text: Beds were hard, check in was horrible, breakfast was fair, elevators were old and slow, hotel is extremely small. We selected this hotel because of the location, familiarity with the brand, Hilton Honors members and good online price.

title: Great place to stay.
text: As far as the staff and room are concerned this place is excellent. The free wifi internet access was good to have. Many restaurants nearby to choose from, close to train and bus stops. Times Square and many other tourist sites are walking distance.

title: Enjoyed this hotel
text:
Near Herald Square and the Empire State Building. It is also within walking distance of Penn Station. We left JFK, hopped on the airtrain, meeting the Long Island RR and were there in a flash. Weekend rates on the LIRR are better with a CityTicket, about half the regular fare. 
The hotel was clean and roomier than other hotels we've tried in the City. Great breakfast selection (included), too. Close to many subway stops. Quiet too

title: Lives up to the Hampton Inn brand.
text: Conveniently located downtown hotel that's only a15 minute walk from Penn Station. Small but clean rooms delivering that consistent Hampton Inn feel. I would stay there again on future business trips.

title: Worth a visit
text:
Little gem of a place. 
Friendly helpful staff. The lifts are quick but can sometimes be a wait to get in them.
Breakfast is fine and gives you a good start to the day without leaving the hotel. Coffee is available 24/7 and is good quality.
Room wasn't particularly big but big enough for 2 of us. Air con was excellent as was the wifi.
We had asked for a room with Empire view many months before travelling and that's exactly what we received. 
The bed was huge and bathroom was very clean. Room was serviced every day.
30 yards to the nearest subway meant getting around was easy. The hotel is very close to Macy's and of course the Empire state building.
Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to visit Manhattan.

title: someone had a key to my room, opened door at night
text: I stayed at this hotel last Sunday night. After I went to sleep, someone opened my hotel room door.  I had the security lock on so all I saw was a band of light around the door and heard a man's voice. I called out and they went away. I got up and closed the door and reset the lower lock, which the key had opened. I went to call the front desk when I heard the person at the door again, so I asked loudly who it was and they left. The floors have only 7 or 8 rooms clustered around the elevators. I called the front desk staff person, who said she'd "call the engineer" and call me back. I waited ten minutes and called again.  She said she hadn't heard back from the engineer. Ten minutes later I called again and they said they'd re-key the door, which they did. By the next day, the hotel claimed no one had used a key on my room at that time. They said they had a "report" that showed that but it's now six days later and they still won't send the "report."  The manager has made it clear they "admit no guilt" and acts like I'm making it up.  I stay in a lot of hotels and have never had this happen before, although I've heard people fumble at the door and then realize they have the wrong room.  But to have the door opened was truly scary. The delay when I called down Sunday night and the delay since then show a remarkable lack of concern.

title: Excellent location
text:
The room was comfortable, the breakfast service offers a wide range of options and location is key.   Good amenities. Staff friendly. Reasonable price considering how expensive New York is. 
 A very clean hotel. 
I would definitely stay again.

title: location is the key
text: The hotel is in a great location. I've stayed here a few times. The city is expensive, the cost of the hotel does not reflect the amenities but you do get breakfast which is a definite plus in NYC. The staff was great, cheery and helpful all around. Hopefully they will remodel. It's clean but aged.

title: Super gelegen und sehr freundlich
text: Ein sehr schön gelegenes Hotel, nicht so riesig mit sehr freundlichem und vor allem hilfsbereitem Personal! Frühstück ist ausreichend, frisches Obst, Kaffee und Limonaden zu jeder Tages-und Nachtzeit verfügbar! Freies WLAN im gesamten Hotel, saubere Zimmer und (teilweise) ein traumhafter Ausblick auf das Empire State Building und Macys! Subway in wenigen Minuten erreichbar! Wenn nochmal New York, dann auf jeden Fall dieses Hotel!

title: surprisingly nice
text:
I chose this hotel for its proximity to Penn Station, and its price (the weekend we were in NYC it was one of the least expensive Hilton-brand hotels). When we pulled up outside I was momentarily disappointed--the Hilton Garden Inn next door looked shinier and more inviting. 
But once we were checked in, our room was really lovely, not too small, and even had a surprise view of the Empire State Building (so lovely at night!).
The furnishings and amenities were up to date--lots of charging options, nice furniture, clean and modern. There was a small safe as well.
I'm used to having a mini-fridge in a Hampton Inn room, the lack of a fridge was the only unpleasant surprise.
The staff was super helpful and friendly, something I have not always found in NYC hotels. 
We stayed on the street side, and even on the 13th floor it was a little bit noisy on the weekend (from street noise--it's a very busy neighborhood) but it would not stop me from staying here again.If noise bothers you you might ask for a quieter part of the hotel.

title: Optimale Lage, sehr guter Service
text:
Direkt an einer Subway-Station im Herzen von Manhattan - Lage ideal!
Die Zimmer modern und sauber. Für die zentrale Lage relativ ruhig (unser Zimmer war auf der Rückseite). Zum Frühstück leider nur Einweg-Geschirr (Plastik/Pappe)

title: Muy buena opción en Midtown
text:
Excelente ubicación para visitar NYC. Tiene estación de metro a 1 minuto para poder moverse por toda la ciudad. Por su ubicación tambien permite llegar andando a los lugares más turísticos (A 5 minutos de Empire State, 10-15 min de Times Square, Top of the Rock...). 
En cuanto a la habitación, en nuestro caso eramos 4 (2 adultos + 2 niños) y resultó un poco justa. Camas correctas, baño limpio y reformado. Tema a mejorar, el mobiliario: No cuesta nada poner unas estanterías en el único armario que hay para poder guardar la ropa y no tener que guardarla en las maletas durante la estancia. La habitación reservada era con vistas, y no defraudó la vista nocturna del ESB.
Desayuno correcto, tal vez a mejorar la variedad y el espacio y la temperatura del comedor. 
El personal muy amable y servicial que resolvieron cualquier duda.
Precio razonable para ser NYC.
En definitiva, si bien hay algunos asuntos a mejorar, es una buena elección para pasar unos días en NYC

title: Great Stay on West 35th
text: Location, location, location, was great. The staff was on-point. The guy that managed the breakfast area was outstanding. The hotel was clean, no smell, and had little amenities that added a personal touch. I would go back there in a City of New York minute.

title: Viaggio
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel a New York per 6 giorni , punto strategico per visitare Manhattan , metro vicinissima hotel carino pulito io avevo una stanza molto grande con un letto king comodissimo anche il bagno grande ma nn ha niente per appoggiare i teli ,spazzolini etc cambio asciugamani tutti i giorni , unica e grande pecca la colazione pessima due tipi di dolcetti confezionati immangiabili solo uova sode  o strapazzate macedonia e yogurt basta peccato perché sicuramente nn tornerò in questo hotel

title: September 2019 Stay
text: Quite a good experience at this hotel. Nothing to complain about except the complimentary Breakfast was a bit average. although the rooms were a little on the small side, they were clean, the bed was comfortable and had everything that i needed. I was out most of the day so that wasn't really an issue.

title: Pratico, servico impedavel e bem localizado
text: Esse hotel è fantastico. Ja ficamos algumas vezes. Do lado do empire building, da quinta avenida, da macys. E o servico è fabuloso. O cafe è otimo, dificil de achar em manhatan e muito pratico pois è perto de tudo

title: Vacaciones
text: Excelente opción para NYC!! Muy cerca del Empire State, Macys, JCPenny, Target, H&M, Uniqlo etcétera!! Cerca del Subterráneo!! En pleno Korea Town! Muchos Pubs y bares cercanos!! Fue una excelente experiencia. Los conserjes muy amables y siempre hay alguien que habla español sino sabes hablar inglés!!

title: Comfortable, basic hotel with great location
text:
Stayed 5 nights. Location is great - steps away from Herald Square and metro station.
Rooms are small (not surprising for Manhattan), but clean and comfortable. Air conditioning was too strong - felt like ice storm, so had to turn it off for the night.
The shared spaces (corridors, staircases) are not so clean though, I do not understand why.
Breakfast is very basic - toast, some cheese, cold cuts and some hot items (eggs or omelette)  - usual paper plates and cups - bit odd with European eyes. 
There are only 2 elevators, also used by hotel staff - sometimes need to wait a lot for the lift - often chose rather to walk down from 7 th floor after endless waiting.
Receptionists are efficient and friendly.

In sum goodbstay for the price - the clean and comfortable rooms and the excellent location make Hampton Inn a reasonable choice in Manhattan.

title: Comfortable Hotel Near Herald Square
text: The Hampton Inn Manhattan-35th Street provides an outstanding location in Midtown Manhattan along with a comfortable respite at the end of the day. Shopping, eating, accessing the subway or even walking around, this is a fantastic starting place.

title: OTTIMA POSIZIONE MA è STATA UNA DELUSIONE
text:
L'hotel è situato in una posizione spettacolare di fronte l'empire e vicinissimo a Time Square. L'unica nota positiva è la posizione.
Stanza piccolissima abbiamo fatto fatica ad aprire i bagagli , il bagno ancora più piccolo. La colazione compresa era praticamente inesistente, per i bambini c'erano dei biscotti che però dovevi chiedere espressamente al cameriere che li andava a prendere in una stanza. Per quanto riguarda gli ascensori .un'altra nota dolente. Per scendere la mattina ci volevano 20 minuti . Due ascensori sono insufficenti in più venivano uscati dalla manutenzione e quindi era praticamente impossibile usarli. Sinceramente mi aspettavo molto meglio ,non consiglierei questo hotel.

title: Delusione
text: Quarto soggiorno presso questo hotel di New York,e non ci saremmo mai aspettati di trovarci in una situazione come quella che stiamo vivendo... arrivati con un giorno di ritardo per un problema con l’aereo,abbiamo deciso di prolungare di un giorno la vacanza sicuri di poter contare sulla professionalità di questa catena di alberghi,ma ahimè non solo non hanno minimamente accennato al rimborso della notte da noi non goduta,ma ce lo aspettavamo,quanto piuttosto non ci hanno né dato disponibilità per la notte in più,ne’ tantomeno aiutato nel cercare un’alternativa,considerando che siamo con 2 bambini piccoli al seguito.Per fortuna il nostro agente di viaggio ha risolto prenotando in un altro albergo...colazione sovraffollata,personale scostante e decisamente poco disponibile all’ascolto,che piuttosto che farci una prenotazione ci ha invitato a farla da soli su internet... delusione totale.

title: Perfecto para visitar Manhattan
text:
Situado al lado de la Quinta Avenida y de Broadway.
Es un buen hotel para todo aquel que quiere visitar Nueva York
Un hotel donde lo mejor es el personal: Emmanuel del turno de noche  o Yonfi del turno de mañana. Todos están para ayudarte con una sonrisa.
Las chicas de limpieza con también maaravillosas.
La sala de desayunos es muy pequeña para cuando el hotel está lleno y se forman colas y tienen que reponer los artículos habiendo veces que se queda algo un rato sin producto.
Hotel limpio, recomendable. Si vuelvo a Nueva York volveré.

title: A great value in a great location!
text: The staff were helpful, courteous and efficient, the rooms were impeccable, the breakfast was good, the views were as promised, the price was a bargain and the location is great.  I would highly recommend this property.

title: Excelente ubicación, servicio de calidad, desayuno aceptable
text: La calidad de atención siempre es excelente, son marcas en la cuales el personal siempre tiene un estándar de calidad muy bueno y son todos muy amables y correctos. El desayuno bajo un poco la calidad desde la última vez, es aceptable pero hay menos variedad y hay marcas genéricas de productos de desayuno. La limpieza es buena, estuve en verano y había agua con hielo y limón siempre para servirse cuando uno llega al hotel. Se puede usar el sector de desayuno para comer, lo que es muy bueno cuando uno vuelve muy tarde y compra algo en algún local de los alrededores. La ubicación es de lo mejor, a 50 metros del Macys, 1 cuadra de Penn station, y a 5 minutos de Time Square. Suelen permitir late check-out. Lo malo, esta vez no tuve heladera en la habitación, me indicaron que no tiene costo adicional tener una, pero que ahora hay que pedirla cuando se hace la reserva o al hacer el checkin.

title: EXCLENTE MESMO
text: bem localizado, bom café da manhã com opções . Os móveis do quarto precisam de substituição e quando estávamos hospedados vimos chegar os móveis novos, de forma que estão atualizando o hotel. Já ficamos hospedados outras vezes e o custo benefício é muito bom: METRO na porta, localização, tamanho do quarto (mesmo sendo em NYC é muito bom) e principalmente o atendimento do front desk. Destaque muito positivo para o Sr. Yonfi. Sou membro do Hilton Honors por estas razões.

title: Nice Overnight Trip
text: This was my first time staying in Manhattan, as I had just won free tickets to a Yankees game.  I've always had good luck with Hampton Inns, so I figured everything would be good.  I can honestly say, I had a great overnight experience at this hotel.  The staff were incredibly friendly and the breakfast attendant did an excellent job keeping everything stocked!  It is true that the rooms are on the small side, but the beds are more than comfy and you are right near Herald Square and the subway.  I would gladly stay here again!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Très bon hotel pour le prix ( vacances en Février ). 
Personnel très adorable et excellent petit déjeuner. 
Très bon emplacement également à peu près 10 minutes à pied de Times Square. 
Les lits sont très agréable je n'ai jamais aussi bien dormi dans un hotel.

title: A few nights in sardine can
text: Welcome to New York! This hotel has some of the greatest staff, all were friendly and polite. The room we had was for 4 people with 2 beds. The room was so small that you could hardly walk around the beds and when we ordered a fridge and microwave the fridge had to go in the bathroom and the microwave on the desk. I love Hampton Inn but sorry this room was just way smaller than acceptable. Luckily we were there only 2 nights before moving to another hotel.

title: Excelente
text: Fique neste hotel por 06 noites, eu e meu marido adoramos. Localização perfeita há 05 minutos da 6* Avenida, da 7*Avenida, metrô na porta, recepção muito atenciosa, café da manhã o melhor que já tivemos em USA. Muitas variedades, além da aguá, café, chá que ficam a disposição o dia inteiro. O quarto para casal é pequeno mais aconchegante,banheiro grande. Quarto para 03 a 04 pessoas é bem maior. Os qusrtos não tem carpete, mobilha nova, tudo muito limpo, Adoramos, todas as vezes que for a Nova York é neste hotel que vou ficar. !5 minutos á pé da Time Square.

title: Good location
text:
The hotel has a great location; near fifth avenue and the empire state. Many subway stations around and a lot of restaurants and stores.

The services is ok.

The hotel distribution is a little bit caotic, and the smalls corridors to the rooms make you feel claustrophobic.

The breakfast is complete, with cold ald hot selection..

title: Staff is awesome
text:
Our 1st trip to NYC started out terrible with Alaska Airlines loosing our baggage.  We showed up here 7 hours before our check In time on Friday August 2nd.  Kadisha was working the front desk. She was SO HELPFUL to me and my son. She got us a room as soon as possible.  She suggested some places to eat and site see while we were waiting for the room. She kept checking in with us about our lost luggage that was supposed to show up (it showed up 12 hours later).  She was so helpful and went out of her way to assist us where she could. Saturday when we left to site see she stopped what she was  doing and asked us if we had everything we needed. She did the same thing Sunday.  Overall the staff was AWESOME 
Monday we called down for a late check out to be able to site see before our trip home. and YONFI was more that willing to assist us. Upon returning to the hotel he was nothing but the best.  

Rooms are kinda small but again it’s the middle of Manhatten right?  All in all when we return to NYC this is the ONLY PLACE WE WILL STAY!!! 

While we were attending a Yankee game Friday night they called to let us know that our bags had finally shown up. 

Two thumbs up to the staff at Hampton Inn / Empire State Building

title: Friendly and courteous staff
text: The hotel room was clean. The staff went out of their way to assist us.  When our airline cancelled our flights for two days, they were diligent in working with me on our accommodations. The location is near to grand central station and Times Square. Excellent value with breakfast included. The manager Ashley and the entire staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Good stay after a glitchy start.
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn - 35th St NYC for 3 days in Jul 2019. When we checked in on Mon 15-Jul, we checked into room 504, which was very poor quality. The carpet was torn in multiple places exposing the floor, the room barely had space for 3 of us with our suitcases but what put us off completely was the filthy stentch in the room. Later that day, I went and mentioned the issue to the Reception, with a hint that I am a senior reviewer in Tripadvisor - that did the trick and I was moved to room 405 which was much better, but why spoil the experience by giving a dodgy room in the first place!

Leaving aside the check-in experience, my new room (405) was clean and had more space (I know NYC cannot afford space, so was quite happy with the room), the bed and linen was very comfortable, bathroom was small but good enough and well stacked with towels and toileteries. Mini-fridge was on request which we didnt request, owing to the room's space.  

What I loved - The complimentary breakfast was a real blessing as we were always hurrying in the morning for our guided sightseeing tours, the 24X7 fresh coffee and tea & cold water in the breakfast area on offer was just very human thinking by the hotel mgt. The location is just perfect, you come out of 34th st- Herald sq subway and the hotel is 15 steps from it. The surrounding places are filled with eating, drinking & shopping options, so that was 5 star for us. Also, Jason (at reception) accepted our request for a late check-out (instead of 11, he moved it to 12, though not much but still thanks for the intent!) which I felt was nice.

Would I visit this Hampton Inn again when I return to NYC? Maybe, maybe not. I had a good experience, but not something which would stop me from exploring other hotels in the area. Also, this is a Hilton group hotel, so Hilton has to do some serious quality checks in here.

title: Buen hotel, limpio, buena ubicación, 100% recomendable
text:
Hotel bien ubicado en Herald Square, a pasos del metro del mismo nombre y a un poco más de una cuadra del Empire State.
Buenas habitaciones, muy limpias, desayuno básico, pero lo suficiente para comenzar el día 
Hotel 100% recomendable y con personal amable y atento

title: Birthday Weekend!
text: It was my birthday and I just wanted to have an amazing weekend with my friends. This is my parents favorite hotel, so that is why I booked. I am extremely happy with my choice and I feel that the friendliness of the hotel staff made it worthwhile.

title: Família - apenas uma noite
text:
Adoro essa rede, mas essa unidade foi um caso à parte. Localização boa, próximo da Herald Square é muito comércio. Mas a rua tem muitos lixos que ficam empilhados, a noite descendo da Times Square até o hotel passamos por muito moradores de rua.
Café da manhã apertado , depois das 9hs reze para conseguir rápido um elevador. Solicitei reposição de xampu e estou esperando até agora.

title: Midtown
text: The hotel is in a prime area and good value. The staff is very friendly and helpful well worth considering to reside there. The elevators are the only downside as there are only two so a busy morning regyudea patience

title: Ontario67
text: We were a group of 9. We all enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect to walk to the city sights. I would recommend to my friends and family. The reviews I read before also helped a lot with our decision.

title: Awesome location!
text: Consider the price and breakfast with the location, this is the one of the best choice in NYC. My family enjoyed trip while we were staying here. But the bathroom is quit small and sink top is really tiny.

title: Very nice stay in NYC
text:
First time in NYC and had a great time. The location was perfect for our situation.  We took Amtrak from Chicago to NYC and this is so
close to Penn Station-three blocks.  Close to Time Square, Broadway, and Empire State Building.  The room is not very big, but very clean and comfortable.  The breakfast had a variety each day and it was great to start off with a hot meal in the morning.  The
staff was super friendly and helpful. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

title: Hotel Staff make this hotel special
text: We chose this Hampton Inn because of its location, since we were traveling with friends from Spain.  Close to Empire State Building, Macy's, NYC Subway, etc.  However, little did we realize that it was the hotel staff that made it a memorable stay.  Their hospitality and sensitivity to the needs of the guests was outstanding.  From helping with the complexities of the Subway to suggestions for eating, they were always available and responsive.  In the future this will be the place we stay in NYC.

title: Convenient location but noisy
text: The best thing going for this Hampton Inn is it's location. It is steps away from the subway and major shopping.  Breakfast is also included.  However, there were sirens, construction noise, and honking horns at all hours.  Even at 3 am, we were awakened by horns on the street below.  But that's the price you pay for the location.  Accommodations were acceptable but the staff here were not very friendly.  They seemed overworked.  Never a smile to greet you when you entered or even an acknowledgement that you were present.  We especially enjoyed our previous stay at the Hampton Inn Grand Central location and would recommend that over this one.

title: Decent Hotel
text: Nice clean hotel.  Centrally located.  Very good breakfast.  Friendly and very helpful staff.  The king room was a little bit crowded.  Smooth check in and check out.  Just around the corner from the Empire State Building.  Lots of attractions within an easy walking distance.

title: Zwischenstop in NYC
text: Wir waren auf einer USA Rundreise für 3 Tage in NYC und im Hampton Inn untergebracht. Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral gelegen. Unser Zimmer war recht hellhörig, was das Schlafen schwierig machte. Das Frühstück ist für USA Verhältnisse recht gut, die Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich hilfsbereit.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed here over the 4th of July. Rooms where very new feeling. Front desk and staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was very centrally located for all of our travels. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfecto para dormir y estar cerca del centro
text:
La ubicación del hotel es excelente a sólo 7 minutos de Times square, y en la misma puerta acceso a metro. Nosotros teníamos desayuno incluido, que la verdad no había mucha variación pero estaba muy bien como para poder salir ya comidos del hotel. Beagels, cereales, café, huevos revueltos y leche fría.

La habitación sencilla y baño igual. La cama muy cómoda así que lo agradecimos estilo king size.

title: I love this place!!!
text: This hotel is awesome.  They are so nice and friendly.  It is the perfect location to get anywhere.  I had the best time staying with them.  I just loved, loved, loved it.  When planning your next trip to NYC, you won't be disappointed.

title: Wonderful NYC trip
text: Took my granddaughter (age 9) for her first overnight (2) trip to the Big Apple.  Stayed at the Hampton in Herald Square with an Empire State Building view.  Lovely hotel, no issues whatsoever, and an amazing front desk Manager - Ashley - that I can't thank enough for taking such good care of us.   Was a wonderful experience.

title: Very good hotel.
text: The staff at the front desk were super!  Our room was clean, but very small for four people.  Breakfast was good.  The parking garage is about a block away.  We had to drop the car off and they took it and parked it which made us nervous, but everything turned out okay.  The great thing about this hotel is that they let you drop your bags off in the morning and give you access to the parking garage right away even though you can't officially check in to your room!  We did this around 9:00 and had all day to see the city before we came back to our room.

title: Bessere Lage geht nicht
text: Hervorragende Lage mit Undergroundstation vor der Tür. Saubere, gute Zimmer. Inkludiertes Frühstück entspricht nicht deutschen Erwartungen (keine Wurst, kein Käse (außer Frischkäse)). Freundliche Mitarbeiter,

title: Convenient location. Very polite staff
text: The staff was really professional. It’s NYC so the rooms are a little tight but we had a family of four with 4 suitcases and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean. Comp breakfast was a nice bonus to kick off the morning. Easy access to Subway and  Penn Station. Would stay again.

title: Great location and value
text: Great location for visiting NYC and good value considering NYC prices. Friendly and helpful staff and good breakfast. Would recommend this hotel and stay here again. Rooms were roomier than they appeared on the online photos. Elevators are a little slow and small.

title: Great Staff, Tiny Room, Reservations a Headache
text: Place was clean, but worn. Rooms were about the size of a cracker box. Counter in bathroom was so narrow the faucet was offset to one side because it would not fit behind the sink. Reservations were a hassle. Staff, however, were friendly and helpful. They deserve better.

title: nice place
text:
This is a small hotel, with a very nice and efficient staff, well located in Manhattan.
Some neighours were noisy, bad luck.
Close to subway station and  Empire State Building. Thank you for welcoming me.

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel was great. Very clean and great service. When we checked in I requested a room with a spectacular view and front desk person (I forgot her name, sorry) easily found one. All employees were very nice and helpful. The only thing is rooms are small and hotel is a few blocks from main Times Square area.

title: Great Location and Excellent Staff
text: This is a great location to stay in NY City. You can walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building. Lots of restaurants in the area. The staff is super nice too. The subway station is just a few meters from the entrance of the hotel.

title: Overall a good expereince
text:
Excellent location -steps to subway, shopping and restaurants.
Helpful staff.Good breakfast variety.Clean rooms and house keeping.
Only negative is lack of good shower and water flow  and inconsistent hot water .

title: New York
text: Great location, clean property, nice amenities, friendly helpful very competent staff. Our week in New York was great and this choice of hotel made it even better! Will stay again when I return to New York

title: Family 3 day trip to NYC
text: Great family stay. Easy access to subway from hotel. Easy walk to Empire State and Times Square. Reception staff were amazing. Held our luggage. Very helpful throughout the stay. Great job staff they are the best.

title: Broadway show weekend trip
text: Stayed 1 night in this hotel with a friend for a Broadway show.  Walking distance from Penn Station and Times Square therefore, very convenient location.  Decent room size and very comfortable beds!  I would stay here again - without a doubt.

title: Flexibility
text:
My flight was diverted to another city due to was and I couldn't get a connection into NY until the next day.  The hotel was contacted and I was told top bad, they have  24 hour cancellation policy and was billed $450 for a room I couldn't use.  I will never use this hotel in the future and would recommend advising against it due to its rigid cancellation polocies.

Unfortunately there are no NA's for the ratings.  I have no data point because I wasn't able to stay there.

title: Excellent location
text: Best thing about the hotel is the location, this hotel is located near the Empire State building and also Penn Station. It is close enough to walk everywhere but in a quieter location for the night time. Hotel room was a bit dated but good for the price you pay.

title: Excellent location
text: Hotel was in excellent location to everything. We walked to ground zero, Times Square and Central Park with no problems. Lots of good restaurants nearby. One block from Empire State Building. Next to Bryant park which had fun activities every night.

title: Great location, basic breakfeast
text:
We stayed here 10nights.
Location 5/5, So close to everything but still in a place that aint awfully crowded.
Staff+housekeeping 5/5, very friendly staff, very clean rooms. Excellent job by housekeepers!
The room 3/5, small, outdated, no hand shower, air conditioning worked great, but air didn't changed at all inside the room.
Breakfeast 2/5, very very basic breakfeast, with very little choises. Coffee, juice and fruits were often out. Awful amount of waste by those disposable trays, plates, forks, plates etc.
Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Gute Lage
text: Sauberes kleines aber sehr gutes Hotel. Lage ist Top. Nähe Times squere und Metro. Reichhaltiges Frühstück. Hilfsbereites Personal und ruhige Zimmer. Immer gerne wieder.. Zimmer waren recht gross. Preis Leistung stimmt für New York

title: Familia de Los Ángeles CA.
text: Bonito hotel con excelente atención al cliente en especial la señorita Sandra que nos estuvo ayudando en las direcciones de las atracciones que visitamos y a entender las rutas del metro, las habitaciones están limpias y muy bueno el desayuno buffet que tienen.

title: Small rooms, old worn furmiture, unconfortable
text: Small rooms, old worn furmiture, unconfortable, never Hilton quality, very disapointed, but well place, just walking distance to time square, to bradway ans most touristic places, the rooms have never the quality of the price!

title: Nice, amazingly quiet room at a good (for NYC) price
text: Possibly the quietest room I ever had in NYC.  Nice people at desk, room in good condition.  A couple of nits: no service elevator (and only 2 total) makes it difficult when housekeeping is hard at work, and one morning some repair work somewhere near me was pretty noisy at 7 am.  Maybe wait a little later.  But great location, especially if arriving or leaving from Penn Station.  Recommmended.

title: Good deal and the view of Empire State Building
text:
We are staying here for 3 nights and the location is perfect for sightseeing.  It’s walking distance to many places such as subway station, Times Square, Bryant Park, Empire State Building and Macy’s.  

The room is spacious for New York.  We have 2 double beds.  The breakfast is the same as other Hampton Inn hotels and free.  The lobby has free coffee, lemonade and water all day.

title: Excellent Hotel, friendly welcoming and great location
text: This is my 4th time at this hotel. Welcoming was really nice as usual. The staff are always friendly. This time, Sandra helped me, there was something wrong with my reservation and she figured it out. She also made me informed about Hilton honors. I am so happy to stay here. The rooms are really clean and good. The hotel’s complimentaries are really good. They maybe seem to be small details but make guests feel like as if we are in the family.  The hotel’s location is really good. Families, friends, students, women who travel alone etc can definetely choose to stay. Anyone who is looking for a comfortable stay, literally, needs to choose this hotel. I do not search hotel in Manhattan. I just make a reservation at this hotel. Before I found this hotel, I had bad experineces in other hotels. I believe, when comparing the price and the performance of it, I am sure most people will have the similar thoughts. My good thoughts come from the good impressions on me of good staff, especially Sandra from the front desk and Louis from the breakfast area. However, I honestly shared my feelings. Hopefully everyones enjoys it like me.

title: Excellent room and staff.
text: All staff were friendly and efficient. The room was excellent- clean and comfortable and spacious for Manhattan at this price. I find Hampton Inn breakfasts ok, not great, but consistently ok. The coffee is not bad and good bagels. More important is the room, price, location and staff and all of those were excellent.

title: Never again
text:
Oof, where do I start here?

I booked this hotel based on good reviews from Expedia and TripAdvisor. I think I failed to read into the fact that most of those reviews were something along the lines of "decent place to sleep, didn't spend too much time here." Well, I didn't either but I somehow wish I spent less time here.

Starting off, check-in is at 3 but it took close to an hour because they had one person at the front desk and a million kids on a high school trip and a few other families. There were other employees floating around and occasionally someone manning the Hilton Honors station but not for long.

Basically - our room wasn't ready so they had to find another. Fine. We get a room on the 17th floor. First thing I notice after traveling all day - THE TOILET DOESN'T WORK! Fantastic, I just need to pee and I need to leave for my event anyway, so I figured I'd deal with it later. 

I come back later that night to tell the front desk about the toilet and they send someone up. Now the maintenance people are some of the nicest people I've dealt with throughout this whole thing. But it took an HOUR AND A HALF of my time at midnight to fix this thing. And once it was fix, their tools left a weird black ring in the toilet. They told me someone at the front desk was documenting this all and someone would come in to clean or paint the inside of the toilet because of the black marks. 

Well. No one did. No one even mentioned it to us or called up to our room. It was like that the whole weekend.

Next up, the "breakfast." I legit thought the omelette was in a tortilla because of how hard the outside of the egg was. So, I think you can kind of gather your thoughts on how the rest of the breakfast fare is.

To top it all off, one night our keycard wasn't working. My husband went down to the front desk to inform them and the girl needed an ID. Okay.... we have the keycard right here. We're tired. We've been here for 2 days and you've seen us. But you need my ID. Okay. I'm waiting for him on the 17th floor, desperately trying this keycard and he comes back asking for his ID. So, he goes back down there and the other employee doesn't ask for his ID AT ALL and hands him a keycard. Okay, thank you but why couldn't you just have done this in the first place?

Oh and all those reviews about it just being a decent place to sleep? It's not. The room is either too hot or unbearably cold no matter what you set the temperature to. The blankets are scratchy and stiff. I even asked for more when the room was too cold and they came up with the most ragged and scratchy blankets I have ever used in my life. It's also just the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept on with pillows that just immediately flatten when you use them.

We left a night early. I'd rather have a long drive back than have to spend another night in this hotel. After telling the front desk our story, they offered $50 off. FIFTY DOLLARS. WHAT A JOKE! We didn't want to argue that because we wanted to get out of that hotel as fast as we could. But they must be kidding when they offered that. They really, really, REALLY don't care about who stays at their hotel.

My advice, don't stay here. A hostel would be better. A garbage chute would be better. The pile of trash outside the building is more comfortable than the bed. The only good thing is the location but with another hotel literally next door and a thousand more in the city, don't stay here. Don't even consider it.

title: unfassbare Empathielosigkeit nach dem auschecken
text: Ich war ich mit meinem schwerbehinderten Sohn Gast im Hampton Inn. Der letzte Tag dort war derart vernichtend, dass wir immer noch entsetzt und fassungslos sind. Am Abreisetag bat ich um 11.00 h den dortigen Rezeptionisten, uns für 18.00 h ein Rollstuhltaxi zu bestellen, da unser Abflug für 22.00 h vom JFK geplant war. Der Rezeptionist stellte nach einem Telefonat fest, dass das Vertragstaxiunternehmen des Hotels keine "Wheelchair Taxen" betreibt, versprach jedoch, uns um 18.00 h ein gelbes Rollstuhltaxi zu besorgen, dies sei kein Problem. Als es um 18.00 h unwetterartig regnete, bestellten uns die zwei dann anwesenden Rezeptionistinnen zwar ein Taxi, als dieses um 18.30 h erschien stellten wir aber entsetzt fest, dass dies ein normales Taxi war, ohne Rollstuhltransportmöglichkeit. Anschließend weigerten sich die beiden Frauen, uns ein Rollstuhltaxi eines anderen Unternehmens zu besorgen, angeblich, weil man keine Telefonnummer habe. Bis ca. 19.00 h sprach ich, inzwischen völlig durchnässt, ca. 20 am Hotel vorbeifahrende Taxifahrer  vergeblich an, leider waren alle besetzt. Inzwischen befürchteten wir, den Flug zu verpassen und flehten die Rezeptionisstinnen regelrecht an, uns doch bitte ein gelbes Rollstuhltaxi zu organisieren. Man blieb jedoch  stur und weigerte sich, auch nur irgendein Telefonat diesbezüglich zu führen. Letztendlich haben wir es der Hilfe des Managers vom Nachbarhotel zu verdanken, dass wir unseren Flug nicht verpassten. Deshalb: Hampton Inn nie wieder,

title: Excellent hotel and service
text: The hotel and rooms are clean. The front desk and hotel staff are excellent. Breakfast and breakfast staff were excellent. The only complaint we had was that the pillows were very uncomfortable. Great location, great and friendly hotel.

title: Hay mejores hoteles por el mismo precio
text: Por el mismo precio hay mejores hoteles con ubicación en times square, el desayuno es malo no vale el costo adicional de verdad por el precio se puede acceder a algo mejor en el distrito financiero o en times

title: Great Check In Not So Good Check Out
text: Everything was great until it was time to leave and arrange travel to the airport.  Your staff member suggested that I take the $55 car service that was recommended by your hotel to the airport.  He claimed that it would be $75  if I took another method of transportation so I opted for his suggestion.  Your staff member stressed to me that the $55 was a flat fee which would included all costs including tolls.  Once in the car the driver stated that we needed to take another route because if he took the bridge it would take an hour to get to the airport, this included an additional $10 for the toll. I also had to pay and additional 10% because I was paying with a card.  And at the end of the ride the lowest option presented for a tip was 20%.  Which would have totaled $95 for a 20 minute ride to the airport!  Luckily I found a way to just include a $1 tip which brought my total to $71.  Out of curiosity I looked to find out what Uber would have charged me and it stated $35.00 - $40.00!!!  My check in was a breeze and the housekeeping staff was impeccable but my experience with your suggestion for transportation was horrible. I felt that I was taken advantage of and it left a very bad impression about your establishment and staff.

title: Great Location!
text: This was our first visit to NYC and already want to go back. We would definitely book this hotel again!The location is great for site seeing and roaming all over the city. It’s right next to a subway station but also walking distance to the major tourist areas. We were able to drop off our bags before our room was ready. The room was clean with an amazing view of the empire state building!!

title: Great location but tired property needs major renovation
text: The property needs total gut job and renovation. The linen was dirty the carpet was very worn full of dust in the corners of the room. Curtain was falling did not close. The closet door did not work. Safe deposit box did not close.

title: Great location to stay
text: We enjoyed our stay. The location was great and the people at the front desk were really nice! The hotel is very narrow but it might be expected because of the city. I also thought the price was reasonable.

title: Highly recommend
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over the Memorial Day weekend. It was the perfect central location to both uptown and downtown New York. It was a short walking distance to the subway as well as Times Square and other attractions. The staff was always friendly and accommodating. They will allow you to leave your luggage at the hotel if you arrive before your room is ready. Our departing flight was delayed by several hours. They allowed us to leave our luggage with them after we checked out of the hotel so that we could go to lunch and do a little last minute shopping before departing for the airport. We will definitely stay there during our next visit to NYC.

title: Great Hampton Inn in the Big Abpple
text: The Hampton Inn Manhattan has a super location for exploring NYC.  A short walk from Penn Station and the subway station is right out the door.  They have several tables to sit outside and plan your agenda for the day while soaking up some fun.  The front desk staff is wonderful 24 hours per day.  We stayed Memorial Day weekend don’t he hotel was sold out but staff was so friendly and accomodating.  We stayed in two different rooms and both were very clean and quiet.  The housekeeping manager brought us ice on arrival.  The AAA rates were very reasonable for NYC for the weekend.  I stayed at thei hotel 12 years ago and was happy to return.  You can walk to all the sights and the staff will store your luggage if needed.  This is my go to hotel for visiting the city.  As mentioned in previous reviews the bathrooms are full size and spacious.

title: OK
text: The room  was   located near everything so that was good.  However  when I  got to room and pulled the  sheets back to  check   with the flakes of skin, boogers and stuff I had to get the sheets changed , which they did promptly , still gross though.   The pillows were awful. Staff was  helpful though.

title: Nice break fast and great location.
text:
Proximity to Macy’s and other major Shopping outlets. 24hrs Coffee and Tea Availability.
Great front desk staff and provision for seat out in front Of the Hotel 
No Micro Wave and Fridge in the room. Hotel generally clean !

title: Hôtel Hampton inn
text: Très bon hôtel avec un excellent petit-déjeuner compris dans le prix, personnel très professionnel, idéalement situé pour les visites (à 50m de la station de métro), chambre très correcte avec vue sur Empire States Building pour certaines

title: Hotel needs major update
text:
We stayed here for five nights and were not impressed with the hotel at all.  It is old and needs a major facelift.  There are only two elevators for this 20 story hotel so a lot of time was used in waiting for the elevators.  They are old as well.  The rooms are small but this is NY so it is probably not an anomaly.
The only public bathroom is in the basement and one needs their room card to enter the one room stall.
For the price we paid at this hotel, I would have expected a much nicer environment and better food than the standard Hampton Inn's I have stayed at in the past.  Pretty disappointed.
Our smoke alarm went off the last day we were there and there were multiple attempts to fix the problem.  Since we had a very early flight the next day, we just told them to take the alarm off the wall.  In the need for our safety, of course this is not suggested, but we had to get to sleep.
The staff at the front desk needs to be more welcoming.
The only bright spot is that it's location is down the street from the subway and Herald Square

title: Mother-Daughter Weekend
text: We found this hotel through a booking website. We reserved the room for 2 reason. Location and Price. Neither disappointed. The rooms were clean, the location was wonderful. The subway was at the end of the block. The only thing disappointing about this trip was the weather. Cold and rainy. But we'll be back to Hampton Inn and NYC.

title: Hotel is fine but Manhattan is a mess
text:
The team is very helpful and makes stay very comfortable. The main back draw is that rooms are rather small and it is challenging to manage all your bags during the stay.
Pros:
-helpful team
-close to main attractions
-additional equipment (safe, ironing set but no fridge)
-view from higher rooms

Cons:
-small rooms
-slow lifts
-not enough space in the dining area
-public infrastructure around the hotel slowly decays, but it seems natural for most of the Manhattan

title: Very good experience
text: Friendly and helpful staff, accurate reservation and checkout, excellent complimentary breakfast.  Only complaint is that the rooms were too dark with the low-wattage light bulbs used.  Also, the room was a bit on the small side, but that was not a major issue.

title: prime location
text: This hotel was in perfect location walking distance from Penn Station then walking distance to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Garden.  Front desk staff very friendly and helpful.  Nice breakfast buffet.  Bed comfortable.  No complaints, will stay again.

title: Hampton Inn on 35th Street, Manhattan, New York
text:
We stayed four nights at this Hampton Inn.  
Positives:
* Central location convenient to mid-town Manhattan;
* Good, free breakfast;
* Close to subways for trips throughout the city.
Negatives:
* Check-in took an excessively long time as there was only 1 Hampton staff member to greet and check in guests.
* The reason for the long check-in was Hampden refusing to honor a reservation price for two guests who complained and stormed out of the hotel.  
* For three of our nights, there was no maid service whatsoever.  We had to make our own beds as well as provide our own soap and toiletries.   Considering the cost of this hotel, we found this simply inexcusable. 
* On our floor (9th), there were complaints about noise levels due to parties by some students on the floor.  We did not hear the noise ourselves, but there were others on our floor who complained to management about it.
* If we wanted ice, we were informed that the ice machines were not working.  The hotel referred us to different ice machines on other floors.  It appears the ice machine on our floor has been broken for some time. 
* The air conditioning unit in our room was excessively noisy.  We simply turned it off throughout our stay.  To our knowledge, no windows could be opened for a breath of fresh air. 

Overall value for a New York City hotel:  poor.

title: I got duped at this hotel
text:
I am a Hilton Diamond Member. The way I got treated at this hotel, during my stay here in February, left me with a really bad taste. It actually started out pretty well. I had booked a room with a view of the Empire State Building. You could see the building, but it wasn't what you'd call a view. So, I wanted to see if they could change my room to a lower floor (which I prefer). They were able to accommodate me. The folks at the front desk, also guided me to an amazing camera store. The trouble started when I realized that the room wasn't heating up enough. Weirdly, the air conditioning unit was blowing hot air for sometime and then it was blowing cold air. Now, this might not have been too much of a problem in a larger room, but given that the room I was in was really small (again, not a complaint, that is just how most NYC hotel rooms are) the freezing air was blowing right on my face. 
When I called the front desk, the guy sent up a technician. I tried explaining it to him, but he kept saying everything was okay. Since the hot/cold blowing was only happening every 15-20 minutes, when he was there, it was only hot air and he refused to believe me. He got quite rude and behaved as if I was blaming him personally. So I just asked him to leave. I called the front desk again, to see if they could find me another room. It was close to 10pm and really cold outside and I really didn't want to go to the trouble of moving to another hotel. Also, since I was using NYC as a stopover to catch an international flight in two days, I had a lot of luggage with me. And, I had ordered dinner for two nights. The hotel couldn't find me another room. So, I was compelled to leave, since the cold air had started affecting me by that time. My throat started feeling sore, my head started aching, and there was no point getting sick before a 20+ hour journey. Luckily, I found another hotel at a reasonable price.
I had never expected that I would be charged, especially since Hampton Inn's motto is that they won't charge us if something is wrong and they can't put it right. The front desk guy, again, appeared to be understanding. He even helped with my luggage and offered me points. I requested him to just make sure that I wasn't charged, since it wasn't my fault that I had to leave. He promised to speak with the Manager.
Well, I was charged the full amount for that night. When I reached out to Hilton, they sent me a lame letter saying they couldn't really do anything, since the Manager said there was no issue. Nobody - neither Hilton, nor the Manager - considered, why I had to leave on a freezing night and move to another hotel, if there was no issue. It was a nightmare! What had started as a pleasant stay soon turned into literally the worst hotel experience I've ever had and I spend close to 100 nights a year in hotels. I was disappointed with the hotel, the Hampton Inn and the Hilton brands. This is what I got for being a loyal customer!

title: Εξαιρετικο
text: Το προσωπικό ήταν καταπληκτικό πρόθυμο να σε εξυπηρετήσει . Το δωρεάν πρωινό ήταν ικανοποιητικό είχε ότι πρέπει να έχει ένα πλήρες πρωινό . Το σημείο που βρίσκεται το ξενοδοχείο είναι εξαιρετικό κεντρικότατο με σταθμό μέτρο πολύ κοντά και πολλά μαγαζιά τριγύρω

title: Städtereise
text: Also für New York klasse! Super gelegen und es gibt sogar ein Frühstück, dass echt gut war! Zimmer waren immer sauber und das Personal super freundlich! Ganz klar Empfehlung - war schon dreimal in diesem Hotel....

title: Good value
text: Great value in a great location. Room had everything needed and was clean. Room is small, typical for NYC, might have felt a bit crowded if I wasn’t alone. Cost less than other places and serves a nice breakfast. In easy walking distance to Penn Station.

title: Ireland Scotland
text: Very good service especially from the front desk. Very friendly, helpful and most courteous. Great answering questions and offering suggestions.  Would definitely stay in this hotel again. Good price for the location.

title: Good place to stay - near Times Square
text: This hotel was a very affordable hotel near Times Square but away from the noise of NYC.  Its a great value with free breakfast in a good location in the city.  The people who work there were all very nice and extremely accomodating.

title: Buena estancia
text: Siempre me ha gustado hospedarme en la cadena Hampton Inn cuando voy a NYC, están bien ubicados y de buena calidad. En este caso el hotel de la 35th estaba bien pero con un precio elevado supongo que por la temporada, si requiere de algunas mejoras principalmente en el área de los baños del cuarto y en el aislamiento del sonido. El desayuno es muy básico y siempre hay muchas personas y desorden. Otro punto negativo son los ascensores, solo hay dos y en horas de la mañana hay que esperar hasta 10 minutos para poder subir o bajar. No se si fue un problema de mantenimiento o mala suerte pero el aire acondicionado no enfriaba lo suficiente y era ruidoso. En cuanto a la limpieza de las habitaciones, muy bien e impecable, en recepción fueron muy amables y atentos. Creo que hasta el momento el Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central sigue siendo la mejor opción de los que he visitado.

title: Aufenthalt Ostern 2019
text: Durch die zentrale Lage und der unmittelbaren Nähe zu den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln nur zu empfehlen. Ein weiteres Plus ist das gebotene Frühstück, deshalb kann man den Tag völlig entspannt angehen und muss dazu nicht schon am frühen Morgen bei Regen aus dem Hotel

title: Trés bien
text: L’hôtel est idéalement placé à 1min du métro et à 5min de Times Square. Celui-ci est parfaitement insonorisé. Le personnel était très chaleureux et professionnel. Le seul bémol concerne la salle de restaurant qui est un peu petite et il peut s'avérer difficile pour une famille de 4 personnes de trouver de la place même à 7h du matin. A part cela ce fut un très bon séjour.

title: Great location with helpful and friendly staff
text: The staff at the hotel are really helpful and friendly and the location of the hotel is great - a few steps from a subway station and a few minutes from the Empire State and the Times Square. Would stay here again if we come back to NY!

title: Visita en familia
text: Ubicación inmejorable, lo que no puedes hacer andando lo haces en metro que está en la puerta. Para ser un hotel de nueva York está limpio, el servicio de habitaciones correcto, el desayuno aunque no muy variado está todo bueno, especialmente los gofres. A los niños les ha encantado. El personal que asiste el desayuno encantador y muy serviciales, igual que el personal de recepción, que además casi todos hablan español, especialmente Sandra que te facilita todo, encantadora.

title: Ótima localização!
text:
Fomos em um pequeno grupo de 9 pessoas e ficamos em 3 quartos na última semana e gostamos muito. Ótima localização, pertinho de várias lojas imperdíveis, vários restaurantes e cafés próximos, fácil acesso ao metrô e ônibus. Caminhamos bastante na região do hotel e vários pontos turísticos ficam bem próximos, a uma curta caminhada (Empire State, Times Square, Grand Central, etc). 
Os quartos não são grandes, mas acomodam bem 3-4 pessoas, mas sem muito espaço para guardar as malas, roupas e compras. Café da manhã bom, não muito variado, mas com os itens básicos para nós brasileiros: pães, frutas, sucos, 3 tipos de cereais. Ficamos 1 semana e os pratos quentes variavam (bacon, ovos mexidos, omelete, etc). Uma pena que pratos, copos e talheres sejam todos descartáveis, gerando muito lixo. Cafés, chás e chocolate quente ficam disponíveis 24h na sala de café da manhã e alguns momentos do dia havia cookies na recepção.
Fizemos algumas encomendas pela internet e o hotel recebeu sem cobrança, mas verifique a informação atualizada para o período da sua viagem.
Recomendo a escolha desse hotel e voltaria a me hospedar com certeza.

title: La mejor experiencia que tuve de todos los hoteles en los que me he alojado
text: Realizamos un viaje familiar en donde todos nos encontramos en NyC. Tanto la limpieza, la ubicacion como la atencion del hotel fueron excelentes. Nos tocaron varios dias de lluvia pero la atencion super amable por parte de los empleados del hotel hicieron que nuestras vacaciones fueran inolvidables. Especialmente quiero agradecer a Dominga, quien se encargo de que tuvieramos las habitaciones impecables, tambien quiero agradecer a Juan, Jason, Marie que estuvo siempre bien predispuesta para ayudarnos a preparar la leche para los chicos en el desayuno, Deondre Dixon que estuvo siempre para ayudarnos en cualquier cosa que necesitabamos. Sobre todo quiero agradecerle a Sandra la recepcionista que fue super amable en poner todas las habitaciones cerca y siempre nos recibio con una enorme sonrisa y bien predispuesta a cualquier pedido que teniamos. Luis es otra joyita a destacar, todos los dias nos saludaba en el desayuno y nos preguntaba si necesitabamos algo, interactuaba con los chicos, nos ayudaba a prepararles el desayuno y nos ayudo en absolutamente todo lo que necesitabamos, incluso intercambiamos telefonos para seguir en contacto. Estamos muy conforme con el hotel, pero sobre todo con el personal que es excelente.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: Our family of 4 stayed here during our weeklong trip to NYC. The best thing about this Hampton Inn is the location. The hotel is literally steps from the Herald Square subway station making it super easy to pretty much go anywhere in Manhattan. The staff was very friendly and accommodating (special thanks to Luis, the breakfast attendant).  The rooms are not large by any means, but adequate for a family of 4. The rooms were surprisingly quiet and well-insulated from outside noise. The free breakfast is pretty standard for a Hampton Inn, but it can get crowded in the breakfast area at peak hours. Would definitely stay here again for the convenience and reasonable price for midtown Manhattan.

title: Great location. Great hotel.
text: Comfortable beds and pillows. Great staff. Good breakfast. Teas/ coffees available all day complimentary, plus fresh lemonade and cookies in the afternoon.  Check in and check out we’re both quick and efficient. It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Es la segunda vez que me hospedo en este hotel. Es muy bueno. Buena ubicación. Limpio. Muy buenos servicios. Desayuno abundante y variado. Siempre reponen. Otorgan limonada, café,, té y galletas todo el día. El personal muy amable. Reciben paquetes sin cargo. Guardan las valijas. Lo único que le sumaría es frigobar en la habitación.!

title: Great stay
text:
Everything to make a perfect vacation stay to visit NYC.
A great location a few steps from a main subway station! This is essential if 
A Great team at your service.
It can be noisy on saturday nights, but what to expect in such central location in the city that never sleeps.
We will definitely come back here for our next stay.

title: Hampton Inn Empire State Building - A Great Place to Stay.
text:
We were visiting New York with friends after a road trip around New England. We booked this Hampton because it is centrally located in Manhattan and close to the Empire State Building. It’s a very compact hotel and a lot smaller than the standard Hampton. Our room and bathroom was also very compact with not a lot of room to accommodate our four suitcases. That being said it was adequate and we managed ok. The room and bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was fine with a good stock of toiletries. The breakfast was the usual Hampton breakfast but the breakfast area is also compact for the size of the hotel and as a result gets very busy in the morning. We did manage to get breakfast and we enjoyed it. Our room was located on a high floor and at the rear of the hotel so we looked onto the back of buildings and office blocks. I guess no matter where you are located in the Hotel, you are going to be looking over onto adjacent buildings. 

The massive plus for this hotel is that it is centrally located in Manhattan to walk either north or south. It’s also in walking distance of Times Square and Grand Central Station. The cost of the Hotel is also very competitive considering you get a free breakfast. 
The staff were very friendly and accommodating and kindly organised us a limo to take us to Brooklyn cruise terminal to get our ship back home. The staff worked very hard to please us.

We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

title: The best place to stay in "the city that never sleeps!"
text:
This hotel is conveniently located close to many of the popular tourist spots, and half a block from a Metro. The staff was very pleasant, helpful and accommodating. Housekeeping was efficient and common areas were kept clean. Although the room was small, it was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good; we slept in a couple of mornings and the staff gave us 'breakfast bags.' Bottled water was provided when asked for, and coffee, tea, and hot chocolate were available all hours. During the day, there was a cool 'lemonade stand.' And late afternoon... fresh baked chocolate chip cookies! We stayed 4 nights, and 5 days; on the last day, the staff stored our luggage after check-out so we could spend the day out. Our flight did not leave until 10:00 pm, so this was very much appreciated. The hotel offered a car to the airport; it was not cheap, but well worth the price. I highly recommend this hotel, and intend to stay there on our next visit to NYC in October!    
Sign up for Hilton Honors for rewards, discounts and benefits!

title: My daughter 16th birthday trip
text: Friendly staff and helpful,good variety for breakfast,clean rooms with 2 double beds,hairdryer,cleaned every day. Our room look into the Empire State Building which was a 5mins walk. And a 10-15min walk up to Times Square,top of the rock and  Lots of shops/restaurants on the way up. The hotel is between 5th Avenue & 6th. I really enjoyed the time we spent here.

title: Posizione spettacolare
text:
Ottima la posizione dell’hotel, a due passi dall’Empire State building. Staff cortese e disponibile, abbiamo avuto un problema con la cassaforte e hanno mandato qualcuno a risolvere dopo neanche 5 minuti dalla mia telefonata in reception. Colazione buona ma non particolarmente entusiasmante. Ottima la possibilità di potersi fare un caffè o un the caldo h24. 
Nonostante non lo avessimo chiesto (le camere con vista richiedono un sovrapprezzo) dalla nostra stanza al terzo piano era possibile vedere l’empire. 
Fermata della metro Herald Square a due passi dall’hotel. Posizione eccellente. 
Tasto veramente dolente: gli ascensori. In orari di punta l’attesa ha superato anche i 15 minuti. Camere pulite, letti e cuscini molto comodi. Certo 200$ a notte non è proprio un regalo, ma data la posizione alcune piccole mancanze possono essere perdonate.

title: Posizione...top!
text: Hotel in una zona strategica di NYC, a pochi metri dalla quinta strada, stanza pulita con vista Empire State Building, letto molto comodo, gran parte delle attrazioni nelle vicinanze e raggiungibili comodamente a piedi, Metropolitana a pochi metri per spostarsi in tutta la città. Colazione che potrebbe essere migliorata, ma comunque molto ricca per affrontare la mattinata di tour turistico. Hotel non economico, ma le comodità hanno un costo. Consigliatissimo!

title: THE perfect spot for the Subway & so much more!
text:
Stayed here for the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Induction and the Subway is literally 200-300 ft from the main entrance AND that station is a local hub for all the trains.

We went all over the city, at all hours of the night and always felt safe.

So many pubs and restaurants nearby too. I suggest tge Liberty NYC and Monarch Rooftop, both on the same block, for a drink.

Our room the first night faced the street and was just too loud for us so they graciously changed us to a room on the 9th floor, in the back.  If you like quiet, ask for a room in the back when booking.

We also loved the hot coffee 24/7 and the complimentary breakfast was a plus.

There are no bells abd whistles, so this was all about access to all that NYC has to offer.

Also, just around the corner is a place called “Toast Cafe” and they have a 24 hour food buffet for takeout and cold beer/wine.

We will definately stay here again.

title: Wonderful stay, great location!
text: I came to NYC for 3 nights with my 13yr old son. This hotel didn’t break the bank and exceeded my expectations. It was clean, perfectly located, and the staff were so pleasant and helpful. The coffee bar and afternoon cookies were an added bonus. The morning breakfast was convenient and not overly crowded if you go early. We stayed up on the 11th floor and it was very quiet- no guest or street noises. We easily walked to Empire State bldg, Madison Sq Garden, and Times Square. We are big walkers so even walked down to Chinatown. If walking is not your thing, the Subway is so close and we used it several times. The location is truly perfect though. I highly recommend and will be booking it again when we come back.

title: Tolles Hotel mit sehr guter Lage
text: Ein sauberes Hotel an sehr guter Lage mit feinem Frühstück. Auch die U-Bahnstation(en) und Einkaufsmöglichkeiten jeglicher Art sind in unmittelbarer Nähe. Das Personal ist freundlich und zuvorkommend.

title: Great Location, Rooms need Updating
text: This hotel has an excellent location. Very close to Herald Square and Empire State Building and walking distance to Times Square. While the rooms are clean, they are in desperate need of a update.  Complimentary breakfast has pretty good selection of both hot and cold offerings and is convenient and easy. Fairly good rates for Midtown location.

title: Great price and location
text: This property is the perfect distance from Madison Square Garden if taking the train - it offers unique access to the surrounding food, fun, and activities! 10/10 would go back! If you are looking for a location in the city look no further!

title: Great hotel and great location
text: We have stayed here about 4 different times now and love this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is clean and the breakfast is very good. The hotel is literally steps from the 34th Street-Herald Sq metro stop. It is also a very short walk from Penn Station. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. Great hotel!

title: Bon hôtel mais aïe la clim !
text:
Emplacement idéal pour tout départ en métro 
Hôtel bien insonorisé 
Petit déjeuner nettement amélioré depuis un précédent passage en mai 2018
Par contre gros problème avec la clim qui passe du froid au chaud sans prévenir et est très bruyante ! Je suis rentrée malade ! C’est dommage car à part cela c’est un excellent rapport qualité prix

title: Beautiful location
text:
The room was small but comfortable for two adults and one teenager, the room was clean they had continental breakfast every morning the location was great 
We really enjoyed our stay here 
We got a view to the Empire State Building 👍🏻👍🏻

title: Excelente
text:
Es la segunda vez que me alojo en este hotel y una vez debo destacar la excelente atención de los empleados del mismo . El desayuno muy bueno y variado 
Como ya lo he echo los seguiré recomendando Gracias

title: Excelente
text: Gran ubicación a pasos del metro, a 10 minutos de penn station y cerca de varias atracciones . Muy central para organizar salidas. Personal amable y dispuesto .. desayuno y wifi incluido ... cargos adicionales:solo tax

title: Awesome location and Staff!!!
text:
Great stay. Super professional caring staff. Rooms are small but nicely updated bathrooms-with a Tub-Yay! Inexpensive for where you are. Made my work week more bearable:)
Can not beat location.....I will be back for sure.

title: Spring Break in FREEZING but WONDERFUL NYC
text:
We stayed at Hampton Inn Manhattan-35th & Empire State Bldg for 5 nights in March 2019. It is an EXCELLENT location; about 2 blocks from Penn Station which is at 33/34th streets & 7th/8th Ave (hotel is at 35th & 6th Ave). We took the AirTrain from Newark Liberty airport & transferred to NJ Transit ($13/adult one way fare) & got off at Penn Station & walked to the hotel for about 10 minutes. If you have young kids or lots of luggage you may want to grab a taxi from the Penn Station to the hotel.

There is also a subway station within 10-15 steps from the hotel door that can either directly take you where you need to go or you can easily transfer to another line.

If the weather is too cold or wet, you can just use the underground paths to navigate your way from the subway station by the hotel all the way to the Penn Station (do NOT get on any trains; just navigate the underground maze & follow the signs for the Penn Station. You should come out very close to Penn Station if you get out the correct exit).

Hotel is also walking distance (10-15 minutes) from Times Square/Broadway shows & the Empire State Bldg.

Our room had 2 double beds; for a group of 3 or 4 people the room is a bit tight. But hopefully you are not indoors for too long while visiting NYC.

The mattresses were not as comfortable for me but I also have a bad back. The bathroom sink & toilet did not seem to have been washed on a daily basis; but overall the bathroom was clean.

The complimentary buffet breakfast is absolutely wonderful. They have 2 or 3 different variety of hot items that they rotate throughout the week (western omelette, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, etc.), delicious NY bagels, donuts, muffins, yogurts, fruits, cereal, juices. There should be something even for the pickiest eaters in your group. The ladies that help out in the morning are wonderful; they quickly brought out anything that had run out. The only minor complaint is that (for my taste) the hot breakfast items were not as hot as they should be & the hot water was also not hot enough for making tea.

If you are a Hilton Honors member, book your room online directly through them using the AAA or some other savings program to get the best value.

Pleasant young ladies & gentleman working the front desk. Ask them for maps & the city tour book especially if it is your first time in NYC.

Overall an excellent location, excellent staff & excellent value. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent location, GREAT service!
text:
Great location - everything is within walking distance. Rooms are average size and elevators fast (this is important if you are on a higher floor and there are only two elevators). I gave it 5 stars because of the staff - THE BEST STAFF hands down! Everyone was kind, friendly, courteous and helpful. 
Breakfast is so-so, but it is free and that means a lot in NY. Beds are comfortable and there is plenty of hot water. Rooms are small but this is NY so don't expect executive suites. We had the view of the Empire State Building.

title: Già mi manca !
text:
Ottimo hotel, felicissimi della scelta ! Felicissimi di aver alloggiato qui! Cortesia e disponibilità da parte di tutto lo.staff! 
Stanze grandi e pulite !
Posizione fantastica, ad un passo dalla 5th avenue, 5 min da times square , posto perfetto per qualsiasi destinazione, con la metro a 20 metri ! 
Per iniziare la giornata, niente di meglio che una buona e genuina colazione ( waffle con panna e scaglie di cioccolata 😁 )

Se vuoi un consiglio, non esitare a prenotare ! 

Torneremo sicuramente

title: Family orientated!!!
text: Do not hesitate, book now. Great breakfest for family, and staff is excellent!!! Easily accessible to all the great amenities, rooms and overall appearance is quite modern. Somewhat pricy, but your on vacation...enjoy!!!

title: You stay here for the location, not the hotel itself
text:
This hotel is in a terrific location! Very close to the Empire State Building, Bryant Park, Herald Square, and the subway. It's a short walk to Madison Square Garden and Times Square. As far as a home base for exploring the city, it doesn't get much better than this. But the hotel itself was a bit disappointing, so don't expect to spend much time in your rooms. I was on the 20th floor so street noise was not an issue for me at all, but the hallways are loud with the closing of doors. Rooms are tiny and cramped, with no fridge. Shower curtain had holes in it, closet door was broken, A/C unit was extremely loud. They advertised the room as having a Empire State Building View, which technically it did - you just had to stick your head out and up to see it. Check-in also took a while, despite being a Diamond member.

Again- if you are going to spend all of your time exploring the city, this is a great hotel for that.. but keep your expectations extremely low about the hotel property and rooms.. this is far from a luxurious stay.

title: Muito bom! Ótima localização e café da manhã delicioso
text:
Fiquei no hotel duas vezes: março/2019 e outubro/2010. As duas vezes foram ótimas! Funcionários super atenciosos, quartos limpos, café da manhã super gostoso e localização maravilhosa. 
Fica a no máximo 10 passos do metrô, uma coisa maravilhosa, especialmente se vc resolveu vir do aeroporto do trem. Em dia de neve, nem vale a pena abrir o guarda-chuva, dá pra sair correndo até o hotel mesmo hahaha
O quarto e banheiro são espaçosos e muito limpos. Nessa última vez os itens de banheiro eram todos da Neutrogena, todos de qualidade.
A cama era enorme e super gostosa! Dormi muito bem. O aquecedor funcionou bem, até dava pra esquecer que estava menos 6 graus lá fora.
Tem café e chás disponíveis no hall o dia todo. Nesse carnaval (2019), como estava muitoooooo frio e nevando, eles tbm deixaram chocolate quente disponível, uma delícia.
Se eu voltar para NYC, ficarei por lá novamente com ctza!

title: Hotel correcto
text:
Las habitaciones son un poco chicas pero no molesta cuando estas en un hotel donde te atienden tan agradablemete .
El desayuno es correcto para lo q pagas el alojamiento.
Lo mejor es l atencion de la gente q te da ganas de volver  y la ubicacion .

title: Average At Best
text: I knew this was going to be average when one of the two elevators was out of service.  The rooms were dark and felt rather dated.  The room size was decent by NYC standards.  Front desk staff were welcoming.  Location is not on one of the better streets.  Digital check in is really great.

title: Great value
text:
Next time will get the room with a view, we opted not to. This is a great size for single or couples, there are only two elevators. We use the stairs often, but as we were on a higher level this seemed to only really work going down. It was loud at night sometimes due to the elevator or the electrical shoot which we were near, bring ear plugs. One single king, clean room, view into other people apartments/condos etc, feels like a friends episode but closer. No walking around naked basically.  Morning breakfast, not many choices though, basic oatmeal, cereal, and 2 choices from hot plates only. No bacon the time we were there, I was bummed. Limited for GF person.

After checkout they kept our luggage and all the packages we bought so we could enjoy a few more hours of walking around, how helpful!! I would stay here again, it is not fancy and I am not high maintenance. If you have accessible needs though the rooms are small.  It has potential to be crowded in the room. Distance from the bed to the desk and tv window etc all about 2 feet. The location cannot be beat. So I will take it for the price. Which is why I gave it 4 stars.

title: What you would expect
text: Comfortable lobby, with a great staff experience.  Breakfast was satisfactory, it's a continental breakfast, nothing to write home about.  Rooms are small and tight.  Outdated and at least my room had a ton of wear and tear.  I live outside of the city and like to stay in manhattan with my family for a little staycation.  If you are familiar with the city it's fine, if you need a place to crash for the night it's fine, if you want a memorable nyc vacation ehh.

title: Location was perfect and rooms were always clean!
text: We were in NYC for 9 days. Breakfast was good and the staff was always friendly. The elevators are pretty slow but at least they were available for use! The rooms are slightly bigger than other hotel rooms which is a plus. My only real complaint were the pillows. They were too soft and I couldn’t get comfortable. Heater worked perfectly during the snowstorm.  Thank you for such a great stay!

title: ótima localização e bom café da manhã
text: Gostamos muito de ficar neste hotel pela localização, bem proxima da Times Square e de lojas, como a Macy´s, Uniqlo, etc. Quarto bom, cama confortável, chuveiro bom, café da manhã com opções bacanas. recomendo

title: Great hotel
text: Brilliant location- 30 steps out of hotel and a block from empire state building. We had a room in floor 2 on our first night but asked for a higher floor with a view. Our bags were moved when we were out the next day and we had the most amazing view of Empire State Building,on the top floor. Breakfast is great. Eggs and meat change daily. Free coffee and tea all the time and free hot chocolate at night. Computer in reception for guest use and they have cookies at tea time for guests. Only 3 star but it has everything you need. Our room was quiet also. Couldn't get heating to work quietly but it was warm enough under the thick duvet. Definitely recommend this hotel. All staff were so friendly and helpful too.

title: Friendliest Staff
text: We have stayed at this hotel before as Honors members.  Staff extremely friendly, courteous, helpful, etc. Great location. Very good breakfast options. Just too hot in the rooms - they could turn down the heat

title: Love this place
text: I had yet another great stay at this property in January.  Have stayed here repeatedly over the years and am always happy.  Location is great when arriving or leaving by train.  You can get everywhere on the subway from the Herald Sq location.  Friendly staff. Excellent tv selection.  Right next to delicious 24-hour Korean food.  Rooms are small-ish but not cramped and you don’t come to Manhattan to stay in your room!  Great value to boot, especially off-peak.

title: Detalles
text: Ubicación perfecta.Desayuno incluido que es exelente en NY.El detalle de tener chocolate caliente, galletitas en la tarde para mi fue exelente.Con vista al empire state building. Recibi un paquete y no tuvo costo.

title: Excellenty hotel and excellent location
text: Excellenty hotel, excellent location - it is beside Macy's, 1 block from Penn Station and one block form the Empire State Building. Really please with cleanliness and offered a very good complimentary breakfast

title: Excelente custo/benefício
text:
O hotel fica muito bem localizado, entre a 5ª e 6ª avenida. Na esquina dele tem uma estação de metrô. Há poucos quarteirões do Bryant Park, Biblioteca Pública de NY, uma rua atrás do Empire State, perto do H & M, Macys, Brodway e dá pra ir facilmente a pé para Times Square. Eu fui e voltei de la várias vezes. A localização do hotel facilita demais o deslocamento do turista.
Sobre o hotel em si: Staff muito prestativo. O senhor que cuida do café da manhã é muito atencioso e simpático, recepcionistas sempre dispostos a ajudar. O café da manhã é farto, sempre havendo reposição dos itens. O hotel dispõe de uma mesa com cafe, chocolate quente, chá e água gelada a disposição dos hospedes 24h. A noite eles colocavam chocolate quente com marshmellows pra ajudar a aquecer  no inverno.
