Quarto: cama, travesseiros e cobertos muito bons! Chuveiro com agua bem quentinha, o que é essencial no inverno. 
O aquecedor funciona, mas as vezes faz barulho.
Enfim, tive uma excelente experiência e sem dúvidas indico e voltaria a me hospedar nele. Nota 10!

title: Very Busy Hotel, Room OK
text:
We stayed here over Christmas and wow this hotel was super busy, it was packed.

The room itself was great decent size comfy bed, view to street, well decked out in everything you needed and the location of the hotel is excellent, we stayed here for easy access to Penn Station, and Rock Centre, both very easy walks.

A big Hi to the guys on reception, although it was so busy they always stayed calm and friendly.

The biggest issue was the breakfast , as it was so over full it was really hard to get to the buffet and a seat, Christmas Day was packed.

The lifts are a bit slow, but we were fine as on 2nd floor stairs could be used. Loved the handy side exit.

All in all good value for NYC at Christmas.

title: Séjour Février 2019
text: Hotel idéalement situé juste derrière l'Empire State Building. Proche de tout. Nous avions une chambre avec vue sur l'Empire, le top. Très bon petit déjeuner et très copieux. Chambre faite tout les jours et salle de bain avec baignoire. Internet dans la chambre gratuit avec très bonne connexion. Nous y retournerons les yeux fermés mais en été cette fois!

title: buen hotel, buena ubicación
text: el hotel reune varias características que son importantes, esta muyyy bien ubicado, tiene un excelente desayuno, la atención del personal es excelente . La limpieza muy bien, nos daban champú acondicionador crema para el cuerpo y jabón de neutrogena

title: Too small
text: The rooms are very small with the bare minimum accommodations parking is an extra $75 a night.   We had to drive three blocks away in order to park in the parking garage.. the dark without any security had to  transport all of my luggage and items back to the hotel again in the rain in the dark without security it was very frightening ..

title: Unbeatable location, wonderful service
text:
This hotel is well-known gem, and if it were possible, I would give it more than 5 stars. Location is absolutely unbeatable, with one of the main subway stations less than 50 meters (150 feet) away at Herald Square. Location is so convenient, that most guests are amazed, even if they are returning. It is THAT good. 
Service is fast and friendly. Everyone, from front desk to housekeeping, goes above and beyond to ensure guests are happy. They are always eager to help and carry a positive attitude. Absolutely wonderful. 
And is one of the few hotels in NYC that offers breakfast buffet already included with every night you book. Breakfast varies every day with options for everyone. 
Moreover, they do offer these sweet touches, like free hot chocolate and marshmallows during cold days. Much appreciated when returning from a freezing out-and-about. 
Despite being in a very convenient location, noise from the street is quite low, so you will have a nice night sleep. 
I have been at this hotel 3 times already and is hands-down my choice for NYC. A very special thanks to Luis, Ashley, Edwin and Angela for their wonderful and kind support during our stay. 
Don’t wait any longer and book, as plenty of people have already made this hotel their choice as it offers guests so much value.

title: Excellent stay
text:
My partner and I spent one week in New York in early February 2019 and had an excellent stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan 35th St. 

The location is probably the biggest selling point, and rightfully so. Wedged between the shopping havens of 6th and 5th Avenue, not to mention 30 seconds walk from Macy's, with Broadway & Times Square a 10 minute stroll, a Subway station on the corner of the street, Grand Central Station, the Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Centre, Flatiron Building all a short walk, and the imperious Empire State Building looming over from just one block away. 

The complimentary breakfast is worth the body-dodging in the small buffet area. And the waffle-making machine is definitely worth the queueing to use. You're given the option to have a blowout American breakfast (sugary cereals, bagels/muffins, French toast, potatoes, waffles etc.), or you can keep it light with fruit, yoghurt, or some toast. The only thing missing for me was pancakes - but you're not short of nearby diners where you'll find some (I'd suggest Ellen's Stardust on Broadway, fyi). 

To rattle through some of the other stuff the hotel was great for: 
- Good quality free WiFi
- Nice and clean
- Rooms a perfect size (we had a King) 
- Bed was very comfortable and was massive!
- Heating with thermostat to adjust
- 24/7 complimentary tea, coffee, water, hot chocolate. 
- Good TV channels (particularly if you like US Sports or Seinfeld/Friends)

Last thing I'd like to comment on was the staff. As a Brit, I often forget just how much better the service is in the States. And the Hampton Inn was no exception to that. After a long flight and journey to NYC we were greeted with a smile and staff who really couldn't do enough for you. They were happy to help with any questions we had, and even found us an excellent spot to watch the Super Bowl. On our final day, they were happy to keep hold of all our luggage until we had to leave for the airport, allowing us to spend our final hours exploring the city suitcase-free. Really can't speak highly enough of the staff. 

When (not if) we return to the Big Apple, we will definitely be looking to book the Hampton Inn again.

title: Formidable !!
text: Tout était parfait: de l'accueil aux chambres, le petit déjeuner, etc... Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel et notamment vu son rapport qualité/prix et son emplacement incroyable : 1 rue de l'empire state building, 20m d'une bouche de métro où passent 8 lignes de métro, 10 mns à pied de Times Square !!

title: Pleasant stay
text: This hotel is very well located and the staff friendly. The free breakfast is more than adequate and there is 24hrs coffee on tap. I would definitely stay there again. The rooms are a bit small, but our bed was very comfortable.

title: Great Staff and Stay at Property!
text:
Just returned from a great stay at this property.  Rooms were of high quality in terms of furnishings and cleanliness.  We had a room at the "back" of the property, so we heard no road noise at all, even on a lower level.   Rooms may be small to some, but we found them to be about on average with other Midtown hotels of the same quality.  Heater and hot water both worked fine in our room.

Your staff is exceptional. Super friendly. Love to chat and willing to help out in any way they can.  Have to take a minute to mention Yonfi and Leeben for their great service and personalities.   Every time I saw either of these two, there was a genuine smile on their face.  Others were quick with a welcoming "hello" or "Welcome back".  Breakfast attendant actually looked like he was enjoying his job and kept everything fully stocked and clean.

Ideal "Midtown" location.  Close enough to walk to all the typical "Midtown" tourist spots, but also you have a subway stop less than 30 seconds outside the front door of the hotel and Penn Station is maybe 5 minute walk.   Several restaurants around hotel in two block radius, both local and franchise type places.  

I would not hesitate to book here again. Love the location, the staff, the comfortable and clean rooms.

title: Good location
text: This is a typical Hampton Inn. Maybe a bit more in need of renovation that some others we've stayed at. The breakfast is good. The location is excellent. When we stayed there it was only $79 a night on the weekend. Would stay again.

title: Hampton Inn by Hilton
text: First time staying this Hilton facility.  Room was a little smaller than we're used to.  Room was clean & sufficient; complimentary breakfast was very good; staff helpful & friendly.  Location of this hotel is perfect!  Right in the middle of midtown; easy access to everywhere!

title: Very Happy
text: Check-in and out was quick. The staff were helpful and nice. My room was clean, and the shower water was hot. I have been to the city before, but this was by fair the best hotel room I had. I would definitely recommend!

title: Close to Penn Station and Times Square
text: I chose this hotel because of its location and price.  Room was clean but there was no soap or shampoo, which I didn't notice until it was too late.  Staff was very helpful at check in and I'd stay hear again.

title: Great Hotel with Hampton Hospitality
text:
We love (most) Hilton brand hotels we’ve stayed in. Hampton Inns always seem to too the list though. The staff was warm and friendly. We got into the city early and swung by to drop off our bag, with no issues, they even checked to see if our room was ready (it was before noon, so, not surprising it was not, but we appreciated them checking just in case). When we returned later in the day they greeted us with the famous warm cookies and offered us bottles water as well while we checked in. 

One reason I love Hilton properties is the Hilton App. Using it, I was able to “check in” the day before and select a room. We selected a top floor corner room. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building in one direction, and Macy’s on the other. 

Breakfast was very good. They had waffle machines, which are always a hit with my son and me (although his waffle was a bit more chocolate covered than mine), additionally they had eggs, sausage, fruit, etc. 

Every staff member we ran into was polite and friendly. The only downside of this property might be the street noise, but being NYC, that’s a hard one to fight at any property.

title: Great stay
text: Checked in around 1pm and there was a room available. Yes the rooms are small but my room was spotless Good breakfast selection of eggs, cereal, make your own waffles, yogurt. My room was on the 14th floor and was quiet.

title: Hampton Inn is my go to choice.
text: I love Hampton Inn.  The rooms have always been clean and comfortable, the staff is warm, welcoming and helpful.  The breakfast is great.  The only somewhat negative comment I've made about Hampton Inns (and other hotels) is the lack of opportunity to recycle, and now I cannot even say that.  They had receptacle for recycling in the rooms and the breakfast area.  Unfortunately other guests either did not notice, understand, or want to use them, but at least they try.  Maybe someday everyone will!!!

title: Great location and staff
text: Location was very close to Times Square and MSG. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great restaurant close to hotel and other stores. Great view of Empire State Building. Will stay here again if every in the Manhattan area.

title: Great Experience
text: Arrived early to drop off bags and the manager let us check in early since a room was available. All staff encountered were very friendly. The location of the hotel is great with subway entrance right outside.

title: Perfectly fine.
text: It’s just your average Hampton Inn.   Clean, decent room.  Great location for midtown nyc.  Only issue is the strange layout of the bathroom.   Hard to explain but expect to need extra towels to dry off the floor as the water from the shower gets everywhere.  Overall it’s a fine place to stay on a budget.

title: Bom! Mais tem potencial para ser melhor.
text: Estou um pouco atraso com essa avaliação porém não posso deixar de registrar que o hotel é aspectos maravilhosos, localização, acessos, dimensão do quarto, atendimento, cama, chuveiro, tv e qualidade do café da manhã, simplesmente delicioso. Porém a itens que ficaram devendo, como o sistema de aquecimento faz muito baralho, como passamos a época pós virada do ano novo no hotel, o café da manhã lotado ao extremo, isso porque o espaço para o café na minha opinião não atende a capacidade do hotel, ou seja, a chance de ficar sempre cheio o local é enorme, com espera, podendo sentar separado da sua família, etc.. Enfim não é uma coisa legal ter que esperar e contar com a boa educação dos demais hospedes.  O hotel conta apenas com 2 elevadores, o que para alguns pode gerar uma sensação que demora, a mim não incomodou em nada. Outra detalhe a ressaltar que na área do restaurante fica a disposição café e água quente, chás o dia todo, isso no frio faz diferença, muito legal.

title: Great location to subway system
text: We visited NYC in December and when looking to find a hotel, were most interested in finding a quality hotel that had easy access to multiple subway lines since that was our main mode of transportation. We found that with this hotel. Walk out the front door and turn right and 20 steps later you are walking down to the subway. There are 2 major lines that use this station, the BDFM and the NQRW. We found this to be a very accessible station for all our sightseeing. As for the hotel itself, rooms are typical for NYC. They are small but clean. Ample bathroom space. We stayed on the backside so noise wasn’t an issue. Breakfast was as expected for Hampton Inn, nothing fancy but satisfying. Their is a Duane Reade on the corner that is basically a very large pharmacy but they do have lots of nice food items. Right next to Macy’s. Would definitely stay here again.

title: NYC
text: This hotel was fairly priced for NYC. It is centrally located so you can walk or catch a subway to most attractions. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are quite small but I guess that’s to be expected in NYC. Bonus.... complimentary hot breakfast.

title: Excellent service and location
text: Really nice staff and super location. Will stay here again! Internet worked well and good shower. Clean and nice size rooms. Long wait for the lift, but would stay here again. Specially the duty manager was amazing on check in.

title: Good clean in Manhattan
text: My students and I stayed for two nights in this hotel. While it is not a luxurious place, it is very clean, comfortable, and spacious for NYC standards. The staff was very courteous and accommodating. This Hampton Inn has a good breakfast and free WiFi. The hotel is located only minutes away from Times Square and Penn Station. I would stay here again.

title: Quick trip with the kids
text: Great little hotel! We arrived only to find that our reservation was not correct. (I had called the night before to verify and was told everything was fine.) The reservation was for 2 adults, 2 children but for some reason they showed only 2 adults. They were sold out of rooms that could accommodate us! But Jason worked hard to make it right. He gave us a king room on the top floor with a view of the Empire State Building. My oldest had to sleep on the floor, but he is 20 and didn't mind. They discounted the room for the night which was great. They were able to move us to a bigger room with 2 beds for the second night. The free breakfast was very nice and different each morning. The first morning it was omelettes; the next, it was scrambled eggs and biscuits. All of the other basics of a continental breakfast were provided as well. This was the perfect location for us right in the middle of everything. We visited MoMA and Greenwich Village. We were able to walk everywhere and never used a taxi. We had a great time! The staff was always friendly, helpful and professional. Will stay here again!

title: Perfect
text: All of the staff are extremely professional and very friendly.  We were able to get into our room right away before 3 pm which was nice.  We really appreciated the 24 hour coffee/water/tea service that is set out and maintained that you can enjoy in the breakfast area.  The lobby was cozy with Christmas decorations, chairs, and computers.  We took advantage of storing our luggage in a secure area prior to our departure from the hotel.  The gentleman that checked us in was friendly and efficient as was Luis who maintains the breakfast and lounge area.  The location to NYC attractions was ideal for our stay.

title: Good value and great Mid-town location
text: Great location for trip to Manhattan.  Nice view of Empire State Building, close to Herald Square and Madison Square Garden/ Penn Station.  Breakfast included is always helpful, but especially at Manhattan prices, this was a great benefit to this hotel.

title: Good hotel
text:
I stayed here for a total of six nights.

I was a little hesitant prior to booking as a number of reviews on TripAdvisor had mentioned how small the rooms were and we had three people staying in a twin bed room with three large suitcases! However I shouldn't have hesitated, the room, while not large, was totally acceptable.

When we arrived the hotel reception team couldn't find our reservation (booked through Expedia) however Edwin (Hotel Duty Manager) rectified the situation promptly and professionally.

The room had everything you need including adequate charging ports and a good TV. The bathroom was a good size however I found the shower didn't have the best water pressure. The bed linen and bathroom towels had seen better days and should be replaced in my opinion.

An issue with this hotel is the terrible elevators, you could be waiting sometimes upwards of 5-10 minutes once you pressed the button and once inside it felt like they were moments away from breaking down.

The hotel is in a good location with the entrance to the train station just down the street.

I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on that but I did love the free coffee and tea facilities in the hotel lobby.

Overall, we had a pleasant stay at this hotel and I would stay here in again when visiting New York.

PS: Edwin is a real asset to the hotel, he was very friendly and helpful. Thanks for the great customer service!

title: Excellent location
text: If you’re looking for a place that is located close to main attractions, this is the place. Breakfast: not many options. Overall, we were happy with the hotel, mainly for the location. Take care with the bathroom, may be floated if using too much water.

title: Boa localização, bom atendimento. Excelente café da manhã.
text: Muito bem atendidos tanto no check in  como no check out, funcionários cordiais. quarto limpo, muito bom café da manhã. Perto das grandes lojas de departamento. Recomendável para quem for a Nova York fazer compras.

title: Buena ubicacion, personal amable, excelente desayuno.
text: Lo recomiendo. Muy buena mi estadia.  El desayuno es variado y rico. El personal muy amable. Esta muy bien ubicado sin tener la bulla de una avenida concurrida. Se tiene cafe, agua, chicolate todo el tiempo.

title: Suficiente
text: Bom hotel versus ao valor, boa cama em quartos muito pequenos. Pequeno almoço muito fraco.Excelente localização muito perto da Times Square ao lado do Empire State Building. Serviço limpeza bom mas má reposição de toalhas e produtos. Não recomendo.

title: Confortable & clean, great location
text: After a not so great experience with AirBnB in Queens, we were so happy to move to this clean and private hotel room in the Hampton Inn. Everyone who works there was super friendly and checkin went smoothly. The room didn’t have a great view, but it was a good size and clean with a very comfortable and big bed. The bathroom is nice and modern. You really can’t beat this location in Harold Square - most of Manhattan is in walkable distance with a subway station right down the street, and it’s very close to the Empire State Building. It’s also very nice to have breakfast included which will save you some money in NYC, but expect it to be crowded and to have to queue for food in the morning. There’s also free coffee all day and coffee machines in the rooms. Competitive pricing for a prime location - overall great experience at the Hampton.

title: Great hotel near it all and perfect for families!
text: Highly recommend as it's perfect for families,  clean rooms, excellent breakfast and near it all. Great value too! Everything about our stay during Christmas week was superb even if it was the busiest time of year for tourists. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay
text: I found this hotel to be in a perfect location. My first trip to New York- subway station 30 metres away. The giant Macy’s across the road. The Empire State Building I could see from my window! Plenty of places round to eat and drink. One receptionist on particular helped us with Absolutely every question we had, so friendly- I want to say his name was Otto, he is great at customer service and just generally going the extra mile for customers. One drawback was breakfast, although the food was good the area you eat breakfast and serve yourself is too small for the hotel, get down there around 8 and we could get ourselves a table but 9 was too busy and we had to stand around to wait for one to become free. I would definitely choose to stay here again!

title: Great economical choice for midtown
text: We spent a night here with our two young teens. It was about a fifteen-minute walk from Grand Central. Every single one of the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The check-in staff was patient and pleasant while handling a rush of guests trying to check in or leave bags. Several members of the staff (including maintenance) provided advice and hard info on where to have dinner in the vicinity of the theater we were going to that night fifteen blocks uptown. The breakfast was outstanding—fresh eggs, excellent fruit, good coffee, etc., all managed by an attentive and friendly kitchen manager. We left the kids in the room around 4 pm and went next door to the rooftop bar with fantastic view of the Empire State Building and up 6th Avenue. The hotel is not a super-fancy place, but it's clean and efficient and serves as a fine base for excursions throughout Manhattan.

title: Friendly staff
text: We arrived early morning on 12/20 around 9am but unfortunately they were sold out. We are asked to return around noon and we came back they now have a room ready for us. So thankful for that as we are so very tired. The guys at the front desk were very friendly and presentable! Room was spotless, comfortable and we rested like babies. Breakfast was a plus! Breakfast attendants, housekeepers and engineering staff were very friendly and accomodating! We will definetely return!

title: Great Midtown location
text: Close enough to see Macy's at Herald Square.  One block north of the Empire State Building.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Located on 35th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues.  Cabs don't come through that often on 35th, but are easy to catch on 5th or 6th Avenues.  Would stay here again if I return to Manhattan.

title: New York em 3 dias
text: Saímos de Salt Lake City e chegamos muito cedo no hotel, por volta das 6:30 da manhã. Não foi possível fazer early check in, nem pagando a mais. Foi nos informado que o hotel estava lotado. Deixamos as malas e fomos conhecer NYC. O hotel é muito bem localizado, fica ao lado do Empire State Building e do metrô. O quarto tem tamanho razoável, mas um bom café da manhã. a boa localização nos possibilitou fazer todos os passeios, pois estava perto de tudo. Nova York é um lugar incrível e o hotel proporciona conforto após o dia repleto de descobertas.

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: Great value for the location.  Breakfast much better than other hotels. Staff helpful with transportation from airport to hotel & back. Rooms small but adequate - we didn’t go to NYC to enjoy the room.

title: Visita a New York
text: Personale cortese e disponibile, camere pulite,bagno ampio, posizione eccellente .Buona colazione. Ideale per muoversi in libertà a Manathan.  Empire State building visibile dalle camere.Vivamente consigliato,ottimo rapporto prezzo qualità

title: Our favorite  hotel  in  NYC
text: We have visited  New  York  on several occasions  and  usually  stay in this hotel. The location  is within  easy  walking  distance  to  the  theaters, restaurants, shopping, and Bryant  Park. There is  also a subway station only a few feet away. The hotel is clean, comfortable  and more affordable  than many near Times Square.

title: Good location and value, great staff
text: Nice location close to subway entrance.  Wife liked that Macy’s was so close. Easily walked to TS and RC. Front desk guys were very friendly and accommodating with all requests. Breakfast was good each morning and saves time in order to get out on the streets ahead of the pack. Liked that it met my expectations for a Hampton property.

title: Great hotel
text: Hampton excellence in NYC.  Hotel is less than 1/2 a block from the nearest subway station and across the street from Herald Square and Macy’s.   The rooms were quiet and roomy.  We were very pleased with the staff and accommodations.

title: Family visit
text:
Stayed December 13/16 . Came to town to visit my daughter who lives in The East Village. Great location next to Macy’s. We walked to most of the places we went to (MSG for a Rangers game, Times Square to see Hamilton, Rockefeller center to name a few)
Staff very friendly and helpfull , were upgraded to a room with a view of Empire State Building because of diamond status with Hilton.  We were on the 18th floor and could still hear some traffic noises.
The complementary breakfast had the usual Hampton Inn offerings. Hot chocolate was available in the evening when we returned to the hotel.
I would stay at this hotel again the next time I return to New York.

title: Zentral gelegen, ordentlich und sauber
text: Direkt in unmittelbarer Nähe zur U-Bahn, Empire State Building und Macyˋs gelegen. Die Zimmer sind ordentlich und zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Für einen Kurzaufenthalt mit wenig Gepäck ist das Hotel zu empfehlen. Es gibt leider nur sehr wenig Stauraum für Kleidung. Das Selbstbedienungsfrühstück ist lecker, man kann sich selbst frische Waffeln zubereiten, Kaffee und Tee gibt es zu jeder Tageszeit kostenlos. Die Mitarbeiter sind alle sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

title: Rooms could be cleaner and fresher,
text: Great location for walking around NYC, Easy check-in, My room was on 20 floor,I found the bathroom ok, good shower.but the room smelled stale,not fresh,bedding didnt feel clean I wasnt 100% happy with the cleanliness,it was dusty,carpet was bad,Breakfast was good,Staff are lovely.

title: A brilliant birthday trip
text:
I had planned to come to NY for Thanksgiving and my birthday and also as a treat for my daughter .
I trusted my daughter to book everything as l was super busy and she did a fantastic job in choosing this hotel .
It's situated in a prime location which makes it accessable to the favourite places to visit like Empire State Building,Times Square, Ground Zero, Brooklyn Bridge .
Shopping in Flatbush was great with Macy's, Target,and having lunch in Juniors with a fabulous cheesecake was the best.

The hotel room were of ample size,clean and good sized comfortable beds . The free breakfast was delicious and was different everyday and coffee was nice . Cannot fault the staff,they were friendly, attentive and made our 8 day stay memorable.
I would recommend this hotel what to be near the sights but don't pay extortionate prices 

Hampton Inn is my to to place to stay in NY from now on. 😃

title: Our Old Friend Is Showing Signs of Aging
text:
We've stayed in this location many times over the years.  It has become like an old friend in the City, but like many old friends, at some point you start to notice they are slipping.  This time around, we found a huge tear in the carpet and the bedding, especially the bedspread,was worn.  The sheers in the windows were in bad condition.  There are signs throughout that the place is in need of some refreshing.

The housekeeping and front desk staff are still as wonderful as ever!

title: Good location bad hotel
text: I’m a diamond member and just got very ooor service here with early mandatory check out and asking for extending it was every excuse in book that Hilton always give onwjy they can’t. Marriott always gives me 4 pm late check out no questions asked

title: Excellent Stay - You Won't Regret It!
text: This is my second or third time staying at the Hampton Inn 35th Street and once again, another flawless, comfortable stay in The Big Apple.  Excellent customer service, clean and comfortable room, great water pressure, fast complimentary WiFi, and best of all - right in the middle of Herald Square, in the heart of New York City.  Thank you for a wonderful 3 days in the city that doesn't sleep!

title: Great Place to Stay in NYC
text: I had a super visit in Manhatten while staying at the Hampton Hotel on 35th St.  The location worked out great, as there is a subway station a few feet away, and Macy', the Empire State Building and 5th Ave. are just a block away.  I easily walked to Times Square.  The room was spacious compared to others we used.  The free breakfast was real fine, with fruit, eggs, waffles, etc. and better than average coffee.  The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable.  The TV channel selection was better than at other hotels.  Free WiFi connection worked just fine.  It was a great value.

title: Great location and price
text: The location of this hotel and the friendliness of the staff are the main selling points. Steps from Macy’s and other stores, shopping on 5th Avenue, the subway, and the Empire State Building. The rooms were clean. I was on the 19th floor, in back, and there was a bit of street noise, and I could hear the alarm of the people in the next room, so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Mew, the restaurant a couple doors down, is fabulous and the best place we ate during our trip.

title: Nice stay, in the middle of Midtown Manhattan
text: This Hampton is just steps away from Macy's, and at the edge of Koreatown. Many fun activities within short walking distance. Staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. The room was small, but very comfortable and clean. All in all, a good value for the price. Will stay again in the future!

title: Great location and comfortable stay
text:
Had a great stay here. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the location could not be better. The room - small by US standards - was regular by European standards, so I was quite happy with it. It was also spotlessly clean when I arrived, and it was kept that way during my stay.

The only thing I feel could and should be improved, is the breakfast area. It is cramped and way too small for a hotel with this number of rooms. The staff had also difficulty in keeping the breakfast buffet stocked.

title: Group of people
text:
Checked in on a Saturday with a group of 14 individuals. It was a great clean place located in a great area of Manhattan. Close to Times Square and Empire State Building.  The staff was great very accommodating 
Breakfast each morning which is included in the price of the stay. Will definitely go back in the future.

title: Comfortable Hotel, Helpful Pleasant Staff, Perfect Location
text: This wonderful boutique-sized hotel a couple blocks from Penn Station between 5th and 6th Avenues on 35th Street is just a 5 minute walk from Herald Square and Macy's, on a street with multiple Korean & Irish restaurants, and just a mile or so from Radio City Music Hall, is just right.  Our room with twin comfortable queen beds was ample and suited our needs.  The included full-buffet-breakfast was very well done and did not skimp on variety.  The facility was clean, comfortable, well-staffed, and reasonably priced.  WIFI was also included with good connectivity.  A bar next door called the Monarch boasts the best view of the Empire State Building.  Their boast is not over stated.  The view is spectacular. By the way, this hotel does have Empire State Building view rooms but we opted for a lower level room(4th floor) for speedier elevator access in and out.  Highly recommended.

title: Hampton Inn is consistent
text: I stay here often when in NYC as it is convenient to where I come for my work. I also stay at the Hilton Garden Inn next door and prefer it to the Hampton as I am a breakfast lover which is much better there. All in all, you can't go wrong with either.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Everyone here was super helpful when I needed anything. Room was clean & bed was super comfortable. I was glad that there was breakfast available. The subway was only a few steps away from the hotel, so this was convenient. I felt like I got my money's worth. I would come back here without any hesitation.

title: Great place for Groups of all ages
text: Stayed within walking distance to Empire State Building, Times Square, Penn Station and lots of shopping.Great area with a couple good places to eat.Breakfast is included with the stay.Beds are always comfortable Great area of the city

title: Nice visit
text: Hotel is a good location. Breakfast was nice with plenty of seating. Hotel was clean. Would stay again.  Would have given it 5 stars but our air conditioner was alittle loud in our room Enjoyed our stay.

title: Overnight Trip
text: I always stay at this property because it’s convenient to everything, and there numerous dining establishments nearby. The staff is very nice and professional, and will assist you with any problem or question you may have.

title: Excelente opción
text: Excelente opción en mid-town.Puedes andar a pies a Times Sq. ,Teatros ,PennStation y Gran Central .Tambien tiene casi en el frente del hotel, una estacion de Metro ,para poder desplazarte a todo el resto de la ciudad

title: NYC Marathon Hotel Stay
text: Began and ended my stay at this hotel with professionalism, friendly and helpful front desk.  Comfortable room & amenities.  Many varieties of restaurants close by.  Location of hotel is a very short walk to the transportation heading over to the start line. Perfect hotel for this event.

title: Concert Stay
text: We stayed here after a concert at MSG. It was a perfect location. It was a comfortable, but small room. The service was good and the staff was helpful. Internet wasn't great. It kept telling me it wasn't secure. Other than that stay was fine.

title: No recompense for staff error
text:
I had a reservation to stay one night, Nov 5, 2018, booked on points. Unfortunately I fell sick the week before and cancelled the booking by telephone on November 2. Although I requested an email confirming the cancellation, this was never received and I was not well enough to follow up.

The staff member in question failed to process the cancellation, and 70,000 Hilton Honors points have been deducted from my account. I have spoken to Hilton Honors as well as directly to the hotel to request that the points be returned. However neither the hotel nor Hilton Honors is taking responsibility  for this issue. I have been referred from one to the other.

The same day I cancelled this booking, I also cancelled two others for the same trip. For both of these I received prompt cancellation emails. They were both Hampton Hotels and the record is available for this hotel to see. There would have been no reason to keep the reservation in NYC as the whole trip was cancelled.

I would strongly advise anyone who contacts this hotel by phone with a cancellation, to follow up, repeatedly if necessary, if a written confirmation is not received immediately. It seems that they can get away with this poor service with impunity

title: First visit to NYC, great hotel
text: As mentioned 1st time visiting the city ,hotel is brilliant for price paid , check in was friendly , although a slight problem with original room was sorted swiftly ,our new room had a view of the empire state building so win win.Room was clean and comfortable with safe and tea/coffee maker ,shower was powerful and always hot ,staff were friendly and efficient and always willing to help,the free breakfast was absolutely superb with a different hot offering every day ,tea and water and really nice coffee was available all day ,hotel was close to times Square and Macy's store,would definitely recommend ,could not find any negative points

title: Excelente hotel buen ubicado y atención excelente!!!
text:
El hampton inn Empire se encuentra a 100 m de la av 34 y numerosas tiendas 
También a un paso del metro y cerca de la zona de los teatros, la atención es esmerada y siempre te solucionan todo. 
El desayuno es variado y abundante.

title: Hampton Inn @ Empire State Bldg
text: We stayed for two nights using part payment and points.  Room size is average for NYC standard but is clean and service is great.  Escalator lift is slow and hence can be quite a challenge during peak hours since the hotel occupancy is very high.  Complimentary hot breakfast is good but over crowded during peak hours.  The location is prime but traffic is a big challenge.

title: Perfect located hotel close to Penn Station
text: Perfect located hotel. Small rooms, nice staff and breakfast is included. Free coffee 24/7. If you´re looking for a hotel in Midtown, close to the shopping, Empire State Building and Penn Station this one is perfect for you!

title: Good Standard small Rooms
text: Rooms are very small but NY area is like that, Customer Service was good but room was not ready when arrived. Bathroom lock did not work either, called service but they never went to fix it. We got there around 4:30 pm. You don't really spend a lot of time in the room anyways prices are high depending on dates. Parking is off site $30 per night and our Rental car got a flat tire after been park there for two days which we found very strange. Front staff did tried to help us to get road side assistance from a local tire place but because it was Labour day we had no luck. It turned out to be a very frustrating experience. We were two families with kids and our husbands ended up changing and fixing the tire themselves. I will say from other Hampton Inn previous experiences this was not a good one. We stayed outside in NYC area Hampton Inn in Denville/Rockway area the night before just to sleep and it was better rooms than this downtown location.

title: settimana a NY
text:
Siamo appena rientrati da una settimana a Ny ed abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel.
Posizione favolosa, comodo alla metro ( di fianco all'hotel), assolutamente strategico per ogni spostamento. Personale gentile e disponibile, ambiente familiare. Stanze adeguate e pulite, letto comodissimo.
La colazione potrebbe essere migliorata, ma assolutamente accettabile.Ci ritornerei.

title: Séjour agréable en famille
text: J’ai passé 5 jours agréables en famille et très Satisfait de l’accueil de l’hôtel et très propre et très bien situé proche de l’Empire State Building et très silencieux mais salle pour petit déjeuner trop petite.

title: Agréable séjour en famille
text: J’ai passé 5 jours agréables en famille dans un hôtel très propre et  Satisfait de l’accueil de l’hôtel et très bien situé proche de l’Empire state building et très silencieux main salle pour petit déjeuner trop petite.

title: Perfect spot in NYC
text: Loved everything, from the situation in Midtown, to the lovely bedroom, the comfy bed  and pillows, the whole staff, and the delicious breakfast. Will definitely come back if I have the chance to return to NYC!

title: Trip to NYC
text: We stayed is this hotel during our family trip to NYC. Great location, actually walking distance to many attractions, subway entrance is just steps away, Herald Square just around the corner, also Empire State Building. The room is small but cozy and very confortable beds and pillows. Nice staff, special thanks to Ozzy, Diana and Luis for always being so helpful and nice with the kids.  Breakfast is included and has many options, but it could get crowded. Elevators can get busy too.   The view from our room was Empire State. Highly recommended in midtown.

title: Great budget hotel
text:
Good location and although tired decor was fine for our 4 night stay in NYC. The breakfast buffet from 6-10am was a great start to the day. 
Expedia took our booking for 2 adults and 3 kids but the hotel didn’t even have any rooms for 5 so my son slept in the floor for 4 nights!! Hotel supplied duvets and pillows etc and he didn’t mind but we weren’t happy as we’d paid for 5 of us and could have got a much nicer hotel for the same price if only declared 4people. 
Hotel good but Expedia not!!

title: A nice hotel in a decent location
text: I stayed here on a business trip and I have nothing bad to say about my experience.  The people were friendly, the room was a decent size (especially for New York), and the bed was comfortable.  The hotel is in a decent location next to some pretty good food, and you potentially have a view of the Empire State Building.

title: Just right for NYC visit
text:
Hampton Inn

Was in NYC to do some tourist things!

Quite close to Empire State Building and other tourist activities.

Staff was friendly and helpful. 

Fitness center had weights, cardio machines and more. 

Breakfast had healthy to not so healthy (but tasty) options.

Room was comfortable!

Would stay here again!

title: Excelente opcion
text:
En primer lugar la ubicación es inmejorable. Habitaciones cómodas, buenos amenities. Muy bueno el servicio de desayuno, muy variado, surtido, el ambiente super cómodo, limpio, siempre mesas disponibles y para destacar la amabilidad del Sr Luis. El personal del recepción muy cordial. Te permiten dejar el equipaje en depósito si llegas antes de la hora del check in como al momento del check out sin costo.
Me pareció muy practico y me sorprendió gratamente que durante todo el día esté habilitado el servicio de cafe, té, agua y frutas de cortesía.

Sin dudas volvería!

title: Central location!
text:
This hotel is a great location. It is with in walking distance of Penn station, Empire State building, Herald Square and Grand Central Station if you don’t have them in a bag.

Ruma certainly clean enough and spacious for NYC standards. D. included breakfast is a bonus.

We paid $414 a night in the middle of the week.

title: Great Location for Visiting NYC
text: Great location for visiting NYC.  The subway is just steps away, easy stroll to Time Square, Broadway and other points of interest.  I felt safe walking around day or night.  The price was the best value around and Hampton Inns are always a reliable place to stay.  The room was on the 15th floor with a nice view of the Empire State Building.  Street noise was not a problem, but the elevator was slow at times.  The staff was very helpful, especially Ozzy.

title: Nice Hotel
text: No complaints about the room. A little small but typical Manhatten. The room was very clean including the bathroom.  Very friendly front desk personnel. The complimentary breakfast was above average.  Great location and would probably stay there again

title: Great central location, but too busy for detailed attention
text:
This Hampton is right next to Herald Square and a block from the Empire State Building, a pretty bustling and touristy area in the Garment District. It was very convenient to my client's location, and a great value, so I chose it for this trip. The King bedroom was a pretty good size for NYC, relatively clean and quiet, and you're never far from the elevator or stairs. The Hampton breakfast is standard and the staff working it were friendly. While I thought the room overall was pretty good, the carpeting in the room is in need of replacement (lots of fraying/damage) and the bathroom could use some updating as well. 

All of this is completely acceptable at a busy, not-new Hampton. My main issue is that this hotel is not ready for check-in at 3:00 PM. They can't seem to get the rooms clean and had to offer me a different room than what I had reserved when I arrived nearly two hours later (5:00). This is unacceptable, unless they plan to change their check-in time. They either need more cleaning staff or need to be more upfront with guests.

title: Ok if your not in the room often
text: We came to new york for our honeymoon, the room was very dated but we were never in the room much as we were out all day. There was alot of rubbish bags outside so it smelt bad. The breakfast buffet we had was good and the staff at reception were helpful.

title: Good hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: We choosed this hotel on the basis of central location and it was right choice. There are several metro stations nearby and it was very easy to travel. Few minutes to Times square and other New York attractions. The room was not huge but it was absolutely enough space for two. The breakfast choice was upper than average american standard for this price range. Comlimentary drinks (tea, cofee) are available all day and it is very good option. Wi-FI works perfect in room amd lobby. The rersonell was helpful.Additional bonus - there are a lot of Korean restorants and bars on the same street, one of them is next door actually. Good choice for dinner or evening drink.Certainly come again!

title: LA MEJOR UBICACION DE NUEVA YORK
text: Acabamos de pasar 7 noches en este fantástico hotel y no nos hemos cansado de repetirnos lo buena elección que ha sido. El personal es muy amable ( Ozzi incluso nos ayudó a sacar entradas para un musical y le estamos muy agradecidas) y muchos de los empleados hablan español. La habitación está limpia y es muy cómoda con una enorme cama, la única pega es que estaba cerca de la máquina de hielo que hacía mucho ruido así como los aires acondicionados de los edificios a los que daba la habitación, en la parte de atrás del hotel. El desayuno estaba muy bien (pocos hoteles en Nueva York lo ofrecen por lo que es un punto a tener muy en cuenta) y utilizan platos y cubiertos desechables, como en toda la ciudad. Hay una boca de metro a 50 metros. Volveríamos a alojarnos aquí sin dudarlo.

title: Great location and staff
text: We booked at this location to be close to Madison Square Garden and the hotel was great.  Location was perfect, staff was excellent and the room was very nice.  It is not a fancy hotel but by NYC standards, I think it was an excellent bargain.  We had a king bed in a room facing the front of the building. The ventilation system provided white noise so we never heard street noise on the 8th floor.  And we had a view of the Empire State Building from our room.  It was clean a clean room with plenty of towels, coffee in the room, plus a nice hot and cold breakfast included in the price. Would definitely stay here again.  Yes, the elevator can take a while when it's busy but we never had an issue with it.

title: Worst Experience Ever
text: The street was fulfilled with trash and smells really bad. When I checked in, they told me my room was occupied by someone else because some staff upgraded others room to mine so my big bed room became to a two small beds room. And it was very noisy in the morning because the staff was cleaning the room near us. It was my worst experience on booking ever！

title: Hotel bem localizado com estação de metro na esquina.
text:
Estive por 3 dias em NYC e me hospedei no Hampton Inn.

Como qualquer hotel em nova york, ele é bem pequenininho, com so quartos bem pequenos também, mas sempre com o charme da cidade em cada detalhe. O banheiro é bem grande, e o hotel oferece várias amenidades que não se vê em todos os hoteis. Se você esqueceu o aparelho de barbear, creme de barbear, escova de dentes, pasta e escov a de cabelo, é só parar na recepção e pedir que eles lhe darão como brinde. Além disso, 24hrs fica disponível uma mesinha para café, chocolate quente e chá para todos os hóspedes utilizarem. Muito boas as bebidas. O café da manhã é imenso, com inúmeras opções. Fica meio cheio as 07:30-08:00, mas ainda assim é melhor do que um café na cidade. Infelizmente não ficamos em um quarto com vista, mas com certeza ela seria incrível. Escolhemos este hotel especialmente pela localização, que com uma estação de metro na esquina (34 St Herald Sq), chegar no meio da noite, cansados depois de uma dia inteiro de turismo, faz toda a diferença.

title: Vista spettacolare e posizione ottima!
text: Siamo stati in questo hotel per circa una settimana e di sicuro ha dalla sua due aspetti molto positivi: se sarete fortunati potrete godere di una vista spettacolare dell'Empire che è  a due passi da lì è dall'altra avere a disposizione a 2 minuti a piedi una stazione della metro comoda e servita! Molto vicino anche a Times Square nonché al Flatiron o alla 5th avenue dove poter fare shopping sfrenato! L'albergo è di proporzioni limitate con stanze familiari non enormi come spesso accade a New york ma pulito e confortevole. Wi fi gratuito, piccola palestra nel sotterraneo, pc a disposizione nella hall e acqua/The caldo e caffè a disposizione 24 su 24 nella zona della colazione, servizio non indifferente e molto gradito al rientro dalle lunghe camminate in giro per la città.  Personale molto cordiale e gentile,  disponibile a fornire mille info. Colazione per noi inclusa e abbastanza variegata. Macchina per fare i waffles caldi spettacolare! Forse un po' piccolo lo spazio dedicato alle colazioni. Un hotel assolutamente consigliato per soggiornare nella Grande Mela!

title: Disappointed
text: I have stayed in the Hampton Inn many times, but when I arrived at this location, I was so disappointed.  The rooms were so small that we could not hardly move around in it.  The room was down a very small corridor next to a large electrical room..There was a box at the end of the room which was supposed to be a closet with a safe on top.  This closet would not close as the safe would not close so we had to keep our luggage on the bed and remove it when we wanted to sleep. The carpet was old and nasty looking. I felt that this was not the standard that I was used to with the Hilton Chain, and I even used my Hilton Honors points for this place.  I understand that it was an old building, but I would never stay there again. I really hated it and I will be very cautious when using my points again for a Hampton Inn.  On the positive side the hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful.  My only problem was the room itself.

title: Comfy hotel for a short trip
text: This was my second visit to New York and had previously stayed at the hotel next door. I was surprised, the first time we checked in, the welcome wasn't so warm, but there was a lot of people checking in and out, so you can forgive the general welcome. The reception as a whole needs redoing to be more welcoming but once you're in your room, it makes up for it. The beds are big, the room is comfortable and you have good views of the Empire State. The TV works a dream and the shower was hot. The  breakfast was brilliant, with a lot of variety. From waffles, to hot breakfasts to cereal, porridge and bagels. Everything was on offer. The coffee was hot and fresh and available all day for those popping in and out of the hotel (to drop off shopping bags etc) with a variety of teas and creamers. I blame them for my addiction to vanilla coffee now! Would stay again, despite a frosty welcome. The staff were helpful and friendly as the week went on!

title: Won't stay there again
text: Rainwater had seeped into the room and whole floor was wet.Rooms are way too small and antiquated and need maintenance badly. Staff are doing their best but the management needs to put some money into upgrade of rooms.

title: Really helpful, friendly staff, good breakfast & location
text:
Although this hotel is a little old & dated, it was clean, was a great central location, staff were really helpful and the breakfast choice was really good. The only negative was the lifts, there are only two for guests & staff and with 18 floors it seemed like you spent a lot of time waiting for the lift to arrive. The positives were the breakfast, there was a choice of cereal, yoghurts, fresh fruit, then you had the choice of hot, this was different each day with either omelette or scrambled egg, sausage patties or turkey sausages. Toaster with bread, bagels, breakfast muffins and a waffle maker. Tea, coffee & chilled water was available all day & could be taken to your room. The staff were really helpful, if you asked them a question they would google & print out a map or instructions. Room was clean and shower / bath had really good hot water pressure which never depleted. 
Not the prettiest hotel, but certainly didn’t regret my 5 night stay here.

title: Not Fancy But Comfy
text: Excellent service. Bed was comfortable. Perfect location. Still close enough to Times Square. Just across from Macy’s, short walk to the Empire State Building, Duane Reade Drug Store (for bare necessities). Plenty of restaurants around. Near the subway. If you are ok with not fancy but comfy, this is the place to be.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Lo mejor, la ubicación, en el Midtown. Zona concurrida y super segura. Para hacer compras y volver a dejar las bolsas en el hotel. Personal muy amable y dispuesto a ayudar. Desayuno muy completo aunque a veces hay mucha gente y el lugar no alcanza. Tiene unas mesitas y sillones en la vereda como para descansar y tomar algo en los dias lindos de verano. Cómoda habitación. Es la 2da vez que me alojo en este hotel y sin dudas, volvería.

title: hotel stay
text: The front desk staff day and night shift were awesome! They were friendly, knowledgeable of area, and always available to assist!! The rooms were clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast was a large selection and fresh and hot. It could get a bit crowded but that’s expected. Enjoyed our experience here and would definitely stay here again. Great location!!

title: Location and breakfast
text: Location and breakfast are the advantages of this hotel. But our room was small enough and tired, requires cosmetic repairs. Our request for a room on the top floor was not granted. In general - the price is in line with quality.

title: Ottima location!
text: In pieno centro, vista sull'Empire State Building, comodissimo alla metro. Con la colazione abbondante inclusa si arriva tranquillamente fino a sera! Personale molto cordiale e disponibile. Ottimi rapporto qualità-prezzo

title: Tattico!
text:
Hotel tattico a Manhattan a pochi passi dalla metro. Prezzi abbordabili per gli standard di NYC ma servizi da rivedere  e colazione totalmente imbarazzante, misera!
La stanze, in compenso, rispetto al resto, meritano! Il personale decisamente è gentile!

title: Girls Getaway
text: It was a great experience all around. We stayed for 3 days . The location was within walking distance to the subway and other points of interest such as Macy’s, time square etc. The room was small but it’s New York!! The breakfast was good and hot!!

title: Awesome location & Hotel
text:
Chose this hotel for location and being a gold member of Hilton.  Rooms are good considering you are most likely to be out most of the time when visiting New York.

Location is what is great about this hotel, we managed to walk to most attractions and right next to the hotel is Monarch roof top bar to go and relax after a long day.

Breakfast was surprisingly good and kept us going til lunch time.

We had no issues with the lift waiting times and would definitely book again when coming back to New York. 

Staff were great and friendly too! 

Picture is view from our room of Empire State Building.

title: A comfortable stay!
text: We had  the pleasure of staying here for three nights during our first brief visit to the USA. The staff is lovely and the rooms are nice. The beds were very comfortable- just the kind of sleep you want after an entire tiring day of sightseeing. Its comfortably located within walking distance from the heart of the city- times square. We enjoyed our breakfast every day- not a huge spread but quality items.

title: Great place to stay and a good value
text: This Hampton Inn right near the Empire State Building was a great place to stay and it was a good value. The breakfast options were stellar. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and beds were comfy.  It was quiet with only a few rooms on each floor.

title: Location Service Quality A+
text: This is one of the best hotel deals I've found on Manhattan.  The location couldn't be better, as you are central to all NYC attractions.  The rooms are on the smaller side, but they were clean and accommodating.  The staff was always friendly and willing to help. Breakfast is included.

title: Worth it
text: Great location and good value for the (New York City) price. The hotel offers all necessery amenities and has friendly and helpful personnel. Included breakfast (good choice, standard quality) is a huge plus.

title: Terrific service at an affordable price!!!
text: Typical small NYC hotel room but it was very clean and had a terrific view of the Empire State Bldg.  Location was terrific.  The street was relatively quite and the hotel was steps away from a subway station.  The staff at this hotel was the best!!!  So helpful and pleasant!  The breakfast is nothing special but typical for a Hampton Inn.  The hotel is very small so the lobby gets a little hectic at busy check in/Check out times.  Considering how affordably priced the room was, this was an excellent hotel!!!  If you like Korean food, the restaurant right next store is awesome!  We ate there twice during out stay.

title: Ottimo
text: Ottima posizione,splendida vista,camera confortevole, ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo. La colazione inclusa è  soddisfacente e comodissima.Il personale è gentile e pronto ad adoperarsi per ogni esigenza.

title: Average but wonderful service
text:
This hotel was our first stay in USA, bit confused with the size of room, slow lift and very narrow lobby area, but very quickly learnt that "Its New York".

Free flow of coffee / tea basic but filling breakfast, what i like about this hotel is managed by wonderful people.

Recommended

title: DISCRETO
text: L'albergo si trova in ottima posizione ma avrebbe bisogno di opere di ammodernamento o quanto meno di una bella rinfrescata a tutti gli ambienti. L'ho trovato un pò decadente. i corridoi dei piani molto piccoli.....Camera molto piccola, buona la pulizia. Colazione buona, interessante la possibilità del caffe a qualunque ora. Personale disponibile e gentile. Metro vicina

title: EXCELENTE UBICACION
text: Excelente hotel, desde que lo reciben a uno en la entrada se puede observar la calidad del personal. El desayuno es bueno y la limpieza en general muy buena. La ubicacion lo mejor del hotel, la entrada al metro esta a unos 50 metros del hotel y esta ubicado muy cerca de macys, MSG y time square.Muy recomendado!!!

title: Another wonderful stay
text: This was our 4th time staying at this hotel - 4 yrs in a row, and will certainly be back. The location is fantastic, the staff is extremely nice, courteous, respectful and helpful and ALWAYS greet you with a smile. The only annoyance is the fact that you often have to wait a long time for the elevator (10 min sometimes) as there are only two and the hotel staff often uses one of them for long periods. When you're tired and can barely stand on your feet, you don't have a choice but to wait for the elevator. If something could be done about this, it would be great. Otherwise, everything else is fantastic - we definitely recomment this hotel.

title: Ótimo hotel
text: Hotel com ótima localização, bom café da manhã, serviço de quarto ótimo, pessoal da recepção muito atenciosos. Tamanho do quarto é bem razoável para Nova York. Emfim o hotel é muito bom, com o custo benefício ótimo. Recomendo

title: Reasonably priced and friendly and clean
text: Very pleasant personnel.  Quick service even while checking in a little early.  Room was quiet, clean and had all we needed for a pleasant stay.  Very conveniently located to Madison Square Garden and Empire State Building.

title: First time in New York City
text: Hotel was very clean.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The location was great.  Near the Empire State Building, Macy’s, subway, walking distance to Times Square.  Breakfast was included; fruit, make your own waffle, something different everyday.

title: Excelente atención!
text:
El hotel es muy lindo y el desayuno es muy surtido. La atención del personal del hotel es muy buena, sobre todo la de Antonia. Una genia! 
Muy buena ubicación. A unos metros del metro y de la tienda macys. Buena limpieza y precioso accesibles.

title: Super hotel, excellent rapport qualité prix !
text:
Quelle belle surprise ! Nous avons séjourné dans cet hotel au mois de février. A notre arrivée nous avons été upgradé dans une chambre supérieure, néanmoins le mur du lit donnait directement sur la cage d’ascenseur et faisait beaucoup de bruit. 

Nous avons donc demandés à changer de chambre pour finalement avoir une toute petite chambre assez sombre, un peu dommage mais nous n’allions pas encore nous  plaindre une seconde fois.

L’hotel est récent et le personnel est charmant, le petit déjeuner est très copieux et frais, à l’américaine. Des bouteilles d’eau sont offertes à la réception sur demande.

Habitués de la chaine Hilton, nous sommes maintenant au 3ème Garden Inn que nous faisons et ils deviennent une valeur sûre !

title: Excelente custo benefício
text: Qualidade no atendimento com pessoas altamente atenciosas, localização sensacional, quarto impecável. Vale a pena se hospedar pelo pacote de experiência que proporcionam, sem contar que o grupo Hilton nunca deixa a desejar.

title: An average hotel in a good location
text: The Hampton Inn chain is generally reliable.  This location is on 35 th street between 5th and 6th Avenue.  I chose it to be close to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station which are only a 10-minute walk away.  There were a few little problems at the hotel, but the staff was very good and customer-oriented.  Two more difficult issues were that there are only 2 elevators for a 20-floor building so long waits and crowds were common.  Also, and this will probably keep me from booking here again, the wi-if service is unreliable.  I was on the 10th floor and was frequently unable to connect.  Other times I was connected only for the system to shut down on me without warning!

title: Localização excelente e custo/benefício
text:
Hotel com excelente localização (Midtown)a meia quadra da Macys, uma quadra do Empire States. Hotel precisa de uma reforma. Ficamos no quarto com duas camas queen, um pouco apertado se tiver muitas malas, falta um frigobar e um microondas.
O café da manhã é bom mas dependendo do horário fica difícil achar uma mesa.
No geral, o custo beneficio compensa se for apenas para dormir.

title: Great location! Great value!
text: View of Empire State Building and within steps of a subway stop. Located on 35th between 5th and 6th, you’re close to so much yet not in the middle of the chaos of NYC. Staff is courteous and helpful. Great restaurants all around.

title: Top Hotel, top Lage
text: Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 20. Stock mit direktem Blick aufs Empire State Building. Die Zimmer waren zweckmäßig eingerichtet und sehr sauber. Die Doppelbetten waren sehr bequem. Das Frühstück war für amerikanische Verhältnisse sehr gut. Jeden Tag gab es frisches Obst, Eier und Kaffee in versch. Varianten, Toast, Bagels, Muffins etc. sogar frische Waffeln könnte man sich selbst zubereiten. Alles da für einen perfekten Start in den Tag. Die Lage war phänomenal. Direkt vor der Tür eine U-Bahn Station, und das Macy’s ums Eck. Alles fussläufig erreichbar. Times Square nur ca. 19 min zu Fuß oder eine Station mit der U-Bahn. Wir würden jederzeit dort wieder übernachten.

title: Recomendo.
text: Pessoal simpatico e sempre prestável, boa localização, estação de metro a 30 metros. Pequeno almoço agradável. Valor preço / qualidade, bastante razoável para Nova York. Os  quartos um pouco pequenos para 4 pessoas, mas usados maioritariamente para dormir, por isso bastante razoáveis.

title: Ottima posizione, buon hotel
text:
Hotel che si trova in un’ottima posizione per visitare la città, molto vicino alla fermata della metro. Lo staff è molto gentile e disponibile, la struttura tenuta bene. La camera era molto pulita, curata e spaziosa e noi avevamo pure la vista sull’Empire State Building. Colazione disponibile alla mattina, abbastanza abbondante.
Sicuramente ci tornerei volentieri!

title: A nice stay in New York.
text: The hotel has a great location, one block away from the Empire State Building.  The staff was excellent and very accommodating.   The complimentary breakfast was good as well.  The rooms are small, so if you have more that 4 people, you'll need two rooms.  Overall, it was  a positive experience for my family.

title: Good Location
text: This hotel is within 100 feet of a subway entrance, which made this a perfect choice to not be on a very busy street, but everything was easily accessible. The front desk was extremely courteous and helpful.

title: Excelente
text: Muy buena ubicación. Personal muy atento. La zona es tranquila, esta cerca de todo. Fácil acceso al metro.  Las habitaciones cómodas. Limpieza. Desayuno normal. Tienen café, agua fría y caliente disponibles todo el día.

title: Great location
text: Hotel is on a nice location in Midtown Manhattan but parking is offsite. Parking is about 2 blocks away. Hallways are narrow and elevators are slow especially when they are busy.  Breakfast has good selection and staff are nice and friendly. Room is a little bit tight and TV is difficult to turn on.

title: Hampton Inns always deliver quality
text:
We have never been disappointed by a Hampton Inn, and this one is no exception. Friendly staff, comfortable beds, decent breakfast, and a great location. 
I only wish their lobby coffee was as good as the coffee in the room!
No complaints at all!

title: Great location
text:
Great spot to stay at a reasonable price, comfortable bed and room but by no means spacious, the breakfast area is horrid , it’s just way too small and a zoo of crowded folk pushing and shoving for breakfast.
If you wish to start the day in a more civilized manner I suggest pay for an outside breakfast.

title: idéal pour visiter Manhattan a pied
text: la situation de l’hôtel idéal pour visiter Manhattan car la plus parts des attractions touristiques central park ,time square;;;;;;;;;;; ,il faut juste avoir de bonne espadrille pour bien marcher et bien s'hydrater aussi car en juillet il fait chaud

title: Perfectamente situado y personal muy atento
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, justo en frente del Empire. La zona es tranquila, de fácil acceso para usar el metro o coger taxi. 
Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero suficientes y muy cómodas. La limpieza es exquisita y el personal muy amable y atento.
El desayuno perfecto, además tienen café y galletas calientes disponibles todo el día para que entres en calor si viajas en época de frío.

title: Absolut fantastisk!!!
text:
Jeg har været i New York 3 gange på få år, og to af gangene har jeg boet på et Hampton Inn.
Denne gang var helt sikkert den bedste gang!
Hotellet har den mest perfekte beliggenhed! En subway station få meter væk, og her kan du komme næsten hele Manhattan rundt. Man behøver ikke at booke transport til hotellet, for subwayen til JFK stopper på denne station!
Udover det, er der kun ganske få minutters gang til seværdigheder som Empire State Building, Times Square og Macys. Der ligger en stor Target lige på den anden side af Macys, så der er fantastiske indkøbsmuligheder rundt om hjørnet.
Nej, værelserne er måske ikke særlig store, men hvad forventer man i en storby som New York, hvor alle bygninger er 100 gange højere end de er brede?
Og hvor meget tid bruger man på hotellet, når der er så meget at opleve på den anden side af vinduet?
Morgenmaden er som en hver anden morgenmad på et amerikansk hotel.
Der er noget for alle. Mælken er kold, yoghurten opbevares i en køler, kaffen er varm, brødet er i lukkede brødkasser og der er kage til dessert. 
Det er bedre forhold end de hoteller vi danskere gladeligt tager på sydpå!!
Hotellet er rent, vedligeholdt og personalet er venligt og hjælpsomt.
På dette hotel er der privat badeværelse, hvilket bare er luksus i sig selv.
Jeg anbefaler dette hotel til alle jeg kender der skal til New York, og jeg vil sikkert komme igen, næste gang jeg er i området.
Tak!

title: All you need at a great location
text: We stayed there for four nights. The hotel is perfectly located for whatsover NYC activity. Staff is great, room (very tidy) appropriate, although not spacious (but hey - this is New York!), breakfast nice. Overall excellent value for money.

title: Great value in Herald Square
text: I stay at this hotel about 15-20 nights a year for business.  The location is fabulous for going uptown or downtown.  The staff is friendly and the rooms utilize the space allotted effectively.  This hotel is a good value.

title: Girls Trip to NY to see Frozen on Broadway
text: Great Place ...Staff very easy to work with..Room very clean..great breakfast. Coffee Tea and cold water always available..they help you get transportation to the airport and hard close to the subway..would definitely stay here again..

title: マンハッタンの中ではリーズナブルなホテル
text: 客室はコンパクトにまとまっており、地下鉄の駅も近く便利なホテルです。日本人には嬉しいバスタブもありお湯を張ってくつろげます。無料の朝食も無料なら申し分ない内容でありマンハッタンの中ではリーズナブルで使いやすいホテルだと思います。

title: Excelente
text: Estuvimos en Año Nuevo 2017/18. El personal excelente sin excepción. En la cocina una señora se preocupaba , cual abuela, que la chocolatada no estuviera caliente. Impresionante desayuno. Fundamental tener a disposición algo calente para tomar durante todo el día. La habitación perfecta y la calefacción impecable. Ubicación justa a una cuadra y media de pent station, con acceso a todas las líneas de metro. Todo perfecto sin dudas súper recomendable. El precio es muy bueno en relación al servicio y calidad.

title: Great job, Ozzy!
text: Front desk staff, especially Ozzy, was helpful and cool under the pressure of several families waiting to check in at the same time. He gave us great suggestions, too! The breakfast was excellent and had a nice variety choices.

title: First visit to NYC
text: This was my first visit to NYC so I didn’t know what to expect from the hotel facilities and staff. The hotel staff were very friendly and genuine in their customer service. I did not have any problems here during my stay. The room was clean and I felt safe.

title: Friendly Staff
text: Friendly and efficient staff Excellent customer service. Very helpful and easy to communicate with. Would likely book here again as it is only a block from Time Square and the subway entrance right on the corner.

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel bien situé. L empire state Building n est pas loin Ainsi qu une station de métro et de bus. personnel sympa, petit déjeuner très bien et ménage soigné. petit détail si vous demandez des bouteilles d eau à l accueil en gêneral ils les offres.pas de bruit pour dormir mais on a pas eu une chambre où l on voit l empire state Building.

title: Hampton Inn Can’t be Beat!
text: We had a nice stay at the Hampton Inn Empire location. He included breakfast really helped us save money on eating out and it was pretty good! Staff was nice, room was clean! What more can you ask for?

title: Tired
text: I go to New York City once a month, so I've stayed at a number of Midtown Manhattan hotels.  The Hampton Inn is in a great location near Penn Station, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, but the hotel itself is tired.  The room looks like it hasn't been renovated in a few years.  My room had banged up furniture and no fridge.  The TV only has HD channels, but it's not an HD TV, so the picture is distorted.  The bath towels are small and scratchy..  There are only two elevators for a hotel that has over 20 floors, so be prepared to wait for them.  Next month, I'm going to pay a few more dollars and stay at the Hilton Garden Inn next store where the rooms have a fridge, microwave, and a walk-in (not tub) shower.

title: Great time in New York
text: The staff was awesome and I Love it. They went above the call of duty. The Hotel is in the middle of everything. You can go wrong with this Hotel. I was very impressed with how they addressed each guess by name. Awesome Awesome is all I can say!!!

title: Good Location
text: Stayed here for business. Fast access to subway and near just about everything. Very small rooms but what do you expect right. Decently priced for the area. Great steak restaurant right across the street. For some reason I had nearly no cell coverage in the hotel so I had to connect to the free wi-fi which helped.

title: Convenient
text:
It was our first time at this hotel as we normally stay in Times Square.  This hotel is in the Garment District, thus close to Macy’s and a whole host of our stores.  The subway is also conveniently located just outside the entrance and quick to get you anywhere. It is central between Times Square and the lower part of Manhattan.

The rooms are rather small and a bit tight for a family of four, but it didn’t matter since we were always out.  The housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning our room every day.  The people at the front desk were very friendly, patient and extremely helpful.  The breakfast was fine, but be sure to get there before 7 am.  There were tons of families crowding the area after 7 am. ,so there were a few days where we opted to eat out. 

We definitely enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it!

title: If you ride subways, stay here
text: Love this place. Herald Square is best location. The yellow and orange subway lines are the best. You can walk to Madison and Union Square parks. Staff are well trained and pleasant. Gotta visit Macy's. It's huge.

title: A great place to stay.
text: This hotel was clean and convenient.  Our view was of the Empire State building.  The breakfasts were tasty and varied. The staff was friendly and courteous. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

title: Exploring NY
text: This location was fantastic for being ideal for visiting all the sites easily.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very clean.  The view of the Empire State building, especially in the evening was spectacular.

title: ótima opção, recomendo!
text:
O Hotel fica super bem localizado, uma estação de metro na esquina, o que facilita o deslocamento, e é muito próximo da times square e outros pontos turísticos da cidade, fizemos nossos passeios a pé, devida a ótima localização do hotel.
Quarto bom, atendimento dos funcionários, cordialidade e sempre atenciosos, boa opção de café da manha, comparado com demais hoteis da região, é o melhor custo beneficio em relação, localização, qualidade e café da manha. 
Não tenho do que reclamar.

title: Excellent Experience
text:
Excellent Experience, good location and reasonable price.
I totrally recommend this hotel for others. we would like book this hotel again if we go to New York City again.
Thanks for the reception andall other staff.

title: correct
text:
Hotel well located, this is my 2nd stay in this hotel.
The room is good, with a good bed. Free breakfast, but very crowded place however.
The staff is nice, rather helpful. Be careful if you need a taxi, no need to ask the front desk, it will cost you too much. Do it youself for better value.

title: Excelente opção
text: Hotel ótimo, quarto excelente, recepção cordial ajudaram em tudo. Café impecável. Ao lada de uma estação do metrô. vale muito a pena. Localizado pertinho do Empire State e 5ª avenida. Permitem que o hospede faça o check out e aguarde confortável na área do café até o momento que desejar sair e guardam todas as malas em local seguro.

title: Great location but small rooms
text:
I guess for Manhattan you will pay for location over a room size.
Then again for NYC...you will pay a lot for even small space. LOL
But the location was great...close to Time Sq, Empire St Bldg, and Madison Sq Garden.

title: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff
text: We spent 2 nights here in June and it was a perfect location.  Herald Square is less than a block away and they had a market happening so enjoyed breakfast in the park.  There's a subway station basically out the front door and Times Square is a few good people watching blocks away.  Yes, the rooms are small but it's NYC and they were clean.  Decent selection of breakfast items and easy storage both before check-in and after check-out.  Would easily stay again...

title: Not up to par for Hilton
text: very small rooms, no refridgerator, issues with a/c, only 2 bath towels for a room booked for two adults.  None of the amenities I am used to with Hilton brand.  Extremely slow and inadequate elevators, be prepared to spend a lot of time in the hallway or get a room on the lower floor and take the stairs!

title: everything everywhere in walking distance
text:
location location and location, for over night stay with short trip in NYC, this hotel answered all my need. 
arrived in NYC early Sat's morning then spent time hop in-out on bus, enjoy sightseeing around town..
then we checked-in at 3pm; hotel allows to do online and selected my own room 24 hours before arrive in NYC... offer digital key, if i don't want to bother at guest service...
recommend to stop by at guest service if you carry hilton honor card, get free drink ask for extra shampoo.. 
the room kinda tiny, yes it's tighten similar like Tokyo or another big city...but i don't mind about it... only one concern is this hotel near by everywhere i want to go.
PS the room come with full bar of breakfast serve 6-10 am, fill up before hit the road..

title: A wonderful place to stay
text:
Visited On June 6th till 8th, and had a very enjoyable time.
We arrived early and Ashley at the front desk greeted us with a smile and checked us in.
Our rooms were not ready, so they called a gentleman who was such much more than a bellman ( I am thinking secret agent owner) who secured our luggage.  Ashley then called me personally to let me know that one of the rooms was ready.   It was clean and well maintained.   The only hiccup was that the other room was not ready on time, however the young lady on the late shift was very caring and kept us informed.   When I received the other room, it was very clean as well.    Breakfast was in the top 5% of Hampton Inn's I have stayed at...........both hot and cold selections......tea/coffee available all day...........Cold water available all day.           The only hold up was that the elevator is shared with Housekeeping therefore sometimes is extremely slow.      F.Y.I.   Everyone person who works there seems to be happy, because they are happy, not because they are "forced" to pretend to be happy................

title: No el mejor de la cuadra
text:
Viajo anualmente a EEUU por trabajo, y le he tomado cariño a la cuadra de la calle 35 entre las avenidas 5ta y 6ta. Es tranquila y logísticamente insuperable. 
A lo largo de los años he visitado todos los hoteles de esa cuadra y, si bien ninguno es malo, el Hampton Inn es en el que menos cómodo me he sentido.
Quizás haya sido una semana desafortunada; pero, como nunca en un Hilton, tuve un par de situaciones en las que requerí asistencia y tuve que insistir para recibirla.
Eso si, para balancear, el desayuno está incluido en el precio, y es un punto a tener en cuenta.

title: Family visit with one teen.
text: Excellent location near Macy’s and a short walk up Broadway to Times Square. Walked to Richard Rogers for Hamilton. When we didn’t walk, we used the East-West subway stops adjacent to hotel and N-S stops a block away to visit Financial District and 1 World.

title: Excellent Location
