text: We stayed 5 nights & could not find fault with anthing. Excellent location only a 2 min walk to subway & within walking distance of a lot of attractions. We had a room on the 16th floor facing the Empire State Building which was very quiet & no problems with noise or sleeping. Staff were excellent, very knowledgeable & nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice & the availability of hot drinks & cold water 24 hrs was a bonus. I would not hesitate to stay here again if I visited New York.

title: Hotel perfeito
text: Nos hospedamos neste hotel em nossa ultima viagem.  Hotel excelente com um bom café da manhã incluído.  O pessoal de atendimento é muito atencioso. As acomodações são ótimas e bem confortáveis. A localização é excelente bem próxima a uma estação do metro e walking distance de vários pontos como Times square, madison square garden, lojas, etc

title: Great location for us
text: Hotel was in a great location for our meeting- it was within walking distance and subway was right at the end of the block. Our room was quite as it faced other buildings and not the street.  Hot breakfast was as expected.

title: A few issues
text:
I chose this hotel as previous Hilton's have fully satisfied our needs. However there were a few issues. 
15 min check in as they couldn't find my booking ,I had to show my confirmed email. 
Tried to download digital key prior to arrival but received an email to pass by front desk, so what's the point of check-in on line?
Digital key was activated the following day but our key cards no longer worked ,we were promptly issued new ones.
Our room wasn't made up the first day and when I complained I was told I needed to request this !!!
Breakfast at 6am meant lifts weren't busy but the floor was very sticky.
No hot milk and way too much plastic and non recyclable cutlery cups etc. No one bothered to separate plastic from trash.
Hotel needs an update showers over baths with curtain in 2018!! Carpet is worn and dull,dining room bench worn and broken in part.
Noisy ice dispenser outside our room 
Rant over, 
Bed was very comfortable, nice bedding,
 air con works well.
Fantastic position,close to everything but quiet at night.
Able to leave luggage after check out.

title: Great location, staff & breakfast
text:
We stayed here for a week and can’t really fault it. The room was clean and comfortable with effective (if not a touch noisy) air con,which was a god send! We stayed on the 3rd floor facing 35th Street and although there was some street noise,it was background noise and never kept up awake. 
The staff are extremely polite and helpful and the breakfast in the morning was surprisingly good - cereals, eggs, pastries etc and was a good set up for the day. Tea,coffee, water was available in the room,but also in the dining area throughout the day/night. 
Location is excellent- a few hundred metres from the subway,but also walking distance to Time Sq, Empire State, Bryant Park & Rockefeller. Next door there is also a roof top bar which gives some great views. 
We got into JFK and took the Air Train ($5) to Jamaica,then the LIRR ($10) to Penn St. From there it’s approx a 7min stroll to the hotel - the whole journey took less than an hr which was about the same as getting a cab but loads cheaper! 
We’d definitely stay again.

title: Great location, good start to every day
text: This turned out to be a great location for us. Very near a subway entrance. Employees extremely kind and courteous. As always in New York, cost seems a little high but that's what you do so might as well enjoy it. Breakfast really helped.

title: Meraviglioso
text: Pulito comodo il personale era sempre disponibile per ogni cosa. Colazione abbondante. Caffè a tè gratis in 24 ore che raramente trovi in America. Vicino a Times Square e dalla finestra vedevo empire state... Luis e Antoniece sempre sorridente con noi e con la nostra bambina. Sempre disponibili per le mie richieste riguardo alla bambina. Grazie a tutti.

title: Staff’s mistake and money loss
text:
An “in training” front desk young lady has made mistakes that caused a financial harm to me. 
At first, she has made a big mess with the amount of my stay, and without notice and without ask for help, tried to charge my credit card. It has occurred three times before ask for help to her colleague. As a result, my bank blocked my credit card, for security (after all, they interpreted the various attempts as a possibility of fraud). 
To unblock my credit card, I’ve needed to make a phone call, using the phone of the hotel. Surprisingly, after checkout, I realized that phone call was – in a large amount – added to my expenses. So, although a lack of skills have been of the Hampton front desk representative , it’s me that took the onus of it.

title: Great Location... Friendly Staff
text: We stayed for two nights and found the hotel to be wonderful with a friendly staff.  Rooms are clean and well appointed.  Breakfast is included and includes a good variety of breakfast foods.  A real plus for us was that they allow dogs.  There is an extra charge but that is to be expected.  All in all a great choice.

title: Great Location, Very Slow Elevators
text:
The location, just a couple of hundred feet from the Herald Square subway station (NE corner at 35th Street and 6th Avenue) was very convenient. Just a 10 minute walk to Times Square and the theaters, and very easy to get to lots of different subway lines to go anywhere in the city. Of course, if you are taking luggage, recognize that New York subways are not very friendly to anything more than minimal luggage.

The room we had was great; very clean and quiet, despite facing on to 35th Street. The breakfast was about the same as most Hampton Inns, with a decent selection of both hot entrees, waffles, oatmeal, cold cereals, muffins, bread, bagels, and fruit.

The only issue is really the elevators. They are very slow. The hotel is 20 floors (I think), and we were on the 7th floor. The hotel is relatively narrow, with only 8 rooms per floor. There are apparently no service elevators, as the housekeepers and maintenance staff also used the same two passenger elevators as the guests. It did not seem to be unusual to spend 5 minutes waiting for an elevator to come, only to find it already full of guests from higher floors. Unfortunately, that seems to be part of the price of staying in midtown Manhattan.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and was very impressed. Location is quite central, could walk to Broadway, Times Square, Empire State Building and a brisk walk to Central Park.  Room was very comfortable, bed was huge and pillows were lovely, had a great sleep.  Tea and coffee were available in the room which was a change from my previous hotel plus breakfast was included and delicious.  Staff were helpful and friendly and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

title: Great stay in an excellent location
text:
My husband and I stayed here for an extended weekend in the city. The hotel's location was excellent - centrally situated to all of the "must see" attractions in the city. The subway (34th & Herald Square) is just outside the door and brought us to most destinations without having to change trains. We arrived early in the morning (well before check-in) and were able to leave our luggage for the day and the staff even invited us to have breakfast!

I read lots of other reviews before booking and offer the following:
**Staff were very pleasant and helpful at making recommendations
**Elevators - we had zero issues with waiting for an elevator at any time of day
**Our room had only two sets of towels for two people for three nights. We requested extra towels two days in a row. The first day we were given only one new towel (not the two towels and two washcloths we requested) and the second day we didn't get any (but pilfered some from the housekeeping cart). Never did get any washcloths. Check your towel supply and ask right away!
**Breakfast was typical for Hampton and the staff kept up with demand very well. Hot coffee and cold water were available all day.
**The room was small (as expected for NYC) but clean and the bed was comfortable. The only issue with the room was the bathroom fan. It was sort of hanging out of the ceiling, very loud, and ineffective.
**Our room was on the 9th floor, front and we had no excessive street noise at night

We would definitely stay here again!

title: Hotel excelente, e com ótima localização!
text: Gostei muito de me hospedar neste hotel e me hospedarei novamente quando retornar a NY. Localização perfeita, ótimo quarto, confortável, e com staff atencioso também. Conseguimos até um quarto com vista para o Empire States no segundo dia da hospedagem, graças à presteza e simpatia da Grisell. O café da manhã muito bom, com variados itens, bem completo, foi excelente também, contando com a simpatia da Antonia e de outros colaboradores, bem prestativos. Super recomendaria este hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Recently stayed here with my husband and two children. Great location for exploring Manhattan. Check in was easy and staff very helpful. Room was was a good size and clean and had everything we needed. Fantastic view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was very good and offered gluten free bread. Unfortunately we never took the name of the gentleman in the breakfast room each morning but he was helpful and gave the children cookies which they loved. Another nice addition was coffee, tea, hot chocolate and water available 24hrs. We have stayed in other hotels in NYC but this is now our favourite and we will definitely return.

title: Avoid
text: Very small dark rooms.  If you have to stay at this hotel ask for a room with 2 beds facing the street.  These rooms are small even by NYC standards. Even the halls are small.  You can not pass another person in the hall with out stepping sideways.

title: 便利！ロビーのコーヒーサービスも素晴らしい！
text:
地下鉄まですぐ！雨の日もまったく億劫になりません。便利な路線でどこにでも行けます。大通りまで出ればバスも便利！
朝食も毎日チョコチョコ変わって飽きません。バナナなどフルーツもあるので、食欲の無い時も◎。ロビーにあるコーヒー（数種類あり）や冷たいお水など、いつでもいただけるので、お部屋に持ち帰ったりして、とても便利でした。
近くにメイシーズやドラッグストアもあり、何も不自由はありません。お部屋も広くて、快適。次も利用します！

title: Location, location, location. Excelent profesional service.
text:
We have been coming to this hotel several times a year. 
Service is consistent and the staff is super helpfull. 
Nothing is difficult. The restaurant staff is ready to help. 
We like the fact that we can send packages before arrival, and they are waiting for us upon arrival. 
We also like the 39th street location as well.

title: Excelente custo-benefício
text:
O hotel atendeu totalmente minhas expectivas quanto a localização, café da manhã e qualidade do sono. O quarto, de tamanho regular, ficou na medida para nossas necessidades. Mobiliário novo, com cafeteira, cofre digital, cama king e tv grande. 
O café da manhã foi muito bom, com waffles, ovos, frutas, pães e bebidas quentes/frias. Destaco e agradeço ao senhor e à senhora que trabalham na área do restaurante. Sempre muito simpáticos e solícitos! 
Além disso, o hotel conta com uma copa 24hrs com café para os hóspedes, detalhe que apreciei muito. 
O wifi funcionou bem no quarto durante toda estadia.
A entrada para o metrô fica a 50 metros do hotel, e a Macy's fica no outro quarteirão. Esse ponto da Herald Square é movimentado todo tempo, com restaurantes e lojas. O Empire State fica a uma rua do hotel, e a Times Square fica a uma caminhada de 12 minutos, ou a uma estação de metrô.
Staff da recepção bastante atencioso, ficaram com as bagagens por ocasião de nossa chegada (chegamos pela manhã cedo, antes do horário do check-in).
Fiquei muito feliz com a escolha e recomendo.

title: Hotel très bien placé
text:
Hotel très bien placé pour un court séjour car les lignes de métro sont très nombreuses. Beaucoup de restaurants. 
Hotel très calme, chambre très bien entretenue et accueil de la réception super sympa et très pro. Par contre, petit déj très moyen

title: Fantastic hotel and location
text: This is our second stay at the Hampton Inn on 35th Street. The hotel is clean, convenient and quiet. Great to have breakfast on-site before heading out for a long day of sightseeing. It’s a 10-minute walk to Time Square, 2 minutes to Macy’s, and 1 minute to the Subway station.  Lots of food options within a 5-minute walk. I would highly recommend.

title: Busy, Efficient, and a Relaxing Placing to Stay
text: Located in walking distance to the Empire State Building and the theatre district, this Hampton Inn is busy yet efficient. The breakfast area spans two rooms with plenty of seating, so you don’t feel too crowded, and there’s a baggage storage area for those who check out but have a day ahead in NYC (or arrive early and don’t want to wheel bags around the city before their room is ready). The staff is polite,and knowledgeable. Good room rates for a Midtown Manhattan hotel.

title: Sibling trip
text: My brother and I stayed 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Empire State Bldg., checking in on May 12 and checking out on May 16. The experience was great.  The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly.  The room was great as was the breakfast.  We had a great stay thanks to the wonderful staff.  We will stay there again.

title: Great service and price for NYC
text: This is an excellent price for the location and quality. Breakfast is included and there were a lot of people when we were there, however, the staff made sure that the food was stocked. Rooms are not large, but none of the rooms on NYC are big. It was a great valuable with a friendly staff.

title: Best Location in Midtown
text: A GREAT location with easy access to the subway and Penn Station. Walking distance to Times Square and Theater District. Our entire family was comfortable, including an octogenarian. Great place to stay!

title: Très bien placé pour découvrir New York
text:
Très bon hôtel, bien situé, proche du métro et de toutes les attractions de la ville. 
Bon petit déjeuner disponible de 6h à 10h. 
Très bonne literie et chambre correcte et propre. 
Wifi gratuit et avec une très bonne connexion.

title: Spotless hotel in perfect location
text: We had a delightful stay at this perfectly positioned hotel, located between Macy's and the Empire State Building. With access to eight subway lines just steps away from the front door, it's easy to travel anywhere you want to go. The hotel was spotless, the front desk staff were unfailingly helpful and polite, and the breakfast buffet manager was top-notch, keeping everything tidy and well-stocked. I was very pleased with our choice of this Hampton Inn.

title: Hampton NYC
text: This hotel is a great location and good value.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Free coffee/tea and cookies are a great added touch.  The rooms are decent size for NYC.  Bathrooms are clean and well maintained.

title: Great location!
text: Stayed at the Hampton on 35th during a recent business trip. I must say, this hotel is in a great location. The Empire State Building is very close and a ton of amazing food places are close by. The hotel staff was great as well. Khofari (I know I spelled incorrectly) at the front was extremely helpful and friendly- gave me great food recommendations. Macy’s & H&M are also very close.  There is a subway station 100 feet away which makes getting around NYC very easy. Times Square is near and not that bad of a walk. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. Great customer service, great location and GREAT LOCATION!!  I can’t wait to visit NYC again.

title: Hotel correct pour Manhattan
text:
L'hotel est très correct, et le prix l'était également pour Manhattan.
Le petit déjeuner était top, rien à redire, les enfants ont été content, le personnel très accueillant. 
La chambre n'est pas d'une grande jeunesse, mais la literie est confortable, c'est l'essentiel
Je conseille !

title: Great hotel
great hotel
text: arrived at hotel v erry early and the staff was very helpful in trying to make me comfortable until a room was available. Shirley and Grisel are part of the professional front desk staff and they did a wonderful job

title: Definitely won’t be back
text:
I chose this hotel as part of my business trip. This Hampton location is very run down and the front desk staffs are incapable and unfriendly. 

The carpet feels disgusting to walk on and I found a towel that has a lipstick stain (see the attached pic).  

Save yourself and find a hotel somewhere else.

title: Staff Training Needed
text: Hotel is nice enough. No refrigerators or microwave in the room. When I was checking in about 7 pm, front desk lady was on the phone with someone trying to cancels a reservation they made on Booking.com. I pulled out my ID and credit card, and waited. She didn’t acknowledge me, put the person on hold, or attempt to start my check-in while I was standing there. She continued to “argue” with the caller about how she couldn’t do anything to help unless the internet company called her. That took about 10 minutes. Then she finally got off the phone, and another phone started ringing. She asked me to hold one second, and picked up the other phone. She asked that person if they could hold, but they didn’t want to hold and a new issue started with this caller booking on Expedia. Then another 5 minute conversation. She could have easily grabbed my ID and credit card, and started my check-in while she was talking. Anyway, next morning about 8:00 am I go to take elevator to lobby from the 12th floor. It’s taking forever, and finally an elevator opens but it is packed with people and a stroller. No way for me to fit. I wait another 10 mins, and the only other elevator stops on my floor but it’s going up. It appears to be the housekeeping manager in that elevator. He holds the elevator open for about 5 mins while he talks to the maid on my floor. I’m thinking people are probably waiting on every floor while this guy makes his rounds holding up one of only two elevators in the hotel. Finally he leaves, and the other elevator stops on my floor. Inside is a housekeeping staff member with all her cleaning supplies next to the buttons. It’s hard to press your floor. As we go down, several stops, and more people trying to fit on the elevator. The maid doesn’t get off to let guests on the elevator. She’s going to the 2nd floor, and she’s getting there no matter what. People are turned away because they can’t fit due to the maid’s equipment on the elevator. So we have two elevators on a weekday at 8 am being used by staff when that’s the busiest time for people to get down to breakfast or to start their day. Makes no sense. Someone needs to train the entire staff on good customer service. It starts with all of them.

title: Don’t leave anything behind
text:
I chose this hotel for my 1st couple of days in NYC with myself and another friend before I needed to move to a bigger space due to more friends arriving. I chose the hotel based on brand, location and the reviews were not too bad.
I arrived late evening, and my 1st impression was it was not the warmest of greetings. I felt like I had interrupted the 2 folks at reception. Check in was fast, show my credit card and ID, and handed me keys with minimal interaction.
My room was on the 2nd floor. The door was odd as the key card insert was behind the electric board, it was easy access, but did look odd. The room decor is dark,and during the day, this is not helped by the building view of the room as there is no natural light. It was a NYC standard size room, small. But ok for 1-2 people. It is older and a little tired with its furnishings, but clean.
The bed was comfortable and a good size, could have fit 3 or 4 people in it.
Breakfast was fantastic, a good selection of options, and it was not too overcrowded at the times we went down. I really enjoyed it. 
If you are all about location, this is perfect, you are literally 2 mins to the subway system, and right in the centre of Herald Square. This is my favourite location in the city because it’s away from crowded Times Square, but close to everything. 
In the bathroom under the sink was a shelf, so when using the shower I put my clothes there to keep them off the floor. Unfortunately on my last day, I left my Pajamas on the shelf. My bag was locked, and it was later that evening I discovered I was missing them and immediately remembered where they were. I called the hotel, and got told they would check with housekeeping in the morning. I did not hear back so when down that end of the city I popped in. They claimed they could not find them, even though both my friend and I could explain exactly where they had been left (they were in as new condition Garfield brand). This then comes down to 2 things - a dishonest cleaner, or a not very good cleaner and the next guest taking them (unlikely). A report was filed, and I was told it would take about 3 weeks...it is now past 3 weeks and I have heard nothing. It should also be noted at the time there has been 100% no apology. While careless of me to miss taking them, I expect honesty from the hotel, and some form of contact. I am very disappointed in the lack of action on this. For this reason I will never stay at this hotel again.

title: Great Stay - Great Location
text:
Stayed here mid-April for 5 nights. Received an upgraded room on request being a Hilton Honors member - terrific corner room, top floor with an Empire State Building view! 

LOCATION: Hotel is in a great location - near the subway, Penn Station/MSG, Bryant Park - all within a very short walk. Straight walk to get to Times Square, Broadway, etc. Several restaurants nearby, including a couple of great carts!

ROOMS: Room was a 2-double room and was NY-small, like most in the city. Very clean and quiet on the whole. I'm sure being on the top floor helped drown out the street noise, well, that and the earplugs we always travel with. Not a lot of storage area for suitcases. You'll have to use the armoire and chest of drawers.

HOTEL:  All employees we came into contact with were quite nice and always smiling. The breakfast area can get quite crowded on the weekends and the breakfast food area can get demolished several times during the service hours. I'd recommend getting there early or tempering your expectations. Food was basic Hilton fare - the same stuff you'd find at any other Hampton in any other city. Decent but nothing to write home about. The elevators were a bit slow when the hotel was busy. There are only 2 elevators for all 20 floors (I think 8 rooms/floor). It can take a while depending upon the time of day. Once, it took a good 10 minutes to get to the ground floor to pick us up after breakfast.

Overall, I'd say any room facing the street will have a great view. If you are a HHonors member (Gold/Platinum), be sure to ask for an upgrade when you make your reservation. It was a really great stay here and I will definitely look at going back when we need to return to the city that never sleeps. Thanks Hampton!

title: Great little hotel in a fab location!
text:
We stayed here on a short trip recently and the hotel is great! 

So central for everything you need and want to see in the city. 

Lovely friendly staff, GREAT afternoon cookies!!! 

Rooms, whilst on the small side were clean, comfortable beds, and all in room facilities were good. Only downfall was the shower head which was a bit temperamental, either on pulse or dripping and the coffee machine didn’t work but this didn’t really bother us too much. 

Breakfast was good. The waffle machine was great! Hot breakfast was a little limited, but there was cereals, fruit, pastries, hot oats on occasion. All self serve which was great. Only downside was it was all on disposable plates, cutlery, cups etc. Which I don’t really agree with from a reuse, reduce, recycle point of view, but this is the same all over NYC. A disposable culture I guess!! 
Overall though...It’s a lovely small hotel in the city!

title: Hotel con excelente ubicación y personal muy atento.
text: El hotel tiene una estupenda ubicación, las habitaciones son pequeñas como en todos los hoteles en Manhattan, por lo que no es un problema, todo el personal del hotel siempre está atento y es muy amable ante cualquier requerimiento. El desayuno que sirven es muy completo y es más parecido a un buffet que al típico desayuno continental. La habitacion siempre estuvo muy limpia y en orden. En general un gran lugar para quedarse.

title: En pleno centro
text:
Muy bien ubicado con el metro en la esquina y a mano de todo.
Ofrece agua mineral para llevarte y una manzana de cortesía que en n york no es poca cosa, ademas el desayuno es completo abundante y rico y durante  el día
 tienes café agua caliente y limonada din costo adicional.
La gente de recepción es  amable y alguno habla español.
También esta Antonia que es lstina y habla ademas de ingles perfectamente español y es buenísima.
Esta a la vuelta del empire state pir ejemplo y a cuadras del time squeare.no tiene contra .
Las habitaciones no son amplias pero eso en n york no se cuestiona es n york y estar allí ya es mucho

title: Can’t find fault!
text: Really struggling to find any fault with this hotel. Check in process was smooth & staff   were helpful. We requested to move rooms to a lower floor (we were originally on the 20th floor), due to not being keen on heights and the staff were very accommodating. We were warned that a lower room may result in street noise disturbing us, but we had no problems at all with noise. We had a good view of the Empire State Building from our room. The room was clean, very comfortable & had everything we needed. The breakfast had a good choice & the hot items changed daily. It’s in a perfect location for exploring New York, being a 10 minute walk from the hotel to Times Square. There is also a subway right next to it. Loads of places to eat nearby & just up the street from Macy’s. Would not hesitate to stay again.

title: Not for me
text: Too loud (hotel noise, not including street noises), internet unusable and breakfast mediocre - mostly carbohydrates and no super accommodating to someone gluten free.  No enough help at front desk, so slower problem resolution.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Muy bueno !!!!!
text: Excelente ubicación de un muy buen hotel para conocer y pasear por NYC. A metros de la 34th St que tiene muchos locales y Macys. Cerca de la estaciones de subte Penn station que te conecta con el sur y norte sin problema. La atención en el hotel es muy buena. Muy serviciales. El desayuno es muy bueno y es clave que tiene café y agua caliente las 24hs porq en días fríos llegar de caminar todo el día u tomarse un café caliente es vital. Volvería sin dudarlo si decido volver a la misma zona de NYC.

title: Good tradeoff price - service
text: The rooms are comfortable, the hotel is close to the city center and well connected with public service, the room was nice, wide and comfortable. The breakfast in the morning very tasty and full of different things. Definitely recommend.

title: Très bien situé
text:
Les moins: Climatisation bruyante, chambre petite, pas de restaurants, petit dej pas très varié...
Les plus: métro à côté, au pied de l’empire State building, superbe boutique près de l’hôtel, personnel souriant et très agréable. 
Chambre propre. Literie au top comme toutes les chambres de la chaîne Hilton!

title: Top Lage, nettes Personal
text:
Wir waren für 3 Tage im Hampton Inn.  
Da wir schon häufiger in diesen Hotels untergekommen sind, kann ich sagen, innen ist es genau wie überall.

Frühstück ist inklusive (typisches amerikanisches frühstück), Kaffee und Tee gibt es den ganzen Tag umsonst. 

Das kleine Fitnessstudio hat verschiedene Geräte und war bei unseren Besuch immer leer. 

Die Lage des Hotels ist perfekt um verschiedene Sehenswürdigkeiten fußläufig  zu erreichen. 

Das Empire State Building ist um die Ecke und somit auch in weiter Entfernung zur Orientierung hilfreich. 

Das Personal war freundlich und immer aufmerksam. Absolut empfehlenswert.

title: Basic, serviceable and convenient
text:
Two adults, one teenager, Room 1501, 8 nights in April.

Pros:  excellent location, close to Herald Square metro, 10 minute walk to Penn Station, 15 minute walk to Grand Central.  Breakfast was standard fare; however, they maintained it very well with constant replenishment and tidying up.  Room had adequate temperature control, clean linens, good TV, good wifi.  No problems with reservation or billing.

Cons:  Elevators are constrained, meaning long waits and crowds.  If it stops at your floor, squeeze in because you won't get another chance for several more minutes. This hotel is popular with school groups, so expect lots of teenagers cramming around the breakfast line.

We would choose this hotel again.

title: Small hotel- good not great
text: Super friendly staff, and pretty clean. Our air didn’t work well at well. We let them know it was set on 68 and was 74+ in the room and they mentioned they would look at it while we were out. However, we came back to a room that was 78*F with no moving air and the heat on. The television doesn’t shut off all the way, so it glows and breakfast wasn’t very good. The bed was comfy and the WiFi was fast.

title: Very convenient to everything!
text:
We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn.  We had our car with us.  It was very easy to drive to this location.  The roads are not as congested as other parts of the city and really only one lane is moving since there are delivery trucks double parked in the other lane.  Be aware--they do the parking per 24 hours NOT per night.  We knew this ahead of time so it was OK but you just don't want to be surprised when you get charged another $47 if you get your car later in the day.  The parking garage is one street away.  It is not In/out parking.  They will put your car into a very tight space and roll all the windows down...I don't know why!  

The hotel staff was so wonderful.  They were interested in hearing the reviews about the shows we saw.  Our room was not as tiny as we thought it was going to be.  We were expecting a very small room.  It wasn't.  Elevators are tiny and slow and we'd frequently not be able to fit on them.  Breakfast staff was very nice.  They were on top of the food!  It is a busy hotel!!

We walked everywhere from the hotel.  Never had to use another form of transportation but there is a subway station right outside the door.  Good stay!

title: Family vacation
text: Great location in NY Midtown with easy access to MTA and walking to Times Square, Theaters and Restaurants. Hotel staff is very friendly and service oriented. Great complimentary hot breakfast every morning. Rooms are clean and functional.

title: Gran hotel en una fantástica ciudad
text: Estuvimos 8 días en Marzo. Fue realmente una experiencia muy buena en todo sentido. Excelente ubicación a media cuadra del metro y a 6 del Times Square. Muy cómodo y limpio. La atención, excelente, el personal de recepción se mostró amable y predispuesto, llegamos al hotel un día más tarde de lo previsto a causa de una tormenta de nieve y no hubo ningún inconveniente, nos recibieron con una sonrisa a pesar de que era casi de madrugada. El desayuno muy completo, y todo el día había disponible café, muy útil luego de un día de caminata por el invierno de NY. Por último y para destacar, la atención de Luis y Antonia a la hora del desayuno. Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Very nice rooms for price
text: Had an excellent stay staff very friendly made experance very easy rooms are very clean and price was best I could find only problem was WiFi did not work but not big deal did not spent much time in room

title: Hotel Pulito e centrale buon livello medio
text:
Un Buon albergo in una strada bens ervita dallae metro a poca distanza trovate la linea rossa 1 la linea arancione F D la linea blu (che porta al JFK) quindi la posizione si può definire buona 
in 10 minuti a piedi siete a Times Square e in 5 minuti all? Empire State Building 
L'hotel è pulito e silenzioso si dorme bene se spegne l'aria perchè il ventilconvettore è molto rumoroso noi in inverno (era aprile ma ha anche nevicato) spento andava bene e si stava bene non immagino in estate se bigna tenerlo acceso per il caldo perchè è molto fastidioso
la stanza della colazione è minuscola e la mattina si può far fatica a trovare posto ne hanno un'altra ma quando c'eravamo noi era sempre chiusa
la colazione è sufficiente per noi italiani con pane marmellata e frittata ma l'offerta internazionale è molto scarsa
si trova  a tutte le ore gratuitamente caffè e the nella hall e questo è utile
il prezzo è buono ma ti prelevano senza avviso (in booking non era scritto) una cauzione dalla carta di credito che corrisponde a circa il 20% del costo della stanza che poi restituiscono sulla carta ma questo può creare problemi come a noi sulla disponibilità totale della carta tenetelo a mente
letto comodo bagno grande con phon moltissime prese usb in stanza per cui vi bastano solo i cavi

title: Great location, nice hotel
text: We stayed here in spring of 2017 and it was so nice, we stayed again on our next visit in spring 2018. A short walk from Penn Station, and it is right next to the Herald Square subway station. The hotel is updated and clean. Nice breakfast selections and the staff are all very friendly and helpful with directions. We store bags on arrival and departure day which is easy and a great benefit. We will stay here again on our next visit!

title: Great location at a reasonable price
text: This property is close to Herald Square but fairly quiet. Easy walk to Times Square, Bryant Park, 5th Ave and subway to downtown. Breakfast was convenient with a variety of options. Rooms are small but comfortable.

title: Value and access convenience
text:
Very good value proposition for the accommodations as well as the location.  Like many hotels in this area the layout of the floors is quite tight, not that many rooms and corner rooms have one another's doors almost up against each other, but  once inside the rooms the space is very well used.  The elevator capacity seemed quite adequate even at checkout time (unless one breaks down, I suppose).   The staff was very helpful and accommodated my requests well. This visit was my first use of the e-key feature and it worked very smoothly, combined with e-check-in I can see how it would be a boon if your arrival is at a busy time or after a tiring trip.

This Hampton Inn is part of a cluster of hotels near the end of the block on 35th with access to the Herald Square Subway station within a few feet of the door, which in turn connects to the 33 St. PATH, and is two blocks from Penn Station.  We're talking the very middle of Midtown so getting to and from there to anywhere and getting around town is well taken care of, allowing for better enjoyment of a NY visit.

title: A good value, great location and a friendly staff.
text: A good value and a great location near lots of great shopping and restaurants.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming.  The complimentary breakfast exceeded my expectations.  I'm accustomed to seeing a plate of pastries with a glaze of high fructose corn syrup on each pastry.  But, the breakfast offered two types of coffee, teas, oatmeal with toppings, waffles, protein bars, eggs, sausage, bacon, cereals and more.

title: excelente viaje
text: un hermoso hotel con la mejor ubicacion que me hubiera imaginado, me asomaba desde mi ventana y a 100 metros tenia enfrente el empire state. muy buen servicio, el personal muy amable , a la tarde daban una pequeña merienda  aprte del desayuno completisimo a la mañana. esta entre la 6 y la 5 av a la altura de la 35. a 20 cuadras el central park, a la vuelta el empire y a 10 cuadras todas las tiendas de la 5 avenida, volveria otra vez.

title: Good stay
text: Location is outstanding for this hotel. Across from Macys, right off subway. Service was great, everyone was helpful. It just wasnt thier night. Elevator was broken, water was restricted. It happens, stuff breaks, things need service, etc.

title: 舒適的酒店
text: 酒店地理位置很好，對面是傳統百貨公司Macy's，離時代廣場步行約10分鐘。附近有很多選擇美食。酒店有代收服務，網購時填寫酒店地址，櫃台會幫忙代收。出示Passport 就可以取件，非常方便

title: Fabulous stay
text:
Stayed for 7 nights. Hotel was in a great position, close to everything, including subway and buses. Being able to see The Empire State Building from our room was fantastic. A real bonus
Staff were friendly and so helpful.
Would recommend anytime.

title: Great Location!
text:
The room is clean, quiet & small. Wonderful location, metro on a corner, walk distance of Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State, 24 hours restaurants.Complimentary breakfast simple and nice, and serve it until almost 11 AM. 
Bad... Elevator - 2 small elevators, which clean services shares on breakfast rush hour.
Very safe location.

title: Very Good Value
text: The staff was very helpful and the location is excellent.  The room was clean, and given the price compared to other hotels in the area, the room was an adequate size.  Complimentary breakfast was okay.

title: Excellent location/Comfortable rooms
text: This is a really great, central location to everything. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Times Square. There are a multitude of subway/train entrances around. Great restaurants. Comfortable beds and rooms (rooms are VERY small). Then front desk was veery helpful and kind. It is better to be on higher floors especially during high traffic times - it is hard to catch an elevator with only two serving 20 floors. We had friends on the 6th floor and we were on the top 20th floor. They had to wait 5 times to get an elevator down with their luggage to check out.

title: Great Value for the location
text: Hotel is modern and well decorated.  Very conveniently located.  Rooms and common areas are small but expected in the NYC.  Complimentary breakfast is adequate and does have hot items each morning.  Staff are well dressed and very kind and accommodating.

title: bad night's sleep
text: can hear conversations of other people through the walls, as well as phones ringing and alarm clocks going off.  So while I like the Hampton brand, and have had many good experiences at various locations in the past, and while the people were friendly, I cannot recommend this particular hotel location.

title: Winter Week Visit
text:
The hotel is conveniently located.  It is near the Herald Square subway station (mere steps away) and a few blocks from the Penn Station and Madison Square Gardens.  Access to the sites was extremely easy from here.
We had a king-size room that faced the Empire State Bldg.  The only downside is that you hear NYC traffic and rubbish pick up at night (what do you expect?  You're in New York).  Otherwise, the hotel was quiet expect for that rare door closing.  Each floor has about eight rooms.
The room was a typical size and was comfortable.  The room had a large safe (big enough for a laptop), but no refrigerator.
Breakfast is the typical fare with the waffle maker, eggs, meat, etc.
They have a fitness room open 24 hours which I didn't visit after walking all over NYC.
Would I stay here again?  Yes.

title: Excellent stay
text: We live locally in Brooklyn but had some personal matters to take care of in manhattan. This hotel was confidently located and it was a great choice. The front desk staff was wonderful and friendly, the hotel room was comfortable and clean. The coffee area and the breakfast area was very clean. The breakfast was very good and the breakfast staff was very accommodating. All in all this was an excellent stay.

title: Incompetence at it's finest
text:
I never actually got to stay here, despite having a confirmed booking. Here's why:

After driving all day from Washington DC to NYC, I arrived to the hotel to find my booking had been cancelled with no warning. Supposedly my credit card declined the day before, and "we tried to contact you", but it didn't decline, and they clearly did not try and contact me. 

They they claimed that because I had an international number, they were unable to contact me, and supposedly that's the end of it. I'm sorry, but New York is a city full of international visitors, not all of which have American phones. Despite being an Australian number, they still could have called me, or sent a text, or an email, or whatsapp, or carrier pidgeon, or whatever. But nothing, no communication whatsoever.

I also believe they were overbooked and had to bump someone but chose this excuse so they wouldn't have to follow the Hilton walk procedure (ie, secure alternative accommodation, pay for the first night, pay for my transport to the alternative hotel), but no, I was left with nothing, not even an apology from the front desk staff, nowhere to sleep that night, and a piss-weak attempt to help me book something else.

I was able to source my own alternative accommodation elsewhere with no help from the useless staff.

After attempting to settle this without a public domain, by emailing the GM, almost a month went by with no response, so here we are now.

As a Gold Hilton Honors member, I honestly expected better.

title: Hyvä hotelli keskeisellä paikalla
text: Hyvää Hampton laatua New Yorkin ytimessä. Huoneessa oli näkymä Empire State Buildingiin ja kyllähän torni sieltä vastapäisen talon takaa näkyikin. Hamptonien tapaan hintaan kuuluva aamiainen on aina bonusta Ameriikassa. Suosittelen ja varmasti menen toistekin.

title: Friends Trip to New York
text: It's the first time that I stay at this hotel. In general it is excellent, good location, good treatment and good cost. The kindness of its employees and the human warmth distinguish them. When I return to New York, I will definitely stay in it, I recommend it.

title: Es un hotel con excelente ubicación, limpio y bien atendido!
text:
Hotel muy práctico, fue una gran elección y volvería a elegirlo sin dudas!

Cerca a pie de muchas atracciones, negocios y rodeada de subtes para movilizarse.
La habitación estaba perfecta, era un poquito pequeña pero tenía todo lo necesario. Baño completo, calefacción, tv, y camas espectaculares (muuuy cómodas). La limpieza era muy buena!
El desayuno me pareció muy completo y el señor que lo maneja fue muy amable...
La atención del personal era excelente, siempre predispuestos a ayudarte.

Lo recomiendo y sin dudas volvería a elegirlo!

title: Great location and room.
text: The staff was super nice, the room was clean and comfortable. We loved the area!  Very close to the Theater district and Penn Station.  We walked to lots of places and plenty of restaurants nearby.  The korean restaurant next door was delicious.

title: Great Location
text: This is the perfect location in New York. We were able to walk to most places we wanted to see. The staff was friendly and the rooms were small, but clean. We would come back without a doubt. The walls were somewhat thin, so you could hear loud noises in the next room, but it wasn't obnoxious. We were very pleased with the value of hotel.

title: Estadia maravilhosa!
text: Amei esse hotel! Café da manhã delicioso, cama maravilhosa, banho excelente, funcionários super atenciosos e prestativos, em especial Luís e Jamal. Voltaria mil vezes. Muito bem localizado, ao lado do metrô.

title: Наконец-то хороший отель в Нью-Йорке!
text:
Была в Нью-Йорке уже два раза, но предыдущие отели совершенно не понравились, хотя расположены были также в центре Манхэттена.
Наконец, с третьего раза замечательный отель!
Hampton Inn на W 35 street, помимо прекрасного расположения, понравился следующим:
- хороший завтрак (омлет, сосиски - что в Нью-Йорке не часто встретишь)
- круглосуточно бесплатные чай и кофе, а к вечеру на ресепшн появлялся поднос с печеньем. 
- кофеварка и кофе в номере, причем был обычный кофе плюс кофе без кофеина, что было очень кстати вечером.
- внимательный приветливый персонал.
- хорошая уборка в номере.
- в номере три большие настольные лампы, причем на каждой - электрическая розетка, так что мест для зарядки хватало.

Неожиданным было то, что помимо платы за номер у меня на карте заблокировали еще $200 - сказали, что это типа на всякий случай, по $50 за ночь, и в течение недели эти деньги будут разблокированы. Нигде про это не было написано. Пока неделя не прошла, так что жду.

title: Good Location No Frills
text:
The hotel is a bit cramped for space. You would realize that on the floor lobby but given the location and cost I guess that is expected. Walking distance from Times Square, Grand Central Terminus and Herald Square Subway station. You could even take a walk till the Staten Island Ferry terminal or Central Park from here I you like.

The rooms are well maintained and clean.

The staff is courteous.

The complimentary buffet is good. You must try the Cinnamon cakes.

title: Great Location was clean but being renovated
text: The location was excellent, the place was clean but it was being renovated, so wall paper was half on and carpet was left  in rolls without signs, I tripped and almost fell.  The hilton group was good at handling the issue and overall it was pleasant.  I am sure it is 100% now.

title: Good budget place for short business trip
text: Very good location, bang in the center of Manhattan. Ideal for business travelers. Slightly cramped for space, but the staff was courteous. This place might not suit families as much, since there is not much by way of additional amenities that kids enjoy, but definitely worth a look if you are on a budget.

title: Excellent Value plus Very Clean
text:
I have stayed here numerous times in the past. The rooms are small but adequate (it’s New York City), you’re just there to sleep and get ready to work or just have fun. The breakfast is “OK”, nothing exceptional. The price though is great for the location. And,my room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. 

One thing that did bother me was the clock in the room. It was set one hour later than it was. You would think housekeeping would have noticed that.

title: Ótima localização
text: Gostei bastante do hotel, que na minha opinião, fica em ótima localização para fazer muitas coisas a pé em NYC O metrô está a poucos metros. Não foi possível early check-in, mas guardaram nossas malas para passearmos enquanto o quarto não estava pronto. O quarto é bom, cama confortável, talvez um pouco pequeno para um casal com 2 malas grandes, mas é uma situação contornável. Vale lembrar que não tem frigobar. Bons amenities da Neutrogena no banheiro. Café da manhã na média, economiza tempo e dinheiro, apesar de ser repetitivo. Funcionários cordiais. Minha única ressalva foi que solicitei um quarto com vista pro Empire State ou mesmo um andar mais alto para ver a rua... porém, me colocaram no 3º andar sem vista nem para o céu. Como não fiquei muito tempo no hotel, não foi tão comprometedor, mas fiquei um pouquinho decepcionada. Solicitei a reserva de um táxi para o aeroporto e correu tudo bem e o motorista foi pontual. Talvez um pouco mais caro que a média: 95 dólares, mas paga-se pela comodidade de ter o carro à sua espera na hora combinada. No geral, recomendo. É um hotel correto e com bom preço.

title: 'Premium Location
text: The hotel is ideally located almost in the intersection of 35th street, Broadway and avenue of the américas (6th ave). Really close to Macy's and many other stores (such as H&M, Victoria's Secret, etc.), as well as to the subway and bike rental points. It was a really pleasant stay.

title: Good NYC hotel.
text: We like the location. Rooms are big as far as an NYC hotel goes but bathrooms a little small. Free breakfast has a decent variety and is fresh. Beds comfy and has plenty of pillows. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Melhor custo x benefício
text: Provavelmente o melhor hotel de Manhattan pelo preço que pagamos. 1) Café da manhã bem bom incluso. 2) Wifi incluso, com sinal satisfatório no nosso quarto. 3) Café/chá/chocolate quente 24h no saguão. 4) O banho era bem bom. 5) O quarto tinha um tamanho razoável (em Manhattan tem muito hotel com "quarto cubículo") e era limpo diariamente. 6) Ótima localização, bem perto de várias estações do metrô e a menos de 50m do Empire State Building, então dava pra fazer muita coisa a pé sem maiores problemas. Enfim, definitivamente voltaria ao mesmo hotel.

title: Location is great
text: Hotel is close to Macys, a subway station and the Empire state building.  It is within walking distance of Times square, Grand Central Station and the Rockefeller building.The beds were very comfortable,staff was helpful and the breakfast was wonderful. the price was very reasonable.

title: Great location for business and/or pleasure
text: This was my first time at this Hampton Inn property in NYC.  I can't remember when I've had a more central location during my many stays in Manhattan.  It's on W 35th St, almost at the corner of 6th Ave.  It's close to all of the west side subway lines, a block up from Macy's Herald Square, the Empire State Building, the Garment District.  I loved the convenience.  The staff gets an A ++.  I got a friendly greeting, a room upgrade, friendly hellos and goodbyes on my entries and exits and, even the housekeeping and dining area staffs, were friendly and cordial.  The morning breakfast buffet was good and ample.  Fruit, cereal, selection of breads, waffles, variety of egg offerings, sausage, bacon, etc.  Nothing was left out.  Amazingly enough, even as busy as the property was, the dining space was well executed and planned.  I never found myself without a place to sit and eat.  The rooms are small, but that's New York.  My compliments to the management team on a well run property.  I will be back!

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 2 children and I was very pleasantly surprised.
The location is fantastic for exploring New York.
The hotel rooms are quite small but for the price you cannot grumble.
The breakfast was great, nice selection every morning.
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Decent hotel
text: Quite old property but good hotel. Located in Manhattan so good for business & tourism. Subway is very near. Rooms are of decent size. Stay was comfortable. Place to stay again n again. As such no complaints but some modern changes are required.

title: Everything I needed.
text: In town celebrating my daughter's birthday, got in on an early flight, got to the hotel and was fortunate enough to get a room early! The staff was great, the free breakfast was pretty good, but most importantly we were so close to everything we wanted to do. There was a subway stop just steps from the hotel so we were able to move about freely.  I picked this spot due to proximity to Penn Station (we flew into Newark), and I'm so glad I did.  The price was better than any hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC, will definitely be returning.

title: Convenient location!
text: Great value! Great complimentary breakfast. View of Empire State Building. Steps away from the subway right in the heart of Herald Square! Awesome restaurant Mew next door. Best sushi i’ve Ever had. Very helpful and polite staff. Great stay!

title: Perfect NYC staff
text: Couldn’t have asked for a more perfect stay - even before we arrived.  We went to the city for the weekend to celebrate our daughter’s birthday and our younger child came down with the dreaded stomach bug days before departure.  Having booked through the Hitlon Honors app, the free cancellation period had just passed, but I called the hotel and Ashley, one of the managers, expressed genuine concern for my younger daughter’s health and reassured me that as long as we kept in contact with her and if indeed we weren’t going to make it, to just call the morning of.  Thankfully we did not need to and got on the train and rode the 2 hours into the city from our home. A quick 15 minute walk from Grand Central and we arrived at the hotel.  The front desk staff were amazing.  I had read reviews about “no fridges in the rooms” - all you have to do is ask my friends! We were fortunate that they still had some available and a member from the maintenance team immediately delivered it after we got to our room! The room is a good size for a New York City room - not overly spacious but good enough for a family of 4 for the weekend who wouldn’t be in the room except to sleep and shower.  On two occasions, front desk staff ran stuff up to our room (shower cap and a new key card) and even after we checked out, held on to our bags free of charge.  We did not partake in the breakfast, as we wanted to nosh on authentic NY bagels and explore Chelsea Market.  After checking out of our room, we came back to the hotel after a final stroll and one of the gentlemen at the desk overhead my 4 year old saying she needed to use the bathroom and without us even having to ask, he produced a key card so we could access the bathroom on the lower level.  Such a great staff!  Thank you all sincerely for making our trip a wonderful experience!

title: Muito bom
text: Achei o preço bom para o local que está. Fica em frente a Macys e a 10 min da times square.  Pena que estava muito fruo para ficar andando. O metrô tb é próximo, uns 50m. Na portaria água e café a vontade. Café da manhã de americano com waffle. Cama e travesseiros bons. Banho bom dentro da banheira,  padrão. Gostei bastante

title: Great location and a terrific value!
text: Here’s the scoop - less than $100 per night with AAA discount for this visit, 35th and 6th location next to subway station, free coffee, clean room, comfy bed, very good tv and real cable. This hotel is a great value near midtown. Is it a suite at the Ritz? No. It is a very nice mid-range hotel. It’s a Hampton and they tend to be as consistent here as anywhere. I’ve been here several times and always very nice. Absolutely no issues.

title: Ótimo Hotel
text: Quarto bom, banheiro bom com banheira, limpeza diária com troca de toalhas, café da manhã bom, localização excelente, atendimento das recepcionistas perfeito, nada a reclamar, quando voltar a nova York me hospedarei lá com certeza.

title: Wonderful hidden gem!
text:
My whole stay here was amazing!  The staff were amazing, they were so friendly and helpful.
My room was clean, looked new & updated.  I even had a great view of the Empire state building.
The cost was great, especially as it had a free cold & hot breakfast included too.
I liked that it was half a block from a major subway line, close to Madison Square Garden & Penn Station & also walking distance to Times Square.  Perfect location!

title: Awesome Location!
text:
This was a great choice for my NYC trip!  Ask for a front facing room and you will have the Empire State Building to your left and the original Macy’s to your right.  

The subway is half a block away.  This particular subway station, Herald Square, frequently has city approved subway musicians.  We heard some fantastic talent as we went to and from the trains. 

Grand Central Station was within easy walking distance, and Park Avenue is nearby. There is high end shopping within a block or two, and many,many restaurants from cheap to fancy.  This is in Koreatown, so the block has several Korean Restaurants. 

The hotel itself was clean and the staff was friendly. It has a free breakfast that includes hot and cold items. 

My only complaint is that the alarm clock got turned on for an unexpected and unwelcome early morning wake up two mornings, so check the alarm clock before you go to sleep.  

This was an affordable place to stay and was an excellent choice for the sightseeing I wanted to do.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Sin duda la ubicación es increíble a pasos de macy's y a pocas cuadras de los principales puntos turísticos a los que en su mayoría se puede llegar caminando. De todas maneras tiene la estación de subte en la esquina. El hotel tiene un desayuno correcto. Las habitaciones son algo pequeñas y no tienen frigobar. La limpieza es muy buena . Todo el personal super amables y bien predispuestos . La mayoría habla español y son muy serviciales . El hotel recibe paquetes.

title: What a great experience
text: I stayed at this hotel for a meeting across the street at Pfizer. They could not have been more helpful to me. I needed copies, not problem they let me go into the sales office and make them. I needed a special diet, no problem. and, everything was done with a big smile.

title: Very pleased
text:
Spacious room by NYC standards. Complimentary breakfast was substantial. The bed was comfortable abd the bathroom was quite large. Elevator was quick. The location is superb with many restaurants near by, great shopping area and subway is steps from building. 
Only disappointments were that pillows were not goose down, and there was no bar on site.

title: Good Value Hotel in Midtown
text:
Good value for money. Convenient location in Midtown. NY has very good transport system-you can walk or take a bus/subway to most areas in Manhattan from the 34th St. station.Service was good and staff were vey helpful. Breakfast was OK and not boring- they change the main fare everyday day (either bacon,sausage,etc). Hot Coffee/Tea were available throughout the day near the reception.

Rooms are clean but a little tight even for one person. Busy Elevators sometimes - but you can always take the stairs if you're in a hurry.

title: Good location for Empire State & Times Square
text:
We split our week in NYC at two different hotels so that we could get a feel of the city.  
The hotel is almost at the end of the street and you can miss it if you are not looking!  It sits back further than some of the other buildings on the street.  
There is outside seating as well as a couple of chairs in the lobby as well as a bar/restaurant.  
The receptionist were nice and helpful at checking.  Our room attendant was very courteous as well.  
You can also purchase snacks and food at the pantry beside the front desk.  
There are less than ten rooms on each floor but the elevators do take quite a while so if you are in a hurry, you may want to take the steps if you are on a lower floor.  
The business center and gym are a floor below the front desk area.  
The rooms were standard, beds, desk, microwave and refrigerator.  
Our room didn't have much of a view.  We were directly facing a classroom for a school right across the street.  
The next block over is the largest Macy's, a mall and several other shopping stores.  The Empire State Building is about two blocks away.  There are several restaurants and souvenir shops that are just a couple minutes away, by foot.  
Times Square is a short walk as well and it is advised to just walk, if able, or take the subway, which is  pretty much right at the hotel, instead of taking a taxi, Uber or lyft. You will spend more time in a taxi, due to traffic, and could have already walked and be enjoying your destination.   
There was constant trash on the street, daily, waiting for pick up which was a drawback. The light switches were filthy so good thing I always travel with Clorox wipes and Lysol spray.  There were a couple of areas that could have used a good cleaning.  
The authorization hold ($50 per night) took a few business days before it was released.  
Overall the stay was ok as we were not in the room much.  If the hotel was offering a cheap price, I could possibly consider staying here again.

title: Great staff, amazing breakfast, thanks Antonia!
text:
Very friendly, helpful, considerate staff.

Fabulous, yummy breakfast, delicious waffles, cooked breakfast, fresh fruit.  Antonia does a wonderful job looking after everyone.

Loved the  24/7 hot drink area, a favourite to help us unwind after a busy day in NY.

Great cleaners, helpful, nothing too much trouble, would highly recommend.

title: Overall satisfies with my stay.
text: Friendly and pleasant environment. Good location to be in central New York when one wants to sight see or shop. The staff were welcoming, courteous and helpful. Reasonably sized rooms for New York, where rooms are usually small.

title: Ottimo sia per turismo che per affari
text:
Inizio col dire che è centralissimo: posizionato sulla 35th Street, a pochi metri dall’uscita si trova subito la metro chei porta verso Manhattan sud e Brooklyn, sia verso nord quindi Central Park e Columbus Circle. 

Attraversando la strada si hanno di fronte i grandi magazzini Macy’s, e a pochi metri ristoranti, banca, farmacia, etc. Alle spalle della palazzina c’è l’Empire State Building. Insomma a piedi si possono raggiungere moltissime mete turistiche ma è comodo anche a chi, come me, va per altro e necessita di una soluzione centrale.

Per quanto riguarda l’hotel, è un Hampton Inn by Hilton quindi fatto con lo stampo ma, a differenza di alcune camere di alberghi (anche di note catene) a Manhattan, queste sono grandi e comode come pure i bagni. La camera era dotata di macchinetta del caffè (quella con i filtri per intenderci), tavola e ferro da stiro, cassaforte, wifi ottimo, letto e cuscini comodi, televisore mega-schermo. Nel bagno vi era la vasca il cui unico problema (oltre la mancanza del bidet per noi Italiani è terrificante ma ce ne dobbiamo fare una ragione…) è stata la doccia che ha bisogno di un certo ragionamento per essere capita ed inoltre è fissa e troppo alta. Fornito anche di prodotti da toletta.

Un unico neo: sul copriletto due piccole macchie (non so se di sangue) che ho fotografato.

Questo hotel è distribuito chiaramente su più piani (credo oltre 14 ma io stavo all’ottavo quindi non ricordo bene il numero), ha una sala fitness nel seminterrato, angolo con computer e stampante dedicata agli ospiti vicino alla reception.
Inoltre se come me siete soliti prendere l’ultimo volo del giorno qui potete lasciare i bagagli (senza costo aggiunto).

La colazione (non tutti gli alberghi la includono a NY) buona con piatti caldi e freddi (tanta frutta e waffles che potete farvi da soli); varie sale ove potersi rilassare per prendervi un caffè.
Infatti hanno  creato un piccolo angolo bar/self-service dove vi sono 3 distributori di caffè caldo (normale, forte e decaffeinato e il quarto di acqua calda per il tea o per allungare il caffè), contenitore con monovaschette di latte, dispenser con aroma di vaniglia e mandorla per il cappuccino, vari tipi di tea e un distributore di acqua ghiacciata. Questo mini bar è disponibile 24h senza costo aggiunto per tutti gli ospiti dell’hotel.

Relativamente al personale devo ringraziare tutti, nessuno escluso, per la cortesia, gentilezza e disponibilità che ci hanno dimostrato.
Albergo nel quale presto ritornerò (anche se c'è stato il problema de copriletto) e che consiglio a tutti, soprattutto alle famiglie.

title: Great stay.  Good value.
text:
I had a great stay.  Good value.  The room was clean and updated nicely with quality bedding and bathroom items. The Hampton Inn breakfast is adequate and similar to other Hampton Inns I have stayed in.  The breakfast is a hot self serve style breakfast.  The items change from day-to-day. The hotel does not have dining options, but there are so many in the immediate area.    I will stay here again because of the room comfort, staff, and location.  Don't try to pack your family into one room.   You should not expect a boutique experience at this hotel.  Choose elsewhere if you are celebrating a special occasion that requires spa amenities and cocktail lounge.  I would definitely stay here with SO but would set expectations that it is our comfortable crash pad and entertainment will be found elsewhere.
Tip: I had a room on the 4th floor and it was very easy to exit and enter the hotel.  The lobby is small which is good for coming and going.  Don't expect a grand entrance.

title: 口コミ通り
text: 立地と朝食、ドリンクサービス最優先で選びました。価格も立地やサービスの割にリーズナブルです！部屋も綺麗で、想像よりは広く快適でした！バスタブも広く、スーパーで買ったバスボムを使って寛げました。地下鉄の出口からすぐなので、何処へ行くにも便利。午前中はエレベーターが混み合うので、低層階が良いかもです。歯ブラシや歯磨き粉も、フロントに言えば貰えるので助かりました。ドラックストアやスーパーも近いです。また泊まりたいです。

title: Convenient NYC hotel
text:
Although room was small, it was typical for this price.   Very clean and quiet.  Glad that breakfast was included.  Saved time.  Was able to walk to our destinations. 
Would stay here again.  If we had brought the car, there were parking facilities close by.

title: AÑO NUEVO EN MANHATAN
text: Estuvimos hospedados de diciembre 29 a enero 5 de 2018, una estadía más que grata, el hotel no podía estar mejor ubicado, atrás del Empire State (nuestra habitación en el piso 8 tenía una vista excelente del edificio) entre la 5th y 6th avenida lo cual nos daba montones de oportundades en cuanto a compras y alimentación, a un lado del hotel la estación del metro con lo cual la movilidad fue insuperable sobre todo con el invierno tan fuerte que nos tocó.  Las instalaciones del hotel buenísimas, limpio, organizado, todo funcionando perfectamente, nuestra habitación impecable cada día y con todo lo que podíamos necesitar, la atención el el front desk inmejorable atentos a todas nuestras necesidades y a darnos cualquier indicación que necesitáramos, pero lo mejor de nuestra estadía en este sitio fue Antonia todo el tiempo con una sonrisa amable y una actitud dispuesta para hacer nuestra visita lo más cómoda posible, es increíble encontrar personas como estas en un hotel que te hacen la vida mas fácil y alegre en una ciudad que no es la tuya. Sin dudarlo les recomiendo a todos este hotel no podría pensar en otro mejor por todas sus facilidades.

title: Brill hotel
text: Staff brilliant at this hotel, especially Griselle and Ashley in particular. Nothing was a trouble for any of the staff, very helpful especially with navigating around the city and transport back to the airport. Rooms decent sized and clean however could do with more wardrobe space, my mum and I stayed in a family room (2 double beds), and only a narrow wardrobe with only 6 hangers. Fab location - 7 blocks to times square which took about ten mins walking, subway 30 seconds away. Breakfast okay, could have had more options for hot food but as it was no extra cost can't complain too much. Brilliant stay here would definately recommend and stay here again!

title: Trip Of A Lifetime ~ Extremely Disappointed
text: 14 night stay was extremely disappointed. Lifts took forever, reception staff not very helpful, treated poorly, breakfast area disgusting, heard next door room, will never stay or recommend to anyone.

title: Confortable dormida
text: Cómodo, limpio y tranquilo.  El desayuno justo y necesario.  Tuvimos inconvenientes con el aire acondicionado pero nos solucionaron  el problema casi de inmediato.  La ubicación es muy buena. Siempre tienen un buen cafe.

title: Great experience and planning on returning
text: Spent ten days during the busy holiday season and found the staff most helpful and friendly.  By the time we left, I felt like they were family!  I was unsure of the location before booking, but was completely satisfied with it because it is right by a many subway lines, great restaurants, and walking distance to many sites.

title: Happy new year
text: Nous avons passe 6 nuits dans cet hôtel tout a été bien super bien placé chambre faite tous les jours petit déjeuner très copieux et varié eau chaude et fraîche et café à disposition toute la journée séjour excellent vue sur l empire state Building

title: All good
text: We experienced no problems at all during our stay between Xmas and New Year and thoroughly enjoyed the free hot drinks in the lobby, especially since it was freezing cold in NY.  Staff were all excellent, free hot breakfast was good enough, wifi ws OK - could be better, room was good.

title: Great Location!!
text: Visited around Christmas time. Very cozy hotel amidst the busiest part of New York City. Located right opposite Macy’s on 34th Street. Very polite staff and breakfast was good. Rooms are small which is expected in New York . But very clean and well maintained. Only elevators were slow. All the major attractions are closeby. Times Square is only a few blocks away. Herald square station is right next to the hotel. Overall, worth every dollar spent on the stay.

title: Great family stay
text: Stayed here to take my daughters to see the Christmas lights, window displays and Christmas spectacular.  The room was small but clean and the beds were very comfortable. Staff was welcoming and friendly and the complimentary breakfast was hot and delicious with several options. Would stay here again!

title: Overall great place to stay.
text: Great location, we had two queen beds and the room was a decent size. Nice bathroom, view of the Empire State Building from our room on the 15th floor. Clean hotel, friendly helpful staff. Windows did a great job of silencing the city noise which was great at night. Really can’t fault it, and would stay here again.

title: Muito agradavel!
text: Otima localização, com metro na esquina.  O hotel é muito agradavel, funcionarios simpaticos e um bom cafe da manha.  Quando chegamos nos deram um quarto do lado da maquina de gelo, mas devido ao barulho pedimos para mudar de quarto e fomos prontamente atendidas. Cama muito confortavel e quarto silencioso e limpo. Vou voltar com certeza!

title: NYC with small kids
text: Hotel was excellent, Location was close to everything and times square, Bryant park and empire State building within walking distance. Train station one block from Hotel. we took the yellow cab for JFK to hotel in midtown Manhattan and it was 62.50 plus tip. the only thing as you must expect is the traffic but overall was good.

title: 1st floor and early breakfast only!
text: With just 2 elevators for 20 floors and 160 rooms DO NOT book any room above the 1st floor! As for breakfast: make sure you arrive early and no later than 6:30 a.m. or be prepared to eat standing up! Room size was also deficient: our King Bed room was as large as some hotel bathrooms we have been in! Location near penn station and 34th street somewhat made up for hotel deficiency but.....

title: Forget breakfast - quality very poor
text: Great location.  Rooms average.  Room not ready upon arrival.  Manager attentive and handled this matter promptly.  Breakfast food was well below a typical Hampton standard.  HVAC very noisy.  Long elevator wait.

title: Great Location
text: We frequently stay with Hampton Inn, and chose this one specifically for its location.  It was convenient to subway stations, and walking distance to major attractions, including Macy's, and about 15 blocks from Times Square.  The breakfast varied each day, but always offered us many options to fuel up, which allowed us to eat a later lunch and a light dinner.  The only downside is that one of the elevators was out of order for our 4 day stay, which made for lengthy waits getting to and from the 14th floor.

title: Great hotel in a central location
text:
Have just returned from this great little hotel.It is just  few minutes walk to Macy’s. Victoria Secrets is even closer as is the subway .
Times square ten minute walk away.
Empire State Building a five minute walk away.
The hotel is basic no frills Very clean,excellent staff who are all extremely helpful with maps taxis advice etc.
Self service breakfast is included with fresh fruit ,cereals hot food and waffles ,it was a really good start to the day.
Lower floor street facing rooms were noisy with traffic if you are a  light sleeper,
we were quickly moved to a higher floor when we told reception with no problem(great service)
Very good value for money ,would definitely stay here again and recommend,especially for the convenient location for everything.
Great little Irish pub a few doors away very good food and atmosphere 
(Lifts can be a little slow but this is only a very minor negative )

title: Feel Ripped off.
text: AVOID this hotel. Overpriced. I've stayed in $100 hotels that are nicer. Noisy heat system. Lobby was tiny and cluttered. Breakfast looked terrible, so went to another hotel where friends stayed and that hotel did not charge me after I shared my experience with them. The staff was very nice and not their fault.

title: So glad we chose this hotel
text: This hotel exceeded our expectations. Wonderful location, staff, rooms, etc. I was very surprised by how close and convenient it was to EVERYTHING. We literally walked and took the subway all over NEW YORK

title: overspending on a hotel in new york
text: dirty room, torn sheets, elevators not working and other fun things to make the stay so enjoyable. and my room was 399.00 a night. great location, but a lot like staying in a youth hostel, but a youth hostel is nicer.

title: Muy buena ubicación y buena calidad / precio
text: Hemos pasado una semana varias familias con niños en el Hampton de la calle 35. Lo mejor del hotel es su ubicación. El trato del personal ha sido muy bueno ( sobre todo la amabilidad de Antonia ) y casi todos hablan español. Las habitaciones no son muy grandes pero las camas son muy confortables. El desayuno buffet no tiene tanta variedad como los hoteles de España pero para ser en NY ( que no suelen incluir desayuno ), es bastante decente. En resumen es un hotel muy recomendable para viajar al NY por un precio razonable.

title: 👍🏻
text: Muy bueno el hotel y el personal excelente, siempre bien predispuesto y con una sonrisa. Nuestra habitación siempre limpia y ordenada. El desayuno excelente siempre había mucha variedad para elegir. La hubicacione es una de las mejores

title: Great "little" hotel
text:
First of all this is a 3 star hotel so many amenities are missing. That said, the hotel is perfectly located just off Herald Square litterally "2 steps" from Macy"s and all the shopping on 34th street. Subway entrance is right on the corner. I stayed 8 nights and although my room was on the second floor facing the street it was not noisy. The room was very large, clean, the bed comfortable, HD tv, plenty of drawer space and had a safe and coffee machine. Breakfast was included and there was a large and tasty selection. Antonia was in charge of keeping the buffet well supplied and always had a smile and "good morning" for everyone. There was a glitch in the beginning with housekeeping but after I complained Mirna - the head of housekeeping- came to see me personally and apologized. After that I got towels shaped like a heart on my bed. Now that's customer service! The front desk staff were very pleasant and always helpful. The only thorn on the rose were the elevators. Only 2 old and slow ones to service 20 floors of guests so there were many times when the wait was very long. They really should install new elevators.
If you're not looking for grand entrances, large lobbies, uniformed bell boys and in house restaurants but want a very nice, cozy, perfectly located and reasonably priced (for NYC) hotel - this is definitely for you.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I can not complain about a single thing at this hotel, room was beautiful customer service was excellent. Thank you guys keep up the good work. I will stay here Everytime I'm in the city.... You can not go wrong with booking a room at this location.

title: Hampton Inn is always a good choice.
text: Convenient location to 5th Avenue and Macy's; clean, safe, quiet; staff is professional and very helpful. Has the normal amenities (Wi-Fi, breakfast, coffee any time of day or night, small computer bank - great for printing out boarding passes). Would stay there again and would recommend to others.

title: Fine hotel, nothing especially good or bad
text: Fine hotel, nothing especially good or bad. The location was fine. Rooms a bit small. No refrigerator. Breakfast average. I wouldn't run to choose this hotel again but also wouldn't not gonthere if the rate was good

title: a misstep in the hilton chain
text: things don't always go right everywhere you stay. I've always had good luck with the hampton inn and suites and I will stay there again but not at this location. sometimes it's just a few small things that can put a sour taste in your mouth. The location is great for shopping at Macy's.

title: Hampton Inn/Herald Square is the place to stay
text: We have stayed at this hotel the last 6 years when we visit NYC. Maria, at the front desk, is just awesome. She is wonderful and very helpful. We are sad that she is leaving the Hampton but we are happy for her on her new job. The breakfast is just that, a full breakfast. Eggs, sausage, bagels, bananas, yogurt, ceral, oatmeal, waffles, OJ and other breakfast items.  Luiz, in the breakfast bar, is also awesome. He is very friendly and we look forward to meeting up with both Luiz and Maria when we are in New York.  Luiz keeps the food stocked and the area clean. It seems like he is always moving and getting things filled or cleaned.  My family is very fond of both Luiz and Maria in case you couldn't tell. The only thing I wish could change at the Hampton is the slow elevator but it's such a great place to stay so it doesn't bother me as much.

title: Can’t beat convenience to SUBWAY!
text: Location Location Location!! I can always navigate myself back to this hotel. Subways can be very confusing but most stop right here just steps away from your room makes it really nice for little breaks

title: Excelente ubicación , personal y calidad humana
text: El personal del destino inmejorable !!! Luis súper agradable y atento también Antonia y en el from desk la atención de maria , Griselda súper amables y destacó a Emanuel de la noche que aunque no habla esoañol se hizo entender y solucionó todos nuestros inconvenientes !!! Genio

title: Excellent Stay in the City
text: What a great experience we had at this Hampton Inn.  We usually are very pleased with the consistency we have had with them across the country.  This stay was no difference.  The staff could not have been better or the accomodations.

title: Great location but older and dated
text: The locations was 5 star!! The staff were all exceptional, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great with lots of choices and everything was fresh, and the hot food was hot, and the cold food was cold!

title: Hhmmm
text: Think my new creditcard got skimmed here. No proof, but  never used it before I used it to pay for my room at the hotel. Anyway, good location. The location is good. Small room. Breakfast is a 4 out of 10.

title: In Need of Renovation
text: The condition of this hotel falls far below what I expect of Hampton Inn.  The room was small and very worn.  Wall paper is peeling badly in the hall ways and to a less extent in the room.  Carpets are old and worn, and curtains are old and dingy.  But bathroom seemed to have been more recently renovated and was clean.  We had wanted a king bed, but only 2 doubles were available upon check in.  Neither bed was very comfortable.    Staff, however, was courteous and helpful throughout our stay.  Check inane check out was easy and quick.  Baggage holding was handled very well both for pre-checkin and post checkout.

title: MUY BUENO y RECOMENDABLE
text:
Estuvimos dos semanas disfrutando de NYC y del Hampton Inn. Nos concedieron una habitacion en el piso 19, confortable, con una cama de muy buen tamaño, cofre de seguridad, plancha con su tabla, un escritorio y apoya maletas incluido. Pedimos una heladerita que nos instalaron, sin cargo en 3 minutos.
El personal casi en su totalidad habla español favoreciendonos toda nuestra estadia, destaco a  Antonia y Luis en el desayunador por su buena onda.
En el lobby las 24hs habia cafe y agua fria para reponerse de las largas caminatas por Manhattan un detalle que me parecio de categoria.
