text: Hotel muito bem localizado, a poucos passos do metrô, da Macys e de muitas atrações. O quarto é pequeno, mas limpo e confortável, com produtos de higiene de qualidade. Inclui na tarifa café da manhã bem servido, o que é raro em Nova Iorque.

title: Another good Hamton stay.
text: I seem to always have good luck with Hampton and this was no exception.  Clean and comfortable room, helpful pleasant staff, and a good breakfast included.  I booked when they were having a sale, so it was as expensive as it could have been, so that helped as well.  It is NYC though.

title: parfait
text: le mot " top " est le résumer de tous les services le personnels est génial et d'une gentillesse. le wifi fonctionne très bien l'emplacement est idéal , tout est à porter de marche les chambres sont spacieuses et propres le déjeuner est un peu juste mais en vue des qualité de services fournies , ca passe

title: Отлично
text: Очень уютный отель. Имеются завтраки с 7 до 11. И круглосуточно можешь налить себе кофе, какао или чай совершенно бесрлатно. Номер видовой и чистый. Каждый день уборка. Есть сейф, гладильные принадлежности, маленький фитнес зал. Персонал приветливый.

title: Ok but......
text: Room was half the size of what Hampton Inn usually provides but double the cost. I know it is the location but.....REALLY. All else was what we normally expect from Hampton. Bigger room would have been nice or lower the cost.

title: Very comfortable hotel!
text: We stayed at the hotel for 10 days, while we were visiting New York. We are from Denmark and are used to High standards. This hotel is both with great service and is very well placed in NYC. Especially the service were excellent - Antonia, the morning waitress, made our stay unforgetable! The wifi was not so good, but otherwise it was perfect. Thank you Hampton inn <3

title: Great hotel in midtown
text: Upon arrival room was changed to 19th floor with a view and opposed to the original assigned room. Subway is within 30 yards. View of Empire State Building from room was nice( decorated in red, white and blue for Memorial Day weekend. Breakfast was good, bed and pillows were fantastic and best of all was Hector the front desk employee who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable!!

title: Location, location, location!
text:
We have stayed here booth times when we vistited NY. The location is great! It's walking diatance to most attractions and it's easy to find your way back since it's next to Macys. 
The rooms are good, bathroom kinda small especially when you have a wheelchair (however we hadn't booked a room for wheelchair since our friend can take a few steps.). 
Breakfast is ok. Most of the staff is great and very helpfull. 
We stayed on 12th floor with a great view over Empire State Building. 
Highly recommended!

title: Buen lugar para descansar de largas caminatas en nueva York
text: Estuve una semana en mayo 2017 y la verdad ninguna pega muy bien ubicado muy limpio los empleados muy majos el desayuno pese a no haber mucha variedad estaba todo muy bueno y si quieres ir a pasar unos días a nueva York lo recomiendo 100%

title: Great Location
text: I've stayed at this hotel many times.  It's close to so many things in the garment district. The breakfast is a nice way to start the day.  The rooms are small like most NY hotels but the space is well used. The beds are very comfortable too.

title: Very good stay.
text: Three adults stayed a room with two double beds. There was sufficient room for our things. Location was good for our activities, services were great. Enjoyable buffet breakfast included in the morning; beverages available 24/7. About a 15 minute walk from Times Square.

title: estadia
text: exelente ubicación y servicio  muy bueno el desayuno y el personal  muy limpio   y muy buena la ubicación   ya habíamos estado anteriormente    personal muy bien predispuesto   exelente el personal del front desk

title: GREAT Hotel!!!!
text:
This particular Hampton inn was a perfect stay in NYC. My boyfriend and I were there for 5 days. The location was the best. Walk right out and you're in Herald Square close to a lot of shopping. Literally, just Steps from the hotel is a subway station with most if not all trains. I used an app called Embark that tells you which train to take to get to your destination.

The hotel was extremely hospitable. Our room was impeccably clean and comfortable with more than enough floor space for our 2 suitcases and carry-ons, and shopping bags!

The employees at the front desk were always helpful and friendly. We mostly interracted with Emmanuel, Amanda and Hector who were all so nice, friendly and always ready to give recommendations or any advice you may need. 

Breakfast was so yummy every morning. Your basic continental breakfast: cereals, waffles, muffins, bagels, breads, outmeal, sausages, eggs, coffee, juice, etc etc. They switched it up day to day so you don't get bored but we never did. It was always yummy and the kitchen staff were always nice and ready to greet you.

This hotel is the perfect stay for NYC. We walked a lot and everything is within reach. Definite stay!!

title: Slow Elevators, small rooms
text: Great location, literally down the street from Macy's and a subway stop. 5 minute walk to the Empire State building. Not much street noise on the 18th floor, usual idiots slamming doors at 1am but not the hotel's fault. Smallest rooms we've stayed in NYC, the bed takes up 3/4 of the space, 1807 looked at the building next door no view. Watch out for rooms ending in 06, vending machine right next to the door. Clean, nice flat screen TV, room safe in the closet. Breakfast was ok, egg dishes varied each day, western one day, scrambled the next. Only complain as other reviewers have mentioned the SLOW ELEVATORS. There are only 2, did I say SLOW elevators for 20 floors. At peak times you can wait 5-10 minutes then if you are unfortunate enough to be on a lower floor you can't get on because its full. One reviewer suggested staying on the 3rd floor and using the stairs. If you are into Korean food there are a couple of restaurants next door and a Vietnamese one. We went to the Playwright Irish pub twice over 4 days, a 5 minute walk down the road on 35th. A bit of a walk to Broadway shows and Times Square, ie 42nd to 50th st, 20 minutes or so. If the weather is nice be prepared for huge crowds in Times Square.

title: Short trip
text: A very outstanding hotel and chain. Friendly staff who knows the area.  Very helpful and provided wonderful service. A great place to stay for business or just visiting for a long or short trip.  Near everything NYC has to offer.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Definitely recommend this hotel.  The location is perfect, so close to the subway.  The staff consistently goes over and above to give you the best possible experience in New York City. Look forward to returning to this hotel.

title: Usual trip to us
text:
We always stay in this hotel & we have decided long time back to always stay here. It has the best location for almost everything. Shopping, wasting, transport etc, etc. It is just few blocks away from the Rahman Mosque on the 29 th street. This is the best thing for us. There is an Indian restaurant over the mosque which makes it just too easy. It is closed to the Penn station so we can travel any where we want. Very close to the Times Square. Macy's JCPenny Zara Levi's H&M you name it & you have that close to the hotel. 

The best is the staff. Very helpful & cooperative. Complimentary breakfast. It is so difficult to get hot tea but here we never had any problem to get Hot milk as many times as we want. Just fabulous.

title: Overnight business trip made easy
text: The hotel desk service staff were outstanding. As a Hilton Honors Silver member they have you covered. Free bottled water given, without asking. This property has the "digital key" feature, so you don't need a card. Real slick. The morning breakfast was complete and wholesome. Staff made sure that all items were replenished quickly. Parking was also just around the corner on 36th Street. I presented the desk staff with the parking ticket and received a voucher to present to the parking valet. Payment was then made to the bill. Clean, comfortable and quite place right in the middle of Manhattan. I highly recommend this venue for anyone.

title: Excelente Ubicacion y un personal muy atento
text: El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación en Midtown Manhattan el personal es muy atento y servicial y muy bien entrenado la habitación aunque pequeña muy comoda y muy limpia Muy cerca estacion de Subway y la zona a unos pasos de Macy´s con muchos establecimientos comerciales a su alrededor

title: 2 Hiltons side by side here
text: It is easy to walk into the Hampton Inn or Garden Inn next door,they look alike. But Hampton is 20 stories versus 31 .Hampton rooms have coffee maker, no frig or microwave in basic room.No bar in the lobby.

title: Excellent location and great value!
text: The hotel was clean and the location was so convienant!  Close to subway and near restaurants!  The price was perfect for the city location!  Excellent staff and very helpful!  Kudos to Amanda for our check in and I couldn't believe how helpful everyone was!  Safe environment as well!

title: My wife and I were in Times Sq NYC
text: 14th Floor room , it was not a big room , but just adequate for a night stay with a tv, coffee maker and a clean bathroom. location of the hotel was superb, it allowed me one hour morning walk on 5th Avenue.

title: Home Away From Home
text: I stayed at this hotel several times over a 4 month period for training. During my first visit, I had to make sure it was okay before I locked in my stay here for my remaining trips. Every single  front desk representative was an absolute delight. I was always so warmly welcomed and promptly accommodated for all my needs. Thank you Ashley,  Amanda,  Hector and everyone else for taking such good care of me! Antonia was a jewel and a delight each morning during breakfast. When I didn't have time to each breakfast, she would give me a granola bar to go.  The fitness center worked well for my needs and my room was always clean and equipped with a really comfortable bed and pillows. It is in a great location.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great experience
text: The hotel was in a great location close to Penn Station and the subways. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. There were plenty of choices for breakfast. The desk staff could not have been more helpful. Hector helped us figure out subway routes that would best suit our destinations. He provided maps and information that made getting around easier and more enjoyable

title: NYC experience
text: Family vacation in NYC for long weekend. Hotel was in a convenient location. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Typical Hampton Inn with free hot breakfast. Bathroom a little on the small side, but all else was fine. Would recommend if you are looking to stay within walking distance from Empire State Building. Took about an hour to get to hotel from Laguardia during Thursday pm rush hour via taxi. About 30 minutes getting back on a Sunday morning. Quicker than expected.

title: El hotel justo, el lugar justo.
text: Conozcas o no New York, debes saber la importancia de una buena ubicación, de tener un subte cerca, o de ir al teatro y volver caminando unas pocas cuadras. Tal es el caso del Hampton Inn ubicado en la 35 St. entre 5 y 6 Av. que se encuentra en un lugar preferencial. A media cuadra de Macy´s y a 3 cuadras de Penn Station. Pero a 30 metros además, tenés la boca del subte que te permite moverte por todo Manhattan libremente. Pasan las líneas naranja BDFM y el amarilla RNQW que van hacia el downtown (sur) te llevan a Williamsbrug, a Conney Island y uptown (norte) que te llevan al Museo de historia y Cs. Naturales, al edificio Dakota, a Strawberry Fiels, bordeando el Central Park, y también te permite ir al South Ferry y tomar el ferry hacia Staten Island. Pasando al hotel, la atención es muy buena, las habitaciones están bien, podes contratar una que dé a la calle desde donde se ve el Empire State, el desayuno es abundante con frutas, yogur, wafles, cereales café, infusiones, y huevos revueltos. Los baños están muy bien equipados (en la habitación que ocupé NO había bidet) con pequeños amenities de shampoo, acondicionador, jabón, toallones que cambian a diario. Por ahí lo único que le faltaría sería una heladera pequeña. En recepción está María que es muy gentil y en el lounge hay un mostrador de Conserjería donde se ocupan de las necesidad de entradas a teatros, traslados, etc.  Hablan todos en castellano e ingles. Hay caja de seguridad en cada habitación. MUY recomendado, y sin ser de lujo, tiene todo lo que hace falta, hasta gimnasio en el subsuelo.

title: Superb Location in Heart of New York City
text: This hotel welcomes travelers with budget. Because of location, you can grasp the city well. Good early morning breakfast is a fantastic bonus. And with a few steps, you are at 5th Avenue, or Broadway or at Port Authority Terminal or Penn Station.

title: Poor customer service
text: Check in was an issue. Only one wash cloth was left in the room both days. Front desk would not give extra and never delivered to room as promised. Housekeeping uses guest elevators instead of service elevators for long periods of time and makes it difficult to get in and out of rooms. Housekeeping carts block vending machines for overnight storage.

title: Excelente ubicación, desayuno perfecto para arrancar el día.
text: El personal de Recepcion es genial te hacen sentir muy cómodo y seguro aunque no estés en tu país.Aaron es un colaborador que Está por las noches y nos ayudo en todo momento felicidades por tener personas como el como los q sirven el desayuno y María q también está en recepción simplemente genial y por cierto, la terminal del metro está en la esquina así q eso es genial.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Hampton Inn always makes it just perfect.  I won't go to any other hotel chain.  I love the sincerity of this particular place.  Very clean and comfortable.  Quiet.  The staff was so nice.  We will not look anywhere else.  Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: This hotel has a great location at 35th and 6th. Right by Macy's and walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, Grand Central Station and Broadway. The hotel itself seems new and modern. While most hotel rooms in this part of town are quite small, our room here was a reasonable size for the area, with a king bed and a roomy bathroom. Plus, we had decent feather pillows, a real treat. The free breakfast buffet was a little better than is typical for a Hampton Inn. And coffee and tea are available all day and evening. This hotel is a good value and I will happily stay here again.

title: Thoroughly Recommend
text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, bed and breakfast which is a bonus in New York. Good location. Very comfortable clean rooms, plenty of choice for breakfast. A gym, if you've got any energy left, we didn't. A coffee machine in the room which I was able to use with my PG Tips that I took! A must after a busy day sightseeing. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Hotel Top & Personnzl Exceptionnel
text:
Bonjour,
L'hotel est top. Le personnel est aux petits soins.
L'accueil reserve par Emanuel est super, tres gentil et serviable.
Merci beaucoup a Antonia pour son accueil chaleureux et son petit dejeuner delicieux.
Bravo a toute l'equipe. Je reviendrai sans hesiter.

title: Decent stay
text:
Rooms are small, typical for NYC but the hotel is in a great location, around the corner from the Empire State building and Harold Square. 

Aaron at the front desk was very helpful as I checked in and Antonia made sure I enjoyed their continental breakfast. In general, the staff is great, very friendly, and very helpful.

title: Ótima Localização
text:
Localizado em MidTown, próximo do Madison Square Garden e Penn Station. Times Square a pouco mais de 10 minutos de caminhada.
Acesso ao Metrô a menos de 30 metros da entrada do hotel.
Café da manhã básico, mas bom. O salão não é muito grande e fica cheio até pelo menos às 09:30H.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Hôtel propre, sans surprises. Personnel très courtois et serviable. Les chambres sont assez petites, mais correctes, considérant que nous sommes à Mid-town New York. Ventilation bruyante (air climatisé) typique des hôtels de cette génération.  Petit déjeuner copieux et efficace, comme il se doit dans les Hampton Inns. Oui, on entend le bruit de la rue, le traffic, les sirènes des véhicules d'urgence, etc. mais, disons-le encore, c'est New York. L'hôtel a une entente avec un parking sur la rue voisine, pas besoin de réservations; on y apporte sa voiture soi-même. L'internet gratuit est plutôt lent et intermittent.
L'emplacement de l'hôtel est idéal pour visiter New York, à 10 minutes à pied de Times Square. L'entrée du métro Herald Square est à 50 mètres.

title: Soggiorno in centro a New York
text:
In posizione perfetta e compreso di colazione a buffet molto fornita .
Caffè , acqua e tisane gratuite tutto il giorno 
Ottimo  per appoggio alla visita della città 
Offre  la stanza con tavoli della colazione anche per appoggio per cenare con pizza d' asporto o altro ....
Consiglio

title: hôtel au top!!!
text:
Chambre pour 4 personnes confortable et très propre avec une vue directe sur l'Empire State Building; hôtel idéalement situé : au pied d'une station de métro, proche de Times Square, de la 5ème avenue...Petit déjeuner copieux et varié (fruits frais, mets salés et sucrés) servi par une super équipe (merci à Luis, Antonia et Lisa). Possibilité d'avoir gratuitement 24h/24h des boissons chaudes, de l'eau et du thé glacédans une salle laissée à notre disposition. Excellent accueil aussi à la réception et là encore l'ensemble de l'équipe est toujours disponible : merci à Hector, Aaron et les autres pour leur gentillesse et professionnalisme. En résumé, si nous avons la chance de retourner à New york nous reviendrons sans hésiter dans cet hôtel!!  
Virginie, Eric, Manon et Maelle.

title: Boa opção
text: Staff extremamente cordial e atencioso, sempre prestativo. Ótima localização entre 5ª e 6ª avenidas, há 50 metros de uma estação de metrô , há 150 metros do Empire State, 1 km da Times Square e da Grand Estação Central. Estrutura simples e sem luxo, ideal para quem viajar a NY com a intenção de passar o dia explorando a cidade e usar o hotel para pernoite e café da manhã.

title: A little dirty and sticky floors
text: I have been to New York a few times and I usually stay in Hilton brands.  Had a meeting close to the Empire State Building.  Not a great hotel.  Kind of dirty and the floors are sticky.  Kind of crazy to have sticky floors....you think it would be cleaned up but the floors stayed sticky.  Gross really.  Tons of choices in New York....I do not recommend this place.

title: new york trip
text: i am currently staying here and it is great! the location between 5th ave and 6th ave is very convenient. a subway station less than a minute away and you can easily walk to time square and other places. the room is small but clean and up to date. the staff has been very nice and friendly. they have continental breakfast!

title: Awful, dirty & not secure!
text:
We stayed here for one night when our flight was cancelled.  We had stayed in a sister hotel (Hilton garden Inn) next door for a week prior to this, but there were no rooms availability for an 8th night, so we moved here instead.   The welcome at Reception was fine.  The Room decor was nice.  But it didn't feel clean.  The bathroom floor had dirty marks on it, the shelves & tissue box were dusty & there were also hairs (from the last guests?) on the shelves.  We were tired after the cancelled flight & hadn't the energy to complain.  I washed my hair & plugged in my brand new hair dryer, there was a buzzing sound - like electricity - I plugged it out & looked at the socket - it was filthy!   This may have been the cause of the buzzing, I tried another socket but my new dryer no longer worked.   I called down to reception to inform them.  They (in fairness) were quick to send a technician who told me only to use the socket in the bathroom & he got my dryer working again, he was a nice man.  Later that night my husband and I got into the lift from the lobby to our room & a guy joined us in the lift, we immediately felt unsafe.  He didn't press a button, but got out on our floor and walked behind us, my husband turned to face him & he changed direction & got back into the lift.  Unlike the hilton garden inn, there is no room card needed to operate the lifts, so it's less secure in this hotel and this experience made us aware of that! 
The next morning we went for the breakfast I had read so much about.  The atmosphere & quality of food was like a soup kitchen.  Paper plates, dried up bread & a disgusting thing described as an omelet - see pics - simply revolting.  The orange juice was not even from concentrate, it was a juice drink, full of sugar.   I asked the staff member servicing the restaurant a question and she was very unfriendly & completely disinterested.   I remember reading a number of reviews complementing the restaurant staff & they were all very positive, but I also remember noting, that the ones that did, were mostly completed by 'new reviewers' with just 1-2 reviews to their name/profile, which is often a sign that they are not authentic and by the staff members themselves.  Of course I can't be sure of this, but it makes sense, from my experience.  The fruit was the only eatable item - so that what the extent of my breakfast.  So overall, I will never stay here again & would not recommend it to anyone.  The worst hotel ive ever stayed in in New York.  Yes the location is fantastic but there are a number of hotels on that street with the same location - stay there instead, the Hilton Garden Inn was much nicer!   (See photo evidence to support my review).

title: Great location... average Hampton.
text: 8 rooms per floor with 20 floors.  There isn't really any great views as you are surrounded by other tall buildings.  The rooms are large enough for a NYC hotel.  My furniture was leaning to the right as it was particle board furniture that was damaged.  Location is fantastic though as it is right next to Broadway.  Few blocks to Time Square and other tourist attractions.  Biggest complaint would be the elevators as they are super slow to pick you up from any floor.  Biggest compliment is location.

title: Excelente localização!
text:
Gostei muito de minha hospedagem neste hotel.
O atendimento foi cordial e amável, o hotel ofereceu café da manhã e internet de boa qualidade incluso na diaria.O hotel está muito bem localizado e é possível ir a quase tudo a pé. Muito bom.

title: Hotel muy centrico
text: Hotel muy recomendable.Muy céntrico , al lado del empire state y con una parada de metro en la misma calle.El desayuno está incluido y aunque no hay mucha variedad está muy bien y durante todo el día hay café para los clientes. El trato del personal inmejorable sobre todo Héctor de recepción. La habitación fue una cuádruple y para ser Nueva York no era nada pequeña. Hay wifi en todo el hotel y funciona muy bien.  Si volvería repetiría.

title: Great location and great value!
text: We booked this hotel for a long weekend as we had tickets for Madison Square Gardens basketball. I have to say it is in a great location with the Empire State building close by and just a short walk up to Times Square with all the restaurants and attractions there. The staff on reception were really friendly and the concierge was helpful explaining what was nearby. Breakfast was included in the price and the kitchen staff were quick to restock when busy, all the food was fresh. I just loved the free tea and coffee on tap all day!. The tube station is really close too so not far to take your luggage there. If you are thinking about a stay in New York seriously think about staying here - it really is a great value hotel.

title: Ubicación excelente. Trato exquisito.
text: Acabamos de llegar de este hotel. La experiencia ha sido formidable. El primer día nos cambiaron la habitación que se nos había asignado por defecto a una con mejores vistas. Estuvieron contínuamente ayudándonos a movernos por la ciudad y sugiriendo sitios por conocer cada vez que preguntábamos. Mención especial a Hector, fue todo un profesional del primer al último día.

title: 2nd visit to new york
text: love new york and this hotel was bang in the middle of everything me my husband and 14 year old daughtrer wanted to do and see.lovely and clean comfy beds.room was big enough for us 3,breakfast excellent for free coffee all day if you want to pop back or last thing at night.staff lovely the guy who was on the reception at night had a chat with my husband about english football he had even heard of sheffield united which thrilled my husband.would stay here again and recomend this hotel.

title: Great Staff & Location
text: This location was perfect for any event at Madison Square Garden - which was why we were there.  Parking garage was close and easy - albeit we were not aware of the upcharge for an SUV turning a $47 nightly fee into $60.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Subway station literally a stone's throw away as was Herald Square, Macy's etc...  Room was a little small but very clean.  Overall, a great stay.

title: Excelente lugar para alojarse, atención de 10
text:
Estuvimos 13 noches con mi esposa y mi hijo, nos atendieron re bien todo el tiempo, desde la previa y durante ni hablar..
Luis y Antonia dos genios en el desayuno, Hector y Daymar en recepción también, todos en realidad, no recuerdo todos los nombres, pero se ocuparon de todo y siempre con muy buen ánimo. Jugaron con mi hijo Simón a diario, con mucho amor....
El desayuno muy bueno, el sector de té  café todo el día disponible y bien equipado. Ubicación excelente para todo tipo de paseo o compras...
Gracias a todos por estas 2 semanas que convivimos.... Saludos, Simón, Daniela y Ariel

title: Small rooms but good free breakfast
text: It was good for us as being first time visitors to New York.   It was walking distance to Times Square and lots of restaurants.  It was very small but we didnt spend much time there.  The free breakfast was awesome though.

title: Ok spot in Midtown
text: Stayed here for a second time, mainly due to price and the chance to earn more HHonors points.  The hotel is tight in a great location. We were up on the 19th floor which was a bit of a pain given the elevator situation. Overall, I do recommend it for the price and location.

title: Overnight in NYC
text: Excellent location in New York, only a few blocks from Penn Station and right next to the Herald Square subway stop. The hotel staff was very friendly and allowed us to store our luggage they day we arrived and the day we left. Hotel was clean and very updated. The breakfast was plentiful, 9:00 was very crowded, but by 9:30 it had cleared out. Love the location and staff, we will definitely stay here when we come back to NYC.

title: Avoid lifts and breakfast at peak times and you cannot go wrong with this Hampton.
text: Get to breakfast early to avoid the stampede. Also pick your moment for the lift as wait times can be lengthy. If possible specify floor 2 so you can take the stairs. Great location for walking to most sights, also subway 50 yards away which is a bonus. Handy limo service booked by hotel for jfk transfer, reasonable cost.

title: Perfect Hampton Inn Manhattan Stay
text: Perfect Manhattan stay if you're looking for a reasonably priced, Hampton Inn stay.  Location is excellent.  Steps from the 34th St/Herald Square subway station.  Can be hectic at the breakfast station as several larger tour groups were based from this hotel during our stay.  Our floor was quiet, but didn't have those groups on it.  Heard that it was noisy in floors with tour groups. Will absolutely stay here again.  Super, super location.  Blocks from Times Square, one block from Herald Square.  Blocks from Broadway.  Loved it!

title: Best experience!
text: The attention of the staff, the complimentary breakfast and the rooms are absolutely great. Definitely it was an amazing experience. We had a breathtaking view to the Empire State Building that absolutely add value to our stay.

title: Central for everything
text:
We stayed for a week here at the end of march. My partner and I and a friend. 
I loved it!
The staff are friendly, especially hector who gave us a couple of recommendations for food. They even managed to put my friend in the room next to ours even though he booked separately and arrived later. Some airlines can't even do that! 
The breakfast buffet rotated the hot food which was great so you didn't get the same hot food every day. The fact it's included in the room rate too makes it a great deal! 
The only issue I think for us some nights was street noise because we were on the 2nd floor. Not a hotel problem just a general issue I guess being right in the centre of New York. 
We scored a diamond tho as we got a huge room with two beds in it, which we didn't really need but good for space. 
Didn't use the gym facilities but they looked great and Hotel was always clean and tidy.
Housekeeping were great and prompt with towels.
Overall I couldn't score down anywhere with the hotel we were happy with what we got
Thanks guys!

title: Great stay position and fab staff
text: I didn't expect the level of service we received. The staff were a credit to New York compared to other areas they could take a leaf out of the Hampton staff book. We would 100% return to this hotel when in New York. What a view of the Empire State Building

title: Excelente opción en NYC
text: Excelente ubicación. Muy bien las habitaciones. Excelente el espacio para bebidas y comer, aunque queda chico a la hora del desayuno. Muy bien todos los chicos de la recepción y Excelentes Luis y Antonia, muy correctos, atentos y te hacen sentir muy cómodos.

title: Enjoyable stay
text:
I would stay at this hotel again, the staff are very friendly and helpful ( my son's TSA lock am med on his suitcase and the gentleman on the front desk arranged for a maintenance man to come and cut the lock he was there within 5 mins), you had plenty of choice for breakfast from waffles, cereals, toast,  bagles, muffins, yogurts, etc and cooked breakfast. The room was adequate enough and we where very pleased with it we had a very large double bed which was really 
comfortable, some people may think the rooms are small but  you're  in New York and you won't be in your room for long. There is a subway station only a minute walk away that takes you into Times Square or another about 5 mins away that takes you to the South Ferry terminal for the helicopter port or world trade centre etc. You can walk into Times Square it takes about 10-15 mins the Empire State building is just up the road and turn right about 5 mins away. All in all we had an enjoyable stay

title: Férias perfeitas! AMEI!
text: Essa foi minha segunda vez no hotel da rede Hampton Inn em NY. O hotel é super bem localizado, café da manhã básico mais bom. Recepção 24h, hotel limpo e cheiroso!! Amei os funcionários do hotel, todos muitos atenciosos e simpáticos (Atenção especial para o Rapaz Mexicano da recepção e Antonia do Café da Manhã, pessoas maravilhosas). Fiquei 16 dias incríveis em ny e o hotel me acomodou muito bem e me acolheu. Eu voltaria mil vez para esse hotel e já estou planejando meu retorno.

title: Great location, better than satisfactory stay
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn for a fortnight over the Christmas period. It was not without it's faults but the overall stay was good within the limitations of the hotel. First of all, the location is wonderful and makes up for a great deal. We came in (and departed) from JFK via the Airtrain and the Long Island Rail Road so we needed to have a hotel near to Penn Station. The Hampton Inn was ideal in this respect as well as having a subway entrance within steps of the entrance.
Other advantages of the location were that we were across the road form Macy's and 34th St Shopping as well as being a short walk form 5th Ave. In terms of proximity to the sites you can't do much better. In fact, we could see the Empire State Building from our window.
Breakfast is another highlight and the staff on breakfast (along with those on the front desk) are very friendly and accommodating. There is some variety with breakfast but after 14 days we'd had enough! Even so, it was a great way to begin the day.
the room itself was nothing to write home about. The heating and cooling system was a bit on the primitive side. Twice our toilet blocked but, to be fair, maintenance staff arrived within minutes of the blockage being reported.
Room service otherwise was a mixed bag. We were only given the right number of towels once in our stay but a phone call to the front desk fixed the problem. If things like this stress you out my advice is not to stay but if you can roll with the punches and want to stay in the heart of NYC you could do a lot worse at more expensive prices. Nor should you underestimate the value of breakfast included as eating out is not cheap.

title: SERVICE
text:
Antonia the lady that serve breakfast is very friendly and always smiling.  She has good customer service skills.  The service department should be lucky to have her.  
I come to NYC 4 time a year and will be looking to book my next room at this hotel which is located on 59 west 35 street New York, NY.

title: Congratulations
text: I have been served by the most friendly and communiicative person at the breakfast area in the hotel, Antonia is a great asset and has a fantastic personality. TWO THUMBS UP for her. Bendiciones Antonia.

title: recommend to friends and family
text: the experience that we had was exceptional - they made us feel like family - making reservation - giving us direction - and just in general making sure our experience was a wonderful one and im sure it has to do with the Hampton by Hilton

title: Outstanding place !!
text:
No se puede describir con palabras ....Hay que vivirlo 
La vista de la ciudad de New York de noche es maravillosa ....Más que recomendable y de tardecita / noche para ver toda la ciudad iluminada, los carteles, además del edificio, sus paredes de mármol.Yo volvería una y otra vez...

title: Cómoda estadía (GRAN ubicación)
text:
El hotel es muy confortable, especialmente por la atención de quienes lo atienden. La mayor parte del personal habla español, lo cual es muy útil para quienes no dominan el ingles. Lo mejor del hotel es su ubicación, ya que se encuentra en la esquina de Macy's y Victoria's Secret (y algunas habitaciones cuentan con vista al Empire); está cerca del hotel de donde salen combis para realizar distintas excursiones y en la esquina pasa el metro.
El desayuno es poco surtido, aunque uno encuentra básicamente lo que espera: cereales, lácteos y salchichas.
Increíblemente cómodo para ir y venir todo el día. Además, hay servicio de cafe/te/chocolate las 24 hs. Y se compran entradas para Broadway ahí mismo (aunque el costo es más elevado que en la boletería).
Volvería porque su ubicación (insisto) es excelente.

title: Amazing service!!
text: Very accommodating, as soon as we arrived we asked if there was a small refrigerator in the room.  There wasn't one but within minutes they brought one up! They made reservations for us, printed maps for our sight seeing plans. The recommended great restaurants! Places to see!  The breakfast was amazing! Always service with a smile!!! Made this once in a lifetime trip for us four sisters a very memorable one! Would definitely go again and highly recommend!!
